Manifestations from above develop quickly, while those from below develop slowly. When affected by the six bowels, treatment is easier; when affected by the five organs, recovery is difficult.

Moreover, conditions near the bones are often cold, while those near the skin are often hot. If it lingers near the bones, it may transform into blood worms; if near the skin, it may lead to leaks of energy. When worms develop, there is often more itching and less pain, sometimes itching first and pain later; with leaks, there is often more pain and less itching, or neither pain nor itching. In cases where there is internal deficiency and external surplus, there tends to be more pain and less itching; if bleeding does not stop, there is a higher chance of death, while suppuration often leads to recovery.

Occasionally, there is boundless vomiting or reversal, and meals may be taken at irregular times; these are all effects of sores and ulcers, with varied symptoms. Careful treatment is essential.

[Note: The emergence of worms in sores and ulcers is attributed to wind-heat from the liver, while leaks stem from weakened vital energy; bleeding is associated with spleen deficiency accompanied by heat, and suppuration indicates robust vital energy. Conditions like vomiting and reversal are caused by deficiencies in the spleen and stomach, and one should focus on tonifying the vital energy to ensure safety.][151p]

　　　　　论原有五第二十二

　　一天行，二瘦弱气滞，三怒气，四肾气虚，五饮冷酒，食炙煿，服丹药。　　【注　按前证所因虽殊，其治法亦当别经络、阴阳、虚实、表里肿溃，以助胃壮气为主，使根本坚固，庶保无虞。】
　　　　　分表里第二十三

　　伍氏曰：痈疽皆因喜怒不测，饮食不节，阴阳不调，脏腑不和，腠理不密，寒气客于经络，或荣血受寒，则濇而不行，卫气从之。与寒相搏，壅遏不通，或阳气蕴积则生寒热，寒热不散，皆致前证。又曰：五脏六腑俞穴皆在背。凡患疮证易伤脏膜，多致不救。腑气浮行于表，故痈肿浮高为易治；脏血沉寒主里，故疽肿内陷为难治。又曰疖者节也，痈者壅也，疽者沮也。一寸至二寸为疖，三寸至五寸为痈，五寸至一尺为疽，一尺至二尺为竟体疽。若脉洪数者难治，脉微濇者易治。[152p]

On the Original Causes

There are five causes: First, the body is weak and energy is stagnated; second, there is excess anger; third, kidney energy is deficient; fourth, consuming cold beverages and excessive hot food; fifth, taking medicinal pills. (Note: Although the causes of preceding symptoms may differ, the treatment should also consider the respective meridians, yin and yang, deficiency and excess, and the exterior and interior swellings, primarily strengthening the stomach and enhancing energy, thereby solidifying the foundation to ensure safety.)

On Distinguishing Between Exterior and Interior

The Wu clan states: Boils and sores arise from unpredictable emotions, irregular diet, imbalance of yin and yang, disharmony of organs, loose pores, and cold air invading the meridians. If the blood and energy are chilled, they may stagnate and not flow, leading to exterior pathogens. When confronted with cold, it obstructs and prevents flow; if yang energy accumulates, it can lead to alternating cold and heat, which will not disperse, resulting in previous symptoms. Furthermore, all the points of the five organs and six bowels are located on the back. In general, wounds are prone to injure the membranes of the organs, often leading to failure in treatment. The bowels' energy flows near the surface, hence exterior boils are easier to treat; while the blood of the organs is cold and resides deep, making internal sores more difficult to treat. It is also mentioned that a festering boil is a "jie" (section), an abscess is a "yong" (obstruction), and a sore is a "ju" (depression). A size of one to two inches is a boil, three to five inches is an abscess, five inches to one foot is a sore, and one to two feet is a severe sore. If the pulse is rapid and surging, treatment is difficult; if the pulse is weak and stagnant, treatment is easier.[152p]

初觉宜清热拔毒，已溃则排脓止痛，脓尽则长肌敷痂。当酌量轻重，形证顺逆而审治之。　　【注　按前证若饮食少思，用六君子汤以补脾胃；如不应，加姜桂以温补之，使邪气自退。其不起者，由邪气盛，正气虚不能发也，于旬日之外见之。若已发出，用托里消毒散以壮元气，助令溃腐；不应，须温补脾胃。其不起者，由真气虚，不能溃也，于二旬之外见之。若已腐溃，用托里散以补气血生肌肉；不应，当专补脾胃；又不应，须温补脾胃。其不起者，乃脾气虚不能收敛也，于一月之外而见之。凡此治法，窃常用验，详具首论。】[153p]

Initially, one should clear heat and expel toxins. Once an abscess has formed, focus on draining pus and relieving pain; when the pus is fully expelled, promote tissue regeneration and scabbing. The approach should be adapted based on the severity of the condition and the clinical signs.

(Note: If there is a lack of appetite due to anxiety, use the Six Gentlemen Decoction to nourish the spleen and stomach; if there is no response, add ginger and cinnamon for warmth and support, aiding in the withdrawal of pathogenic influences. If no improvement is seen, it indicates that the pathogenic influence is strong and the vital energy is deficient, preventing resolution, which can take about ten days. If it has already manifested, use the Decoction to Promote Recovery and Detoxify to enhance vital energy and assist in the drainage of pus; if there is no response, warmth and nourishment of the spleen and stomach is necessary. If there is still no response, the cause may be a deficiency in true energy, which prevents the formation of pus, and this can appear beyond twenty days. If suppuration has occurred, use the Decoction to Promote Recovery to nourish qi and blood, and generate muscle; if there is still no response, focus on nurturing the spleen and stomach; if there is still no response, warmth and nourishment of the spleen and stomach is necessary. If there is no improvement, this indicates that the spleen qi is insufficient to consolidate, which can appear beyond one month. This treatment method, I have often verified, is elaborated in the initial discourse.)[153p]

　　　　　别内外第二十四

　　李氏云：疽初发一粒如麻豆，发热肿高，热痛色赤，此为外发。势虽炽盛，治得其法，可保其生。若初时不发热，体倦怠，患处如故，数日不肿痛，内脏已坏，虽有卢扁之药，亦未如之何矣。　　【注　按前证有因元气虚而不能发出者，有因敷贴寒药而不能发出者，有因攻伐过伤气血而不能发出者。凡有因热毒内蕴而失疏托者，审而治之，多有生者。】[154p]

On External and Internal Conditions, Section 24

Li stated: When a boil first appears as a small lump like a soybean, accompanied by heat, swelling, and redness, this indicates an external manifestation. Although the condition may be intense, proper treatment can preserve life. However, if initially there is no heat, the body feels fatigued, the affected area remains unchanged, and after several days there is no swelling or pain, the internal organs may be damaged. In such cases, even effective remedies like those from Lu or Bian may have no effect.

Note: There are instances where conditions arise from deficiency of vital energy preventing proper expression, from the application of cold medicines inhibiting expression, or from overexertion damaging qi and blood hindering expression. Generally, conditions stemming from internal heat toxins that lose their ability to be released can be examined and treated, with many surviving.[154p]

　　　　　阴阳浅深缓急治法第二十五

　　曾氏云：凡痈疽，其脉浮数洪紧，肿焮作痛，身热烦渴，饮食如常，此六腑不和，毒发于外而为痈。其势虽急，投以凉剂，多保生全。其脉沉细伏紧，初发甚微，或无疮头，身不热而内躁，体重烦疼，情绪不乐，胸膈痞闷，饮食无味，此五脏不和毒畜于内而为疽，急投五香连翘汤，甚者转毒散、神仙截法、黄矾丸、国老膏，防托毒气，免致变证内攻。尤宜当头隔蒜灸。若涂毒药，迷其腠理；投诸凉药，虚其真气。故其善恶之证，在乎医之工拙耳。或噫气，痞塞，咳逆，身冷自汗，目瞪耳聋，恍惚惊悸，语言颠倒，皆恶证也。五善见三则瘥，七恶见四则危。五善并至，则善无以加；七恶并臻，则恶之剧矣。　　【注　按前证善者，乃五脏未伤，病微邪浅，使能慎起居，节饮食，勿药自愈。恶者乃五脏亏损之证，前哲虽云不治，若能补其脾胃，固其根本，多有可生者，岂可以其恶而遂弃之耶？】[155p]

The Treatment Methods of Yin and Yang - Chapter 25

Zeng said: In cases of boils and sores, the pulse is floating, rapid, surging, and tight; there is swelling, pain, body heat, and thirst. Eating and drinking remain normal. This indicates disharmony in the six fu organs, with toxins manifesting externally as boils. Although the situation is urgent, administering cooling remedies often preserves life. If the pulse is deep, thin, suppressed, and tight; the onset is very mild, sometimes without visible sores; the body does not heat up, but there is internal restlessness, a heavy and painful body, a lack of joy, chest tightness, and lack of taste in food; this indicates disharmony in the five zang organs, with toxins accumulating internally, leading to sores. In this case, quickly administer the Five Spice and Forsythia Decoction; in more severe cases, use detoxifying dispersals, celestial spirit intercepting method, yellow alum pills, or national elder ointment to prevent the emission of toxic qi and avoid transformation into more serious internal attacks. It is particularly advisable to perform garlic moxibustion at the crown of the head. If toxic medicaments are applied, they may obstruct the pores; if cooling medicines are administered, they may deplete the true qi. Therefore, the quality of the symptoms—good or bad—depends on the skill of the physician. Manifestations such as sighing, blockage, reverse cough, cold body with spontaneous sweating, wide-eyed and deaf, confusion and shock, disjointed speech, are all adverse symptoms. If five good signs are evident, recovery is likely; if seven bad signs are present, danger is imminent. When five good signs are simultaneously present, there is nothing more to add to the goodness; when seven bad signs all converge, then the severity of the bad condition is grave.

[Note: The good signs mentioned earlier imply that the five organs have not been harmed, the illness is mild and the invasion shallow, allowing for careful conduct of daily life and moderation in food intake to achieve self-healing without medicine. The bad symptoms indicate damage to the five organs; although ancient scholars said not to treat them, if one can strengthen the spleen and stomach, reinforcing the foundation, there are many who can survive. How can one abandon them solely because of their bad condition?][155p]

　　　　　善恶第二十六

　　问曰：五善七恶，可得闻乎。曰：饮食如常，一善也；实热而大小便濇，二善也；内外病相应，三善也；肌肉好恶分明，四善也；用药如所料，五善也。渴发而喘，眼角向鼻，大小便反滑，一恶也；气绵绵而脉濡，与病相反，二恶也；目不了了，睛明内陷，三恶也；未溃肉黑而陷，四恶也；已溃青黑，筋腐骨黑，五恶也；发痰，六恶也；呕吐，七恶也。　　【注　按善恶形证，治法见附录。】[156p]

Questions were asked: What are the five goods and seven evils? The answer: Consuming food and drink as usual is one good; experiencing clear bowel movements despite heat is two goods; the internal and external ailments being interconnected is three goods; having distinct muscle tone is four goods; using medicine as prescribed is five goods.

As for evils: Experiencing thirst with wheezing and having bowel movements that are slippery is one evil; having a weak pulse that runs counter to the illness is two evils; having blurred vision with sunken eyes is three evils; having necrotic tissue that is sunken and black is four evils; having necrosis that is blue-black with decaying tendons and bones is five evils; producing phlegm is six evils; vomiting is seven evils.

[Note: The methods for diagnosing goods and evils can be found in the appendix.][156p]

　　　　　生死第二十七

　　问曰：病有甚而至生，有微而至死，病证难辨，生死何从决乎？答曰：发背溃透内膜者死【此言肝俞已上。】 未溃内陷，面青唇黑便污者死 【此言脏坏便瘀血。】 溃喉者不治。阴患入腹者不治。入囊者不治。鬓深数寸者不治。在颐后一寸三分，名锐毒，亦不治。无此者生。流注虽多，疗之必愈。　　 【注　按前证有因元气虚弱而毒气内陷者，有因初作失于内疏托里和荣卫者，有因毒盛失于消解者，有因虚弱失于补托者，有因脓成失于针刺者，有因腐溃失于补养者。[157p]

On Life and Death, Section 27

A question was asked: Some illnesses are severe leading to death, while others are mild leading to death; the symptoms are difficult to discern. How can we determine life and death? The answer is: If the back erupts and penetrates the inner membrane, that is death (this refers to conditions related to the liver). If it has not penetrated and the face is pale and lips black, that indicates death (this means the organs are damaged and there is stagnant blood). If there is a throat ulcer, it is incurable. If there is a hidden ailment in the abdomen, it is incurable. If it enters the sac, it is incurable. If the temples are deeply sunk by several inches, it is also incurable. Located one inch and three-tenths behind the jaw, this condition, called sharp poison, is likewise incurable. If none of these conditions are present, there is hope for life. Even if the flow is excessive, treatment must lead to recovery.

(Note: Previous conditions may arise from the weakness of original energy causing toxic energy to penetrate inward; from an initial condition due to a failure in internal balance of the spleen and defensive qi; from excess toxins resulting from incapacity to properly disperse; from weakness resulting from inadequate supplementation; from the formation of pus due to failure in puncture therapy; from corruption leading to failure in nourishment.)[157p]

若发背脑疽，属湿热上壅者，黄连消毒散、补中益气汤以除湿毒，补脾肺，滋肾水。若鬓疽锐毒属风热者，柴胡山栀散，以清肝火，养肝血。若阴虚，用六味地黄丸以生肾水，滋化源。若患于小腹，补足三阴之血，养脾胃之气，庶可保其生也。其流注之证，或因饮食劳倦，房室阴虚，或七情内动，六淫外侵，以致血虚，互相凝滞，或产后血瘀，随虚流注，或结块，或漫肿，宜用益气养荣汤以固元气，佐以葱熨解散凝滞，更以豆豉饼祛散寒邪。溃久内有瘀肉，用针头散腐之，多有生者。设若不守禁调摄，多致不起，慎之！】[158p]

If there is a backbrain abscess due to damp-heat accumulation, use Huanglian Xiaodu San and Buzhong Yiqi Tang to eliminate dampness and toxins, nourish the spleen and lungs, and enrich kidney water. If there is a sharp toxin in the temples belonging to wind-heat, use Chaihu Shanzhizi San to clear liver fire and nourish liver blood. If there is yin deficiency, take Liuwei Dihuang Wan to generate kidney water and nourish the source of transformation. If the condition is in the lower abdomen, replenish the blood of the three yin to nourish the spleen and stomach qi, which may help preserve life. The symptoms of flowing and dripping may arise from dietary fatigue, sexual depletion of yin, or emotional disturbances and external invasions, leading to blood deficiency and stagnation, or postnatal blood stasis resulting in a continued flow or masses and swelling; for this, use Yiqi Yangrong Tang to stabilize original qi, assist with scallion poultices to disperse stagnation, and apply fermented soybean cakes to dispel cold evil. If there is prolonged suppuration with stagnant flesh inside, use a needle to disperse decay, as many can still recover. However, if one does not adhere to dietary restrictions and management, it may lead to worsening conditions, so be cautious![158p]

　　　　　先明形证逆顺第二十八

　　痈疽溃后，形有逆有顺。白睛黑小，一恶也；不能下食，纳药而呕，食不知味，二恶也；伤痛渴甚，三恶也；体项不便，四肢沉重，四恶也。声嘶色脱，唇鼻青黑，面目浮肿，五恶也；烦躁时嗽，腹痛渴甚，泻利无度，小便如淋，六恶也。脓血大泄，肿痛尤甚，脓色败臭，七恶也；喘粗气短，恍惚嗜卧，八恶也；未溃黑陷，面青唇黑，便污，九恶也；气噎痞塞，咳嗽身冷，自汗无时，目瞪耳聋，恍惚惊悸，语言颠倒，十恶也。又脑为诸阳所会，颈项近咽喉，肾俞，皆致命之所，俱不可灼艾！　　【注　按前证未溃黑陷、面青、唇黯、便污者，脏腑内溃之恶证也。气噫痞塞、咳嗽身冷、自汗者，脾肺虚败之恶证也。不食便泻，肠鸣，耳聋目瞪者，脾肾虚败传变之恶证也。治法详见附录。】　　审内证用药附[159p]

Clarification of Symptoms in Reverse and Forward (28th Section)

After a carbuncle or boil has erupted, the body may exhibit both adverse and favorable signs.

  1. Eye symptoms such as a white sclera with black spots indicate a malady;
  2. Inability to ingest food, vomiting after taking medicine, and food tasting dull are further negative signs;
  3. Severe pain and intense thirst are the third adverse symptoms;
  4. Stiffness in the body and a heavy feeling in the limbs constitute the fourth negative sign;
  5. Hoarseness, pallor, cyanosis in the lips and nose, and facial swelling indicate the fifth evil symptom;
  6. Restlessness, coughing, severe abdominal pain, extreme thirst, uncontrollable diarrhea, and urinary issues are the sixth adverse signs;
  7. Profuse discharge of purulent blood, significant swelling and pain, and foul purulent color represent the seventh negative sign;
  8. Shortness of breath, shallow breathing, confusion, and excessive drowsiness constitute the eighth adverse symptom;
  9. If the wound is black and sunken, with a bluish face, dark lips, and soiled stools, this indicates the ninth negative sign;
  10. Symptoms such as a sensation of obstruction in the chest, cough accompanied by cold body temperature, spontaneous sweating, vacant stare, hearing loss, confusion, heart palpitations, and disordered speech are the tenth adverse sign.

Moreover, the head is associated with various Yang energies, while the neck is close to the throat, and acupuncture points near the kidney area are all critical. None of these areas should be subjected to cautery or moxibustion!

Note: The initial symptoms of black and sunken conditions, bluish pallor, darkened lips, and discolored stools indicate severe internal decay of the organs. Symptoms of obstruction, cough with cold, and spontaneous sweating indicate a deficiency of the spleen and lungs. Inability to eat or diarrhea, bowel noises, and deafness with vacant stares suggest degeneracy between the spleen and kidney. Treatment methods are detailed in the appendix.[159p]

　　自泻呕吐，不进饮食，肾脉最虚，如是之疾，古人皆以为不治，然亦有救疗之理焉耳。　　 【注　按前论发《内经》之微旨，开万世之聋瞶，其惠博矣！此证实命门火衰，不能生脾土而虚寒，以致自泻呕吐，或胸膈不利，或食而不化，或大便不实，宜用八味丸及六君子加姜、附。若因房劳过度，真阳衰败，或原禀不足，不能生脾土而饮食不进者，用补中益气加附子、姜、桂，并东垣补真丸，多有得生者。若用参、芪之类，直补脾胃，鲜有不误。若或以为毒气内攻而治者，俱致不起。】[160p]

From diarrhea and vomiting, not able to take in food and drink, the kidney pulse is extremely deficient. Such a condition, the ancients considered irremediable; however, there is still a rationale for treatment.

(Note: The preceding discussion reveals the subtleties of the "Neijing," opening the ears and eyes of generations, and its benefits are vast! This condition indeed indicates a decline of the fire at the life gate, unable to generate the earth of the spleen, leading to deficiency and coldness, resulting in diarrhea and vomiting. It may present as chest and diaphragm discomfort, inability to digest food, or loose stools. One should use the Eight Flavor Pill and the Six Gentlemen Decoction with ginger and prepared Aconite. If it’s due to excessive sexual activity, with true Yang in decline, or a congenital deficiency that cannot generate the earth of the spleen, leading to inability to take in food, use the Ren Shen and Huang Qi formulas with Aconite, ginger, and cinnamon, along with the Dongyuan Prescriptions for replenishing true Yang, many have survived. If one uses ginseng and astragalus solely to boost the spleen and stomach, few will escape error. If one mistakenly treats it as an internal attack of toxic Qi, it will not recover.)[160p]

　　　　　治贵在早第二十九

　　伍氏曰：夫痈发背者，皮薄肿高，多有椒眼数十粒；疽发背者，皮肤顽硬，状如牛颈之皮，二证皆宜灼艾。痈成脓则宜针，其针当以马衔铁为之，形如薤叶样，两面皆利，可以横直裂开五六寸许，取去毒血，其病顿轻。须先灸而后裂。可服神仙追毒丸，利去毒根，次服排脓托里等药调治。疽成脓则宜烙，用银篦大寸许长六寸烧赤，频烙患处，以脓出为效。大抵痈疽难于诸科，非心传契妙，其可以易治耶？　　【注　按前证若气血充实，其脓既成，宜速针之，勿药可愈。若气血亏损，脓不能出，或脓出反痛，须托里养胃，庶保终吉。详见第四十。】[161p]

Treating Illnesses Should Be Done Early

The Wu family states: When a carbuncle appears, the skin is thin and the swelling is high, often with numerous black spots; when an abscess appears, the skin is tough, resembling the hide of a cow. Both conditions should be treated with cautery using moxa. If a carbuncle forms pus, it should be needled using a horseshoe-shaped iron needle, which is sharp on both sides and can be used to make cuts of about five or six inches to drain the toxic blood, after which the condition will improve significantly. Cauterization should be done first, followed by incision. One may take the Immortal’s Pursuit of Toxins pill to help eliminate the toxic roots, then follow with medicines that help drain pus and regulate the body.

If an abscess forms pus, cauterization is advisable. Use a silver rod, about one inch wide and six inches long, heated until red, and frequently cauterize the affected area until the pus is expelled. Generally speaking, carbuncles and abscesses are more difficult to treat than other ailments; without the heart’s transmission of secret techniques, can they be easily cured?

[Note: If the vital energy and blood are robust and pus has formed, it is essential to needling promptly, without relying solely on medicines to heal. If the vital energy and blood are deficient, the pus may not be able to drain, or it may cause pain when it does, necessitating care to nourish the stomach to ensure a favorable outcome. See more in Chapter 40.][161p]

　　　　　津润墨围第三十

　　伍氏曰：但觉背两胛间赤痒肿痛，或有白粒，且以津唾时润令湿，切勿抓破。大抵在背微有赤肿点，或因抓破入浴犯水，或因饮食脍炙而作。初未辨证，且以津润，时用墨围之；若肿赤，急就围中灼艾，最善。人皆疑火热太过，以致廷蔓，误者众矣！　　【注　按疽发背胛，若有瘀肉腐烂，脓水淋漓，肿痛仍作者，此处有筋一层间隔，内脓不出故也，宜用针引之。老弱者，若待其自溃，多致不救，治者审之！】[162p]

Thirty: Moistening and Refreshing

The Wu family states: One may feel a red, itchy swelling and pain between the shoulder blades, possibly accompanied by white spots. It should be moistened with saliva and one must not scratch it open. Generally, there may be slight red swelling on the back, which could result from scratching, bathing, or from consuming raw or spicy foods. Initially, if the condition is unclear, moisten it and use a medicated paste. If there is swelling and redness, it is best to apply warm moxa directly to the affected area. Many people mistakenly believe that excess heat causes the condition to spread, leading to numerous errors!

(Note: In cases of abscess on the back, if there is necrosis with pus oozing and persistent pain, it may be due to a layer of muscle tissue that prevents the pus from draining. Using a needle to draw it out is advisable. For elderly or weak individuals, waiting for it to rupture naturally can often lead to severe consequences, so careful diagnosis is necessary!)[162p]

　　　　　看色灼艾防蔓第三十一

　　伍氏曰：疮肿赤色，按之色不变者，此脓已成矣。按之随手赤色者，其亦有脓也。按之白良久方赤者，此游毒已息，可就赤白尽处灸断，赤肿自消。凡痈疽以手按之，若牢硬，未有脓也；若半软半硬，已有脓也。又按肿上不热者为无脓，热甚者为有脓，宜急破之。　　【注　按疮疡毒气已结而不发者，法当补其血气，使脓速成而针之。其脓既溃，宜培养脾胃，以生肌敛口。大凡疮疡脓血既溃，当大补血气为先，虽有他证，当以末治。】[163p]

On Recognizing Colors and Preventing Spread (Chapter 31)

Wu said: If there is a sore that is swollen and red, and pressing it does not change its color, this indicates that pus has already formed. If pressing it causes the color to change with your hand, there is also pus present. If pressing it takes a long time to turn red, this indicates that the wandering toxin has subsided; cauterization can be done at the junction of red and white, and the red swelling will naturally diminish. In general, for abscesses, if they feel firm upon touch, there is no pus; if they are half soft and half hard, pus is present. Additionally, if the swollen area does not feel hot, then there is no pus; if it feels very hot, pus is likely present and should be urgently drained.

Note: When the toxic qi in a sore has congealed and does not erupt, it is advisable to tonify the blood and qi to hasten the formation of pus before using a needle. Once the pus has erupted, it is important to nourish the spleen and stomach to promote muscle generation and close the wound. Generally, when pus and blood from sores have ruptured, the priority should be to greatly replenish blood and qi, and even in the presence of other symptoms, one should focus on this as the primary treatment.[163p]

　　　　　疮口冷濇难合第三十二

　　治痈久不合，其肉白而脓少者，此气血俱虚，不能潮运而疮口冷濇也。每日用艾叶一把煎汤，避风热洗，及烧松香烟熏之，更以神异膏贴之。必须守禁调理，否则不效。　　【注　按前证果因寒邪凝滞，气血不能荣卫，宜用斯法，祛散寒邪，补接阳气，其功甚大。若因气血虚弱，不能潮会疮口，必用补脾胃生气血为善。丹溪先生云：诸经唯少阳厥阴之生痈疽，宜预防之，以其多气少血也。血少则肌肉难长，疮久末合，必成败证。苟反用驱利毒药，以伐其阴分之血，祸不旋踵矣。】[164p]

Title: Difficult Closure of Wounds

For long-term untreated abscesses that do not close, with white tissue and little pus, this indicates both qi and blood deficiency, leading to cold and stagnation at the wound site. Every day, use a handful of mugwort leaves to brew soup, wash the wound with care to avoid wind and heat, and use incense smoke for fumigation, then apply a miraculous ointment to the wound. It is essential to adhere to dietary restrictions and manage the condition; otherwise, it will not be effective.

Note: When the cold evil has solidified and obstructed the flow of qi and blood, it is advisable to use this method to dispel cold evil and replenish yang qi, which has great efficacy. If the issue arises from qi and blood deficiency that prevents the wound from healing, it is best to nourish the spleen and stomach to generate qi and blood. Master Danxi states that among all channels, only the lesser yang and jueyin are prone to abscess formation, and preventive measures are necessary due to their high qi and low blood levels. With insufficient blood, muscle growth is hindered, and long-standing wounds will inevitably lead to failure to heal. If potent purging and toxic medicines are used to deplete the yin and blood, disaster will follow swiftly.[164p]

　　　　　用药温凉防秘泄第三十三

　　伍氏曰：凡疮家皆宜宣去其毒，荡涤陈莝，宜用神仙追毒丸、六味车螯散、五香连翘汤、千金漏芦汤，更当详辨禀赋强弱，临时加减。大抵治疮要法，须脏腑坚而不秘，通而不泄，则真气不耗，邪无所留。如秘结，神效麻仁丸。凡疮溃后，尚觉虚热，可与五香汤加大黄、(石卜)硝。且如治疮，温药先用桂以通血脉，宣导百药；冷药必用地黄补不足，益气填髓。近用乳香散，乳香消毒，菉豆清热，真良药也。[165p]

On Using Warm and Cool Medicines to Prevent Secretions and Leaks

Wu said: For all patients with sores, it is essential to dispel their toxins and cleanse the old residues. It is advisable to use the Immortal's Detox Pill, Six-Flavor Chao'ao Powder, Five-Spice Lianqiao Decoction, and Qianjin Loulu Decoction, while also carefully distinguishing between individual strengths and weaknesses for adjustments as needed. Generally, the key to treating sores lies in ensuring that the organs are strong and not obstructed, flowing yet not over-exuding, so that true Qi is not consumed and evils have no place to settle. In case of secretive blockages, the Divine Efficacy Hemp Seed Pill is effective. After a sore has ulcerated, if there remains a feeling of internal heat, one can take the Five-Spice Decoction with added Da Huang and (Shi Bu) Nitrate. When treating sores, warm medicines should first include cassia to promote blood circulation and guide other medicines; cool medicines must use Rehmannia to replenish deficits and enhance Qi, filling the marrow. Recently, the use of Frankincense Powder has been noted; Frankincense detoxifies while Mung beans clear heat, making it truly a good remedy.[165p]

　　【注　按大肠秘结，果因血燥，胃气不虚，最宜前药。若因精血枯涸，用八珍、桃仁、麻仁。其溃后发热，若因气虚，用四君、黄芪、当归，血虚用四物、白朮、茯苓，气血俱虚用八珍、黄芪；若大便秘，小便赤，用四物、麦门、五味。如不应，急用加减八味丸，或六味丸。若下后元气伤而发热，用六君、当归；胃气虚而发热，用补中益气汤。大凡二便，肝肾主之。经云：肾主五液，开窍于二阴。若津液滋润，大便通利；若津液不足，必因脾气亏损，当培养化源。】[166p]

Note: For constipation in the large intestine, it is primarily due to dryness in the blood and is not caused by weakness of the stomach qi, thus the front-line medication is recommended. If due to depletion of essence and blood, use Ba Zhen, Tao Ren, and Ma Ren. If there is fever after an ulcer, and due to qi deficiency, use Si Jun, Huang Qi, and Dang Gui; if due to blood deficiency, use Si Wu, Bai Zhu, and Fu Ling; if both qi and blood are deficient, use Ba Zhen and Huang Qi. If there is constipation with red urine, use Si Wu, Mai Men Dong, and Wu Wei Zi. If ineffective, urgently use Jia Jian Ba Wei Wan or Liujia Wan. If there is injury to the original qi after a bowel movement leading to fever, use Liu Jun and Dang Gui; if due to weak stomach qi leading to fever, use Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang. Generally speaking, both urination and defecation are overseen by the liver and kidneys. The classics say: the kidneys govern the five fluids and open the orifices at the two yin. If the bodily fluids are nourishing, bowel movements will be smooth; if bodily fluids are insufficient, it is certainly due to the deficiency of spleen qi, thus one should cultivate and transform the source.[166p]

　　　　　生痂切护第三十四

　　伍氏曰：痈溃之后，败肉渐去，新肉渐生，日见堆阜，方成白膜新肉，当滋养平复，保无虞。大凡疮口未可速合，日用猪蹄汤洗去恶浊，外敷生肌膏、神异膏；毒脓出尽，可用圣效散以合疮口。更慎起居，节饮食，戒七情。否则虚证蜂起，多致不救，慎之！　　【注　按前证败肉去而新肉生者，须先微赤，四沿渐生白膜者，此胃中生气也，用六君子汤以培补之。若赤甚者，血虚而有火也，用四物加参、芪、白朮以调补之。若赤而不生膜者，气虚也，用四君加当归、黄芪。若色白而无神者，气血俱虚也，用十全大补加姜、桂；如不应，急加附子。大凡疮疽溃后，歹肉渐去，新肉渐生，此乃脾胃之气充实也。若恶浊已去，宜用当归膏。】[167p]

Wushi said: After a boil has burst, the necrotic flesh gradually decreases, and new flesh gradually appears. As time goes on, it builds up into a mound, forming a white membrane of new flesh, at which point nourishing and stabilizing should be practiced to ensure safety. In general, the wound should not be hastily closed; daily, wash away the impurities with pig's trotter soup and externally apply flesh-growing ointment or miraculous ointment. Once the toxic pus has completely drained, the Sacred Efficacy Powder can be used to close the wound. Furthermore, be cautious about daily activities, regulate diet, and restrain emotions. Otherwise, the symptoms of deficiency may surge, possibly leading to dire consequences, so be prudent!

Note: If the necrotic flesh has diminished and new flesh is starting to grow, it should first be slightly red, with a gradually developing white membrane around the edges—this indicates the vital energy from the stomach; use the Six Gentlemen Decoction to nourish and support it. If there is significant redness, it indicates blood deficiency with heat; use the Four Substances Decoction plus ginseng, astragalus, and white atractylodes to adjust and replenish. If there is redness without membrane formation, it indicates qi deficiency; use the Four Gentlemen Decoction plus angelica and astragalus. If the color is white and lacks vitality, both qi and blood are deficient; use the Ten Complete Great Supplement Decoction plus ginger and cinnamon; if there is no response, urgently add aconite. Generally, after the boil has ruptured, the necrotic flesh gradually recedes, and new flesh gradually emerges, which signifies that the spleen and stomach qi are robust. Once the impurities have been eliminated, it is advisable to use angelica ointment.[167p]

　　　　　体察爱护第三十五

　　伍氏曰：痈疽一证，病人当自体察。凡初作先以墨围患处，却视浮沉聚散，脓出视其多少，肉生视其阔狭，饮食视其美恶，脏腑防其秘泄，疮口防其奢裂。宜戒怒节劳，调补元气，保爱体察，慎不可忽！　　【注　按前论即丹溪先生所云痈疽当先助胃壮气，使根本坚固。东垣先生教人以饮食有节，起居有时。《素问》反复言之，可不慎哉！大凡泄泻易损元气，肿疡犯之，不能成脓；溃疡犯之，不能生肌。患者审之！】
　　　　　香药调治第三十六

　　伍氏曰：气血闻香则行，闻臭则逆。大抵疮疡多因营气不从，逆于肉里，郁聚为脓，得香之味则气血流行，故当多服五香连翘汤、万金散、金粉散。凡疮本腥秽，又闻臭触则愈甚，若毒入胃，则咳逆，古人用之，可谓有理。且如饮食调令香美，以益脾土，养其真元，可保无虞矣。　　【注　按前证说见第十八十九。】[168p]

Observing and Caring for Illness – Section 35

Wu said: For the condition of abscess and sore, the patient should self-examine. In the beginning, encircle the affected area with ink, and observe the rising and falling, gathering and dispersing; check the amount of pus that comes out and the width and narrowness of the flesh that grows. Monitor the quality of food and drink, and be mindful of any secretions from the organs. Prevent excessive opening of the wound. It is essential to avoid anger, regulate labor, nourish the vital energy, and maintain careful observation; negligence is not acceptable!

Note: This echoes what Master Danxi said regarding abscesses: one should first support the stomach to strengthen the energy, making the foundation solid. Master Dongyuan taught people to have a balanced diet and a regular lifestyle. The "Suwen" reiterates this, so one must be cautious! In general, diarrhea easily depletes vital energy; if swelling and sores affect it, pus cannot form; if ulcers affect it, flesh cannot grow. Patients should be vigilant!

Healing with Aromatic Medicines – Section 36

Wu said: Qi and blood flow with fragrance and stagnate with foul odors. Generally, sores and abscesses often stem from a failure of the protective qi to circulate, becoming stagnant in the flesh, which then coalesces into pus. The fragrance promotes the circulation of qi and blood; therefore, one should frequently take soups with five spices and honeysuckle, and Jinfen powder. Sores are originally foul and filthy; if they are met with a bad smell, they worsen. If poison enters the stomach, it leads to cough and rebellion; the ancients utilized this, and it can be deemed reasonable. Additionally, regulate food and drink to be fragrant and delicious to benefit the spleen and nourish the true essence, ensuring that there are no future worries.

Note: References from earlier discussions are found in sections 18 and 19.[168p]

　　　　　饮食居处戒忌第三十七

　　李氏云：病疽之人，当戒酒面、炙煿、腌腊、法酒、生冷、油腻、鸡鹅、鱼鲜之类；起居七情，尤当深戒。卧室洁净馨香，使气血流畅。仍忌僧道、孝子、产妇、经妇、鸡犬、猫畜。若背疽难于隐几，宜用菉豆十斗作一袋，隐伏其上，解毒凉心也。　　【注　按前论慎起居，薄滋味，恐病者好动四体，甘嗜性热性寒之物，使火益炽而胃气益衰，则所患淹滞不愈，又谁咎哉！不若预为之防，当以古人之言为戒。如菉豆性寒，主丹毒烦热风疹，或金石所发实热烦渴，饮食如常，证属纯阳者宜用，否则不可用也。】[169p]

Diet and Living Conditions: Cautions, Section 37

Li says: For those suffering from sores, one should avoid wine, fatty meat, roasted foods, pickled products, raw and cold foods, oily dishes, chicken, goose, and fresh fish. In daily life and emotional states, one must be especially cautious. The bedroom should be clean and fragrant to promote smooth circulation of qi and blood. Additionally, one should avoid monks, Daoists, filial children, postpartum women, menstruating women, and pets like chickens, dogs, and cats. If a sore is difficult to hide, it is advisable to use ten dou of mung beans made into a bag placed over the affected area to detoxify and cool the heart.

Note: The earlier discussion emphasizes careful living conditions and simple flavors, as patients who are too active or prefer hot and cold foods might exacerbate their conditions, making recovery more difficult. Therefore, prevention should be prioritized based on the wisdom of the ancients. Mung beans are cold in nature and are effective for conditions like heat and irritations, but if the cause is purely Yang in nature, regular diet is recommended, otherwise, they should not be used.[169p]

　　　　　更易良方第三十八

　　李氏云：常见世间医者，每有妙方，秘而不传，或更改以惑人，诚可恶也。余思西华麦饭石膏，守死不传，其立心私刻，君子责之矣。昔赵公宣教字季修来宰龙泉，兼程而进，患鼻衄，日出数升。时家兄教以服藕汁地黄膏。赵叩诸医，云，此为戒服之剂，乃数易医无效。家兄阴馈前汁，服三日而疾愈。兄曰：此即前所献之方。赵惊叹曰：向非医者谲计以惑我，早信此方，岂久受此困也！今以屡试屡验，不可易者。[170p]

The Thirty-Eighth Good Method

Li said: It is often seen that in the world, physicians possess remarkable remedies but keep them secret or alter them to mislead others, which is truly detestable. I ponder the case of Western Huamaifanshi, who, despite steadfastly refusing to share his knowledge, is rightly criticized by gentlemen for his selfishness. In the past, Zhao Gong ordered Ji Xiu to take charge of Longquan and was making haste to arrive. He suffered from nosebleeds, losing several qing daily. At the time, my elder brother taught him to take lotus root juice and earth yellow ointment. Zhao consulted various physicians, who said that this was to be avoided, and he changed doctors repeatedly without effect. My elder brother secretly supplied the previous medicine, and after three days of taking it, Zhao was cured. My brother said: This is indeed the remedy previously offered. Zhao was astonished and said: If it were not for the deceitful calculations of those physicians to confuse me, and I had believed in this remedy earlier, wouldn’t I have endured this affliction for so long! Now, with repeated testing, it is proven time and again that this cannot be replaced.[170p]

如因热毒冲心而呕，用内托散【一名万金散】 ；因脾胃虚弱而呕，嘉禾散；热毒肿痛，麦饭石膏；阴虚作渴，加减八味丸。此四方屡为医人眩惑，使人忽用，深悯患者之受苦，故举赵公之事以例之。　　 【注　窃以为方者仿也，仿病因以立方。非谓《内经》无方也，若执古方以治今疾，犹拆旧宇以对新宇，其长短大小，岂有舍匠氏之手而能合者乎？设或有合，以为亘古不易之方，此又先王普济之神术，奚必秘而私之耶？余尝观太无先生治滇南一僧，远游江浙，思亲成疾，先生惠之以饮食药饵，复赠金一镒以资其归，此固我医道之当然也。今之医者，或泥古，或吝秘，或嗜利以惑人，其得罪于名教多矣。】[171p]

If vomiting is caused by heat toxin attacking the heart, use Neituo Powder (also known as Wanjin Powder); if vomiting is due to weak spleen and stomach, use Jiahe Powder; for swollen pain from heat toxin, use Maifanshi Gypsum; for thirst due to yin deficiency, use a modified version of the Eight Flavor Pill. These four prescriptions often confuse physicians and may lead them to mistakenly use them, causing deep suffering for patients. Therefore, I present the story of Zhao Gong as an example.

(Note: I believe that prescriptions are imitative, established by imitating the causes of diseases. This does not mean that the "Inner Canon" lacks prescriptions; rather, if one insists on using ancient prescriptions for modern ailments, it is akin to dismantling an old house to fit a new one. Can the dimensions and proportions truly be reconciled without the hand of a skilled carpenter? Even if a reconciliation exists, to claim it as an unchanging prescription since ancient times is to invoke the divine techniques of the former kings. Why should one keep such knowledge a secret? I once observed Master Taiwu treating a monk from Yunnan who, while traveling far to Jiangsu and Zhejiang, fell ill with homesickness. The master generously provided him with food and medicinal remedies, and additionally gifted him an ounce of gold to aid his return. This is indeed the proper way of our medical practice. Yet today's physicians may either cling to the past, hoard secrets, or be driven by greed, leading them to violate established principles and ethics abundantly.)[171p]

　　　　　麦饭石膏第三十九

　　李氏云：麦饭石膏，治发背痈疽神妙，惜世罕知。有患者因脓不溃，以毒药罨之，其势益甚，毒延咽喉脚膝，皆为不治。余用此膏，一夕顿溃。凡疽得脓，其毒始解，或有不溃者，须用此膏。故录之，俾精择修合，以收十全之功也。　　【注　按前证属腑属阳，而气血未损者，用前膏敷之，固无不愈。然亦有属脏属阴而气血有亏者，当审其因而调治其内可也。大凡疮疡之作，由胃气不从；疮疡之溃，由胃气腐化；疮疡之敛，由胃气营养。余常治初结成脓者，托而散之；已成欲作脓者，托而腐之；脓成未溃者，托而开之，脓已溃者，托而敛之。东垣先生云：胃气乃生发之源，为人身之本。丹溪先生亦谓治疮当助胃壮气，使根本坚固。厥有旨哉！】
　　　　　敷神异膏第四十[172p]

Mica Plaster, Section 39

Li said: Mica plaster is wonderfully effective in treating boils and skin abscesses, yet few in the world know of it. There was a patient whose pus did not come to a head; a toxic substance was applied, worsening the situation, and the poison spread to the throat and knees, leading to a state that could not be cured. I used this plaster, and by morning it had opened up completely. Whenever an abscess produces pus, its poison begins to resolve. If there are cases where it does not rupture, this plaster must be applied. Therefore, I record it, hoping that those discerning may choose to modify and combine it to achieve complete success.

[Note: Cases previously mentioned belong to a yang condition, where qi and blood are unharmed; applying the previous plaster will surely result in healing. However, there are also cases belonging to yin conditions where qi and blood are deficient; one must consider the cause and adjust the internal treatment accordingly. Generally, the formation of sores and ulcers arises from the stomach qi not being coordinated; their rupture results from the stomach qi decaying; their healing comes from the nourishment of the stomach qi. I often treat cases where pus first forms by promoting dispersal; if pus is about to form, I promote decay; if pus has formed but not yet ruptured, I promote opening; and if it has already ruptured, I promote healing. Dr. Dong Yuan said: Stomach qi is the source of growth and is fundamental to the human body. Dr. Danxi also remarked that to treat sores, one must aid the stomach to strengthen the qi, solidifying the foundation. Truly insightful!]

Mysterious Plaster, Section 40[172p]

　　凡疽证先以麦饭石膏涂之，俟疮根渐收，却敷神异膏敛之。夫痈疽之发有浅深，故收敛之功有迟速。断不可早用收口之药，恐毒气未尽，后必复发，为患匪轻。但麦饭石膏，难于修合，用神异膏亦效。　　【注　按前证若毒已解，而不生肌收敛者，元气虚也。用六君子汤壮其脾胃，则肌肉自生。设有余毒，亦能自解。】
　　　　　口紧小硬第四十一

　　李氏云：大抵疽口紧小而硬者，盖因风毒所胜，合用蚣蝎散掺疮口，以神异膏贴之。　　【注　按前证乃风寒滞于疮口而未传于内也。凡伤损之证，尤多此患。经云：风者善行数变，入脏甚速，死生在乎反掌，当急分表里虚实而治之。其邪在表者，善伸数欠，筋脉拘急，恶寒惕搦，脉浮而弦，宜羌活防风汤和解之。传于里者，舌强口噤，项背反张，筋惕搐搦，痰涎壅盛，胸腹满闷，或便闭溺赤，时或汗出，脉洪数而弦，宜大芎黄汤疏导之。其汗初出者，由风热郁于里，亦宜大芎黄汤之类下之。[173p]

For the treatment of abscesses, first apply wheatstone plaster. Wait for the root of the sore to gradually shrink, then use the miraculous ointment to close it up. The onset of boils and abscesses can vary in depth, hence the efficacy of closure can be slow or fast. One must not use closing medicines too early, for fear that the toxic heat has not yet dissipated, which could lead to a relapse and cause more serious issues. Although wheatstone plaster is difficult to adapt, the miraculous ointment is also effective.

Li says: Generally, abscesses that are tight, small, and hard are due to being overcome by wind and poison. One should use centipede and scorpion powder mixed at the sore and apply the miraculous ointment.

This situation often arises when wind and cold are stagnated at the sore, not yet transmitted inward. In all injuries, this condition is quite common. The classics say: Wind is good at rapid movement and change, entering the viscera swiftly; life and death hinge on immediate response. One should urgently distinguish between the superficial and the internal, as well as between deficiency and excess, to treat accordingly. If the evil is in the exterior, it causes stiffness in the bones and muscles, chills, and tightness; the pulse will be superficial and taut, indicating the need for Qianghuo and Fangfeng decoction to harmonize and resolve it. If it has penetrated inward, there will be a strong tongue, a sealed mouth, a stiff neck and back, tight and painful muscles, excessive phlegm, fullness in the chest and abdomen, possible constipation or red urination, occasional sweating, and a flooding, rapid, taut pulse, requiring Dahuang and Qionghuo decoction to guide it out. Initial sweating results from wind-heat stagnating inside, thus also needing similar methods for purgation.[173p]

若热既退，脏腑已和而汗仍出者，表虚也，宜白朮防风汤以实其表。然解散、和解、疏导三法，此治暴患之证，气血未损者。若脓瘀内焮而见前证者，宜针之，急投十全大补。或口噤遗尿，乃气血虚极，亦用十全大补加炮附子。大抵此证若因脓血去多，宜以补中益气加羌活主之。或人素多痰，因伤损而见风证，宜二陈、白朮、芎、归、栀子、芩、连。气虚加四君，血虚加四物。血气俱虚内热甚而生风者，宜四物、参、朮、柴、芩、栀子，若因怒伤而见前证，宜小柴胡汤，倍加川芎、山栀、天麻、钓藤钩。若患破伤风，至三五年忽然复发，或跌仆而患者，皆气虚有痰所致也，用二陈、参、朮、芎、归主之。】[174p]

When heat has receded and the organs are harmonized, yet there is still sweating, this indicates exterior deficiency. It is advisable to use Bai Zhu and Fang Feng Decoction to strengthen the exterior. The methods of dispersing, harmonizing, and guiding are used to treat acute conditions when there is no deficiency of qi and blood. If pus and blood stagnate internally and present the previous symptoms, acupuncture is recommended along with an urgent dose of Shi Quan Da Bu Tang. If there is jaw stiffness and urinary incontinence, this indicates extreme deficiency of qi and blood, and similarly, Shi Quan Da Bu Tang with Pao Fu Zi should be used. Generally, if this condition is due to excessive loss of pus and blood, one should use Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang reinforced with Qiang Huo as its main ingredient. If a person has a history of phlegm and presents with symptoms of wind due to injury, the prescription should include Er Chen Tang, Bai Zhu, Chuan Xiong, Gui, Zhi Zi, Qin, and Lian. For qi deficiency, add Si Jun Zi Tang; for blood deficiency, add Si Wu Tang. If both blood and qi are deficient with severe internal heat causing wind, then Si Wu Tang combined with Ren Shen, Bai Zhu, Chai Hu, Qin, and Zhi Zi is recommended. If the patient experiences tetanus that unexpectedly recurs after three to five years, or if they have suffered injuries from falls, this is also due to deficiency of qi and phlegm; use Er Chen Tang, Ren Shen, Bai Zhu, Chuan Xiong, and Gui as the main ingredients.[174p]

　　　　　喉舌生疮如菌第四十二

　　李氏云：痈疽不服内托散，或失宣内毒，致咽喉口舌生疮，甚则生红黑菌，害人甚速，当用琥珀犀角膏治之。向有患此证者，诸法不效，余用此药一日而安。　　【注　按前证多因酒色过度，亏损肾水，虚火上炎，或五疳元气消烁，虚火上攻而致，治当滋其化源。最忌黄蘗、知母之类，恐复伤胃气也。】[175p]

Sore Throat and Tongue Like Fungus

Li states: When there is a case of carbuncle and it does not respond to internal remedies, or if the internal poison is not expelled, it can lead to sores in the throat, mouth, and tongue. In severe cases, red and black fungus may develop, harming the person rapidly. It should be treated with amber and rhino horn ointment. There has been a case where previous treatments proved ineffective, but using this remedy for just one day achieved relief.

[Note: The previous evidence often stems from excessive indulgence in wine and lust, depleting kidney water, leading to virtual fire inflaming upward, or the five types of sores consuming vital energy, resulting in virtual fire attacking upward. The treatment should nourish the source of transformation. It is crucial to avoid substances like huanglian (coptis) and zhi mu (anemarrhena), as they may further damage the stomach qi.][175p]

　　　　　替针丸第四十三

　　曾氏曰：痈疽脓熟，涂以替针丸，疮口自开。古人云：痈疽能杀人。若针药得其宜则生，失其宜则死。不慎哉！　　【注　按疮疡之证，若毒气已结，肿赤炽盛，中央肉死黯黑者，内用托里健脾之剂，外用乌金膏涂之，则黯处渐低，赤处渐起，至六七日间，赤黯之界自有裂纹，如刀划状，其黯渐溃，若用铍针利剪除去尤好。须使不知疼痛，不见鲜血为善。若脓未流利，宜用针于纹中引之；若脓水已出，肿痛仍作，乃内筋间隔，亦用针引之。若元气虚弱，误服克伐之剂，患处不痛，或肉死不溃者，急温补脾胃，亦有复生者。后须纯补脾胃，庶能收敛。若妄用针刀，去肉出血，使阳随阴散，是速其危也。若脓溃而烦痛未痊，脉洪滑大散者，真气虚而邪气实也，为难治；脉微濇迟缓者，邪气虚而真气将复也，为易治。】[176p]

Substitute Needle Powder - Chapter 43

Zeng said: When boils and sores become filled with pus, applying the Substitute Needle Powder causes the wound to open on its own. The ancients said: Boils can be lethal. If the medicinal needle fits the condition, one lives; if it does not fit, one dies. How careless!

Note: In cases of sores, if toxic qi has already coagulated, causing swelling and redness to become intense, and the flesh in the center dies and turns dark, one should internally use medicines to clear heat and strengthen the spleen, and externally apply black gold ointment. Gradually, the dark area will lower and the red area will rise. Within six or seven days, a crack will appear where the red and dark meet, resembling a cut, and the dark will gradually rupture. It is best if this is done without feeling pain or seeing fresh blood. If pus has not yet flowed freely, use a needle to draw it from the lines; if pus has begun to flow, but swelling and pain persist, there may be internal sinew barriers, and a needle should be used to draw it out. If the vital energy is weak and one mistakenly takes a harmful remedy, resulting in a lack of pain at the affected site or dead flesh that does not rupture, one must urgently warm and nourish the spleen and stomach, as there may still be a chance to regenerate. Following this, pure nourishment of the spleen and stomach should be done to help consolidate. If one recklessly uses needles and knives, removing flesh and causing bleeding, it disperses the yang with the yin, hastening danger. If the pus ruptures but pain persists without healing, with a pulse that is surging, slippery, and greatly dispersed, it indicates a deficiency of true qi with the presence of邪气, making it difficult to treat; if the pulse is weak, thin, and slow, it indicates a deficiency of邪气 and the recovery of true qi, making it easier to treat.[176p]

　　　　　割伤第四十四

　　李氏云：痈疽有悞搽毒药，或针刀开割，疮口不合，不可用濇敛之药，宜用猪蹄汤、北艾汤间洗，敷贴神异膏，及服内补十宣散、内托黄芪丸。　　【注　按经云脾主肌肉，脾健则肉自生。然其势炽甚，宜用前药以消其毒。毒将尽，宜用四君汤以养脾。】[177p]

Fourth Injury

Li states: For boils and carbuncles, one may use ointments with poisonous herbs, or open and cut with a needle or knife. If the wound edges don't fit together, do not use strong astringent medicines. Instead, it is advisable to wash with pig's hoof soup or northern mugwort soup intermittently, apply the miraculous ointment, and take internal tonics like the Ten Xuan Powder or Huang Qi Pills. [Note: According to the classics, the spleen governs the muscles; when the spleen is strong, the flesh will regenerate on its own. However, if the condition is severe, it is advisable to use the aforementioned medicines to eliminate the poison. As the poison diminishes, it is appropriate to use the Four Gentlemen Decoction to nourish the spleen.][177p]

　　　　　寒热多汗用药第四十五

　　李氏云：有数人病背疽，或先寒后热，先热后寒，或连日或间日，必呕痰大汗而止，皆用柴胡、恒山，不应。余谓此因脾气不正，复感寒邪痰盛而作，遂先用不换金正气散，次用排脓内补散、木香汤，三月即愈。　　【注　按前证若外邪既去而仍作，宜用六君子汤以补脾胃。大凡胃气虚而作呕者必喜温热，毒内攻而作呕者必喜寒，治当辨之！】
　　　　　食毒发热第四十六

　　李氏论云：凡痈不可食牛羊鸡鹅虾鱼酒面煿炙之物，犯之必发热，宜服栀子黄芪汤。大凡脏腑已利，疮毒已溃，气血既虚，最当调护。若发热而服凉药，无不致祸。　　【注　按前证，若饮食伤脾胃而发热，用六君、神曲、山楂；若阴血不足而发热，用四物、参、朮、黄芪；若脓血出多而发热，用十全大补汤。东垣先生云：胃为五脏之根本。胃气一伤，诸脏皆虚，七恶蜂起，可不慎哉！】[178p]

On Cold and Heat with Excessive Sweating, Prescription 45

Li states: There are a few cases of back abscesses, sometimes starting with cold then heating, or vice versa, occurring on consecutive or alternate days, always leading to vomiting phlegm followed by profuse sweating, treated with Chai Hu and Heng Shan, but with no effect. I believe this results from improper spleen qi, which is also influenced by cold pathogens and excessive phlegm, thus I first used Bu Huan Jin Zheng Qi San, followed by Pai Nong Nei Bu San and Mu Xiang Tang; recovery was achieved in three months. [Note: If the external pathogen has been expelled yet symptoms persist, one should use Liu Jun Zi Tang to tonify the spleen and stomach. Generally, if there is stomach qi deficiency causing vomiting, warmth is preferred; if toxins attack internally causing vomiting, cold is preferred. Treatment must be accurately discerned!]

On Food Poisoning Leading to Fever, Prescription 46

Li argues: In cases of carbuncles, one should avoid food items such as beef, mutton, chicken, goose, shrimp, fish, wine, and baked goods, as consuming them will surely induce fever, and it is advisable to take Zhi Zi Huang Qi Tang. Generally, when the organs have been relieved and the sores have ruptured, and qi and blood are already deficient, care and recuperation are paramount. If one takes cooling medications during fever, disaster is inevitable. [Note: If fever arises from dietary harm to the spleen and stomach, use Liu Jun, Shun Qu, and Shan Zha; if there is a deficiency of yin blood causing fever, use Si Wu, Ren, Zhu, and Huang Qi; if there is a significant discharge of pus and blood leading to fever, use Shi Quan Da Bu Tang. Dong Yuan states: The stomach is the foundation of the five organs. If the stomach qi is damaged, all organs are depleted, leading to numerous ills; caution is essential!][178p]

　　　　　作渴调补精气第四十七

　　伍氏云：痈疽发热大渴，毒气炽盛，急用神仙追毒丸驱下恶毒，次以清膻汤、万金散，五香连翘汤、六味车螯散、千金漏芦汤选用之。渴不止，用秘传金粉散、人参黄芪散、内补散之类，以补津液、生血气，其渴自止。　　【注　按前证若脉沉实，大便秘结，宜用前药，驱逐积毒；若发热作渴，饮食如故，大便如常，属胃经实热，用竹叶石膏汤以清胃热，生津液；若发热作渴，饮食少思，大便不实，属胃经虚热，用竹叶黄芪汤以补胃气，生津液；若发热恶寒，若内热晡热，口干作汤，属气血不足，用八珍、麦门、五味以补肝脾，生精血。】[179p]

On Thirst and Supplementing Vital Energy, Chapter 47

The Wu family states: When carbuncles and sores cause high fever and intense thirst, it indicates a strong presence of toxic energy. Promptly use the Immortal's Poison-Driving Pill to expel the toxins, then follow up with Qing Dan Soup, Wan Jin Powder, Five-Spice Forsythia Soup, Liu Wei Che'ao Powder, or Qian Jin Loulu Soup as options. If thirst persists, use secret transmission Gold Powder Powder, Ginseng and Astragalus Powder, or similar formulas to replenish fluids and invigorate blood energy, which will alleviate the thirst.

Note: If the pulse is deep and firm with constipation, the aforementioned medicines should be used to expel the accumulated toxins. If there is fever and thirst, but food intake and bowel movements are regular, it indicates excess heat in the stomach channel; use Bamboo Leaf and Gypsum Soup to clear the stomach heat and generate fluids. If there is fever and thirst, but decreased appetite and loose stools, it indicates deficiency heat in the stomach channel; use Bamboo Leaf and Astragalus Soup to replenish stomach energy and generate fluids. If fever is accompanied by chills, or there is internal heat with afternoon fever and dry mouth, indicating insufficient qi and blood, use Eight Treasures, Wheat Husk, and Five Flavors to nourish the liver and spleen, and generate vital essence and blood.[179p]

　　　　　将安发热作渴第四十八

　　李氏云：凡疽愈后，忽发渴而不救者，十有八九。或先渴而患疽者，尤为难治。急用加减八味丸，可免前患。如能久服，永不作渴，亦无疽证，且气血皆壮，真神剂也！　　【注　按前证属肾水枯涸，虚火上炎，口干作渴，饮水无度，或唇干作裂，小便频数，或痰气上壅，烦躁不宁，或二三年先作渴饮水，或口舌生疮，两足发热，痰气上壅，或疮愈三四年而口干作渴，小便频数，急用前药，多有复生者。能逆知其因，预服前丸，可免此患。若兼手足厥冷，真阳虚也，宜服八味丸。大凡疮后审其肾水不足，用加减八味丸；中气虚弱，用补中益气汤；气血虚弱，用十全大补汤；阳气虚寒，加姜桂；如不应，用八味丸。】[180p]

On the Heat of Thirst After the Recovery from Abscesses

Li states: After the healing of an abscess, if one suddenly experiences thirst without relief, this occurs in eighteen or nineteen out of twenty cases. If someone first experiences thirst and then develops an abscess, it is particularly difficult to treat. One should urgently use the modified Eight-flavor Pill, which can prevent the previous affliction. If taken over a long period, one will never feel thirsty again and will not display symptoms of abscesses; both the vital energy and blood will be robust—this is indeed a genuine sacred remedy!

Note: The previous symptoms are due to a depletion of kidney water, with deficient fire rising, resulting in dry mouth and thirst, an insatiable desire for water, or cracked lips, frequent urination, or phlegm obstructing upward, causing agitation and unease. Thirst may appear one to three years prior, or there may be sores in the mouth and on the tongue, heat in both feet, and phlegm obstruction. Even three to four years post-abscess healing, dry mouth and thirst may recur with frequent urination; in this case, urgent use of the previous medicine is often required to prevent recurrence. If one can discern the cause in advance and take the specified pills, this affliction can be avoided. If there are also coldness in the hands and feet, true yang is deficient; the Eight-flavor Pill should be used. Generally, if after an abscess there is a recognized deficiency of kidney water, use the modified Eight-flavor Pill; if there is weakness of middle qi, use the Restore Middle and Benefit Qi Decoction; if there is weakness of both qi and blood, use the Ten-Ingredient Great Tonifying Decoction; if there is deficient cold of yang qi, add ginger and cinnamon; if it does not respond, use the Eight-flavor Pill.[180p]

　　　　　口干作渴不同第四十九

　　李氏云：痈疽已安之后，或未安之际，口舌燥黄如鸡内金者，乃肾水枯竭，心火上炎，此证最恶。古人云：玉华池竭七朝亡。若误投以丹药，祸在反掌。急用加减八味丸、桑枝煎、五味子汤以滋补之。　　【注　按前证若不慎房事，亏损真阴而虚火上炎，亦多患此。若发热作渴，或口舌生疮，或小便频数，或茎中作痛，亦宜用前药。其桑枝补血气生津液，轻身明目，补肺肾之良剂也。五味子汤乃六一散，生脉散之复方，滋化源之良剂。若肾水既涸，虚火上炎，而口燥作渴者，须佐以加减八味丸。详见附录用药关键。】[181p]

After a carbuncle has settled or during its unsettled phase, if the mouth and tongue are dry and yellow like the inner gold of a chicken, this indicates that kidney water is exhausted and heart fire is raging upward; this condition is the most severe. The ancients said: "When the Jade Lake is drained, the seven dynasties perish." If one mistakenly administers elixirs or pills, disaster is at hand. It is urgent to use the modified Eight Flavor Pill, mulberry twig decoction, and Schisandra berry soup to nourish and replenish.

(Note: If previous symptoms arise from careless sexual activity, leading to the depletion of true yin and the ascent of empty fire, one may also be afflicted by this condition. If fever and thirst occur, or if sores appear on the mouth and tongue, or if there is frequent urination, or pain in the genitals, the aforementioned remedies should also be used. The mulberry twig helps replenish blood and qi, generates bodily fluids, lightens the body, clears the eyes, and is an excellent remedy for nourishing the lungs and kidneys. The Schisandra berry soup is a compound of Six-to-One powder and Shengmai powder, a good remedy for nourishing the source of transformation. If kidney water is already dried up, with empty fire raging upward and the mouth dry and thirsty, one must add the modified Eight Flavor Pill. For detailed usage of the medication, see the key in the appendix.)[181p]

　　　　　肾虚发热第五十

　　李氏曰：一痈疽之热，未有不自肾虚而得之者，必须五更服加减八味丸。　　【注　按痈疽皆由肾经湿热，虚火上炎，中传恶证，若非加减八味丸滋肾水以制心火，补中益气以生化源，欲望其生难矣。启元子曰：大寒而甚，热之不热，是无火也，当助其心；大热而甚，寒之不寒，是无水也，当益其肾。夫寒之不寒，责其无水；热之不热，责其无火。热之不久，责心之虚；寒之不久，责水之少。窃谓无火者，当用八味丸以益其心，无水者当用六味丸以滋其肾。】[182p]

Li said: The heat from a carbuncle never arises without deficiency of the kidneys; one must take the modified Eight Ingredients Pill at the fifth watch.

[Note: Carbuncles are all caused by damp-heat in the kidney meridian and the upward burning of deficient fire, leading to severe symptoms. If not for the modified Eight Ingredients Pill, which nourishes kidney water to control heart fire, and replenishes middle qi to generate transformation, the desire for recovery would be difficult to achieve. Qi Yuanzi said: In severe cold with no heat, this indicates a lack of fire, and one should support the heart; in severe heat with no cold, this indicates a lack of water, and one should nourish the kidneys. When there is no cold, it points to insufficient water; when there is no heat, it points to insufficient fire. If the heat does not last long, it reflects the deficiency of the heart; if the cold does not last long, it reflects the lack of water. I believe that for a lack of fire, the Eight Ingredients Pill should be used to nourish the heart; for a lack of water, the Six Ingredients Pill should be used to nourish the kidneys.][182p]

　　　　　将安当补第五十一

　　李氏云：疽疾将安，每日当服十全大补汤以补气血，宜与排脓内补十宣散相间服。　　【注　按前云溃疡属气血俱虚，固在所当补。若患肿疡而气血虚弱者，尤宜预补，否则虽溃而不敛矣。凡大病之后，气血未复，多致再发。若不调补，必变为他证而危。或误以为疮毒复发，反行攻伐，速其不起，深可为戒也。详见附录用药关键。】
　　　　　服药捷径第五十二

　　李氏云：凡患疮疽而肾脉虚者，急服补药，尚恐有误。如鹿茸、附子之药，是犹抱薪救火，反益其势，而平补之药，亦难奏功。有一贵人苦疽，诸药无效，愚谓服山药丸于五更初，物欲未接之际，肾门未开之时，如法服三日，脉证平复。若肾经沉寒痼冷，鹿茸附子之药，斯可用矣。　　【注　按前方诚有回生之功，治法见前论。】[183p]

On This Treatment for Abscess

Li stated: For the treatment of abscesses, one should take the Ten Whole Great Supplement Decoction daily to nourish Qi and blood, and it is advisable to alternate with the Decocted San (Ten Xuan San) to expel pus while also reinforcing internal recovery. [Note: It has been previously mentioned that ulcers are associated with deficiency of both Qi and blood, thus supplementation is essential. If a patient has swelling and abscesses with weak Qi and blood, it is especially important to provide supplementary treatment in advance; otherwise, despite ulceration, healing will not occur. After a serious illness, if Qi and blood have not yet recovered, this often leads to relapses. If nourishment is not properly provided, it could result in a transformation to more serious conditions. There may be a misunderstanding that the wound poison has recurred, leading to aggressive treatments that may cause a worsening condition; this should be taken as a caution. For further details, see the key points for medication in the appendix.]

Shortcut to Medication

Li stated: For patients with ulcers and abscesses due to kidney deficiency, it is important to take nourishing medicines urgently, though there is fear of error. Medicines such as deer antler and aconite are akin to stoking a fire with firewood, which may worsen the condition. Moreover, general replenishing medicines may also be ineffective. There was a nobleman suffering from ulcers, and none of the medicines were effective. I foolishly suggested he take yam pills at the early dawn, before interactions with food and at a time when the kidney pathways were not yet open. Following this method for three days, his pulse and symptoms stabilized. If the kidney channels are severely cold and stagnant, then deer antler and aconite can be applied. [Note: This method indeed has restorative effects, as discussed in earlier sections.][183p]

　　　　　调节饮食当平胃气第五十三

　　论曰：《素问》云，形不足者，温之以气；精不足者，补之以味。大凡疮疽当调脾胃。盖脾为仓廪之官，胃为水谷之海，主养四旁，须进饮食以生气血，宜用茯苓开胃散、人参内补散、内补十宣散。　　【注　按人参顺气散，因脾肺肾气盛壅遏，宜用此以疏泄之。若气虚壅滞，必用益气养荣汤以调补之。今之患者，多因气血受伤，当随证而施治。若胃气郁滞，宜用茯苓开胃汤。若胃气虚弱，用四君子汤。若胃气下陷，用补中益气汤。若脾气虚弱，用六君子汤。若脾气郁结，用归脾汤。】　　李氏曰：胃气弱不进饮食，合服嘉禾散，每五两加人参、丁香、沉香、白豆蔻各二钱。有一贵人苦疽，用药失序，脾虚不食。余欲用嘉禾散。或云内有丁沉香，乃别服药，不应，仍用前散，饮食顿进。[184p]

Regulating Diet to Harmonize Stomach Qi

It is said: The "Suwen" states that for those who are deficient in form, they should be warmed by Qi; for those who are deficient in essence, they should be nourished by flavors. Generally speaking, conditions of sores and carbuncles require the adjustment of the spleen and stomach. The spleen is the officer of storage, and the stomach is the sea of food and grains, responsible for nourishing the surrounding areas. It is necessary to take in food and drink to generate Qi and blood, and the following remedies are recommended: Poria Opening the Stomach Powder, Ginseng Internal Supplement Powder, and Internal Supplement Decocted Ten Herbs.

[Note: The Ginseng Qi Regulating Powder is used because the Qi of the spleen, lungs, and kidneys may become stagnant. This should be used to disperse it. If Qi is deficient and stagnant, it is necessary to use the Nourishing Qi and Enhancing Vitality Decoction for regulation and replenishment. Modern patients often suffer due to injuries to Qi and blood, and treatment should be based on symptoms. If the stomach Qi is stagnant, Poria Opening the Stomach Decoction should be used. If stomach Qi is weak, use the Four Gentlemen Decoction. If stomach Qi sinks, use the Supplementing the Middle and Enhancing Qi Decoction. If spleen Qi is weak, use the Six Gentlemen Decoction. If spleen Qi is stagnant, use the Returning Spleen Decoction.]

Li said: If the stomach Qi is weak and does not accept food, it is suitable to take the Jiahe Powder, adding two Qian each of ginseng, clove, fragrant sandalwood, and white cardamom for every five Liang. There was a noble who suffered from carbuncles; due to an improper order of medication, the spleen became weak and he could not eat. I intended to use the Jiahe Powder. Someone mentioned the presence of clove and fragrant sandalwood inside, suggesting to take them separately as medicine, but it did not respond. So, I continued with the previous powder, and his appetite returned immediately.[184p]

　　　　　成漏脉例第五十四

　　经云：陷脉为漏，留连肉腠。盖脉得寒则下陷，凝滞肌肉，故曰留连肉腠，是为冷漏。须用陷脉散、桂附丸温补之。　　【注　按疮疡为漏，皆因元气不足，营气不从，逆于肉理，或寒气相搏，稽留血脉，腐溃既久，阳气虚寒，外邪乘虚下陷，即成是患。若治其初患，当内用参、芪、归、朮，温补脾胃，外用桑枝葱熨，接引阳气，使自消散。若久而不能成脓，亦用前二法补助以速之。若脓既成而不溃，用艾于当头灸数炷以出之，却服十全大补汤。患者又当慎起居，节饮食，庶几收敛。若用冷针开刺，久而内出青脓，外色黑黯；或误用生肌散速其收敛，反助其邪，必成败证。】[185p]

Fifty-Fourth Example of Leaking Pulse

The classic states: the sinking pulse is considered leakage, lingering in the flesh’s pores. When the pulse is affected by cold, it sinks and stagnates in the muscles, hence it is said to linger in the flesh’s pores, referred to as cold leakage. One must use Sinking Pulse Powder and Cinnamon and Aconite Pill to warm and tonify.

**[Note] According to sores and ulcers classified as leakage, these arise from insufficient vital energy, with the nutritive energy not following properly, reverting against the flesh’s structure, or being impeded by cold, blocking the blood vessels, which leads to decay over time. When Yang energy becomes deficient and cold, external pathogens take advantage of the weakness and cause sinking, resulting in this condition.

If treated in the initial stage, one should internally use Ginseng, Astragalus, Angelica, and Atractylodes to warm and tonify the spleen and stomach, while externally applying mulberry branches and scallions for moxibustion to guide the Yang energy for spontaneous resolution. If it takes too long to form pus, use the aforementioned methods to assist in hastening it.

If pus has formed but does not flow out, burn a few moxa cones directly on it to encourage drainage, and take the Comprehensive Boosting Decoction. The patient should also be careful with daily living and moderate their diet to facilitate recovery.

Should one mistakenly use cold needles for puncturing, it will lead to delayed internal emission of blue pus with a dark external appearance; or if they erroneously use a wound-healing powder to hasten closure, it will instead support the evil and lead to certain failure.**[185p]

　　　　　蜞针法第五十五

　　洪丞相治痈疽，初作先以笔管一个，入蚂蜞一条，以管口对疮头，使蜞吮疮脓血，其毒即散。如疮大须换三四条。若吮正穴，蜞必死矣。累试累效。若血不止，以藕节上泥涂之。若疮头未明，以井边泥涂上先干处即是。　　【注　按痈疽既成，毒血凝聚于外，可用此法吮去固善，但能治其末耳。又当审其邪在表里，并元气虚实而药之，斯内外合一，而为万全之治也。】[186p]

Technique of the Cicada Needle, No. 55

Prime Minister Hong treated carbuncles and ulcers by initially using a single pen tube to insert a cicada. The mouth of the tube was directed at the center of the sore, allowing the cicada to suck out the pus and blood, thereby dispersing the poison. If the sore was larger, it was necessary to replace it with three or four cicadas. If the cicada sucked the precise spot, it would surely die. This method was repeatedly tested with consistent results. If the bleeding did not stop, apply mud from lotus stems to the area. If the sore was not clearly defined, applying mud from the edge of a well to the dry parts first would suffice.

Note: Once a carbuncle or ulcer has formed, the toxic blood coagulates externally, making this method effective in drawing it out, but it only addresses the surface issue. It is also essential to assess whether the illness is superficial or deep, and to consider the condition of the vital energy when administering medication, as this integrates both internal and external treatments, leading to a complete cure.[186p]

　　　　　櫽括关键处治

　　一疮疡用药，当审其经络受证标本虚实以治之。不可泥于热毒内攻，专用寒凉克伐之剂，亏损脾胃气血，多致有误。若肿高焮痛者，邪气实也，先用神仙活命饮，后用托里消毒散。漫肿微痛者，真气虚也，用托里散；如不应，加姜桂。若不作脓不腐溃，阳气虚也，用四君子加黄芪、肉桂。若脓既出而反痛，气血虚也，用八珍散。不生肌，不收敛，脾气虚也，四君子加芍药、木香。又当舍时从证，如肿痛，烦躁发热，饮冷便秘，脉洪数实，是为五实，虽在严寒，必用大苦寒之剂，泻其阳以救其阴。[187p]

Treatment of Ulcers in Key Areas

When treating a sore or ulcer, one must examine the meridians to ascertain the symptoms and the nature of the condition, whether it is deficient or excessive. One should not be fixated on treating internal heat and toxins solely with cold and cooling remedies, as this can deplete the spleen and stomach's qi and blood, leading to mistakes. If there is swelling, elevation, and pain, it indicates a presence of pathogenic factors; one should first use the "Divine Immortal's Reviving Decoction," followed by the "Tuo Li Dispersing and Detoxifying Powder." For mild swelling and slight pain, it suggests a deficiency of true qi; in this case, use the "Tuo Li Powder." If there is no response, add ginger and cinnamon. If there is no suppuration or necrosis, it suggests yang deficiency; use "Four Gentlemen Decoction" with Astragalus and cinnamon. If pus is present but pain recurs, it indicates deficiency of qi and blood; use "Eight Treasure Powder." If the wound does not generate flesh and does not close up, it points to spleen qi deficiency; treat with "Four Gentlemen Decoction," adding peony and nutmeg. Additionally, treatment should be based on timing and specific symptoms; if there is swelling and pain, agitation and fever, cold drinks leading to constipation, and a rapid, strong pulse, it indicates five excesses. Even in extreme cold, one must use very bitter and cold remedies to drain the yang to save the yin.[187p]

若脉细皮寒，泻利肠鸣，不食呕吐，手足逆冷，是为五虚，虽在盛暑，必用大辛热之剂，散其阴以回其阳。若执其常法，则误矣。　　一疮疡作呕，如热盛焮痛，邪气实也，用仙方活命饮解之。若因作脓焮痛，胃气虚也，用托里消毒散主之。脓熟胀痛，气血虚也，用托里散，或针以泄之。焮痛便秘，热蕴于内也，用内疏黄连汤导之。寒药伤胃者，托里建中汤。食少胃寒者，托里益中汤。中虚寒淫者，托里温中汤。肝木乘脾土者，托里益清汤。胃脘停痰者，托里清中汤。脾虚自病者，托里益黄散。郁结伤脾者，托里越鞠汤。　　一疮疡用围药，如肿痛热渴，证属纯阳，宜内服济阴丹，外敷抑阳散。[188p]

If the pulse is thin and the skin is cold, with diarrhea, abdominal rumbling, lack of appetite, vomiting, and cold extremities, this is classified as the Five Deficiencies. Even in the height of summer, it is essential to use a strong, warming remedy to disperse the cold and restore the yang. If one adheres to the usual methods, it would be a mistake.

When a sore or ulcer causes vomiting, resembling severe heat and pain due to excess evil qi, one should use the Xianfang Huoming Decoction to resolve it. If there is pus and pain due to the stomach qi being deficient, the Tori Xiaodu San should be used. If there is swelling and pain from mature pus, indicating deficiency of qi and blood, the Tori San can be applied, or acupuncture can be used to relieve it. If there is pain and constipation, indicating heat accumulation internally, the Nei Shu Huanglian Decoction should be utilized to induce it. For cold medicines harming the stomach, the Tori Jianzhong Decoction is appropriate. For reduced appetite and stomach coldness, the Tori Yizhong Decoction is recommended. For middle deficiency with excess cold, the Tori Wenzhong Decoction should be prescribed. If the liver’s wood overacts on the spleen’s earth, use the Tori Yiqing Decoction. For stagnation of phlegm in the stomach area, the Tori Qingzhong Decoction can be used. If the spleen is deficient due to its own illness, apply the Tori Yihuang San. If there is stagnation harming the spleen, use the Tori Yueju Decoction.

Regarding a sore or ulcer treated with external medicines, if there is swelling, pain, and thirst, indicating pure yang, it is appropriate to take the Jiyin Dan internally and apply the Yeyang San externally.[188p]

若似肿非肿，似痛不痛，似溃不溃，属半阴半阳，宜内服冲和汤，外敷阴阳散。若微肿微痛，或色黯不痛，或坚硬不溃，证属纯阴，宜内服回阳汤，外敷抑阴散。　　一疮疡作痛，若大便秘结者，用内疏黄连汤；热毒炽盛者，仙方活命饮；瘀血凝滞者，乳香定痛散；作脓而痛者，托里消毒散。脓胀而痛者，针之。脓溃而痛者，补之。气虚而痛者，四君、归、芪。血虚而痛者，四物、参、芪。肾虚而痛者，六味地黄丸。口干作渴，或小便频数，加减八味丸。[189p]

If it appears swollen but is not, seems painful but isn't, or seems to be festering but isn't, it belongs to a state of half-yin and half-yang. It should be treated with an internal decoction of Harmonizing Soup and an external application of Yin-Yang Powder. If there is slight swelling and slight pain, or a dark color without pain, or hardness without festering, this indicates a pure-yin condition. It should be treated with an internal decoction of Returning Yang Soup and an external application of Restraining Yin Powder.

For a sore or ulcer that is painful, if there is constipation, use the Internal Soothe Huanglian Decoction; if there is intense heat and toxicity, use the Immortal Formula for Life; if there is stagnant blood, use the Frankincense Pain-Relieving Powder; if it is festering and painful, use the Tuo Li Disinfecting Powder. For painful swelling with pus, treat it with a needle. If it has festered and is painful, then nourish it. For pain from qi deficiency, use the Four Gentlemen, Gui, and Qi formulas. For pain from blood deficiency, use the Four Substances, Shen, and Qi formulas. For pain due to kidney deficiency, use the Six-Flavor Rehmannia Pill. For dryness and thirst, or frequent urination, adjust with the Eight Flavor Pill.[189p]

　　一疮疡气脱陷，或误服克伐，或脓血大泄，或吐泻劳役，或误行房事，若发热烦热，头痛头运，便血目赤，烦喘、自汗、盗汗，气短唾痰，体倦热渴，意欲饮水，投水，身热，恶寒，憎寒，恶衣，扬手掷足，汗出如水，腰背反张，呻吟不绝，脉浮洪大，此无根虚火假热之证；若畏寒头痛，咳逆呕吐，耳聩目蒙，小便自遗，或时淋沥，泻利肠鸣，里急腹痛，玉茎短缩，冷汗时出，齿浮痛，肢体麻痹，或厥冷身痛，咬舌嚙唇，舌本强硬，呃逆喘促，脉微沉细，此危殆之证，但见一二，急用大剂参附汤补之，多得复生。　　一疮疡溃后发热烦躁，若发热无寐，血虚也，圣愈汤；自汗不止，气虚也，四君子加黄芪、五味子；发热烦躁，肉瞤筋惕，气血虚也，八珍汤；大渴面赤，脉洪大而浮，阴虚发热也，当归补血汤；肢体微热，烦躁面赤，脉沉微，阴盛发躁也，四君、姜、附。[190p]

When there is a sore with gas escaping and sinking in, it may be due to mistakenly taking harsh medicine, or excessive pus and blood loss, or from vomiting and diarrhea due to overexertion, or from improper sexual activity. If there is fever and irritability, headache and distress, blood in the stool and red eyes, restlessness, spontaneous sweating, night sweats, shortness of breath with phlegm, fatigue, heat thirst, a desire to drink water but unable to, feeling hot, aversion to cold, dislike for clothing, excessive movement of hands and feet, profuse sweating, back arching, and continuous moaning, with a pulse that is floating and large, this indicates a condition of false heat from rootlessness; if there is fear of cold, headache, reverse cough, vomiting, deafness, blurred vision, involuntary urination, or intermittent dripping, diarrhea, abdominal sounds, urgent abdominal pain, retraction of the penis, cold sweat, toothache, limb numbness, or cold limbs with pain, biting the tongue or lips, a tongue that is stiff, belching with shortness of breath, and a delicate and sinking pulse, this is a dangerous sign; even observing one or two of these symptoms requires urgent use of a strong dose of Ginseng and Aconite Decoction for supplementation, leading to recovery.

After a sore ulcerates, if there is fever and irritability, and if the fever prevents sleep, this indicates blood deficiency, treat with Shengyu Decoction; if there is persistent sweating, this indicates qi deficiency, treat with Four Gentlemen Decoction plus Astragalus and Schisandra; if there is fever and irritability, muscles twitch and tendons are taut, indicating deficiency of both qi and blood, treat with Eight Precious Decoction; if there is extreme thirst with a red face and a floating large pulse, indicating yin deficiency leading to heat, treat with Angelica Blood Supplement Decoction; if there is slight limb warmth, irritability, a red face, and a sinking and weak pulse, indicating excessive yin leading to irritability, treat with Four Gentlemen, Ginger, and Aconite.[190p]

　　一疮疡大便秘结，若作渴饮冷，其脉洪数而有力者，属实火，宜用内疏黄连汤；若口干饮汤，其脉浮大而无力者，属气虚，宜用加味八珍汤；若饮食虽多，肚腹不胀，此内火销烁，切不可通；若腹痞胀而不通者，乃因直肠干涸，以猪胆汁导之；若误行疏导，复伤元气，则不能敛溃。　　一疮疡大便泄泻，若因寒凉伤脾，六君加砂仁；脾气虚弱，六君煎送二神丸；脾虚下陷，补中益气送二神丸；命门火衰，用八味丸料煎送四神丸；肾虚不固，姜附汤加茱萸、五味；脾肾虚寒，参附汤送四神丸；脉沉而细，饮食不下，用姜附汤，多有复生者。[191p]

When there is a sore with constipation, if the patient feels thirsty and drinks cold water, with a pulse that is strong and rapid, this indicates excess heat; internal cooling with Huanglian Decoction is recommended. If there is dryness in the mouth and drinking soup, with a pulse that is floating, large, and weak, this indicates deficiency of qi; the modified Eight Treasures Decoction should be used. If the appetite is good but the abdomen does not swell, this indicates internal heat dissipating; it should not be purged. If there is abdominal distension and no relief, this is due to dry rectum, and pig bile should be used to guide it. If purging mistakenly is used, it could injure the original qi and hinder recovery.

For a sore with diarrhea, if caused by cold harming the spleen, use Six Gentlemen Decoction with sand ginger. If spleen qi is weak, send it with the Six Gentlemen Decoction and Ershen Pill. If the spleen is weak and sagging, Tonify the Middle and Benefit Qi Decoction with Ershen Pill is appropriate. If the kidney fire is weak, use Eight Flavor Pill decocted with Four Shen Pill. If the kidney is weak and unstable, use Jiangfu Decoction with evodia and five flavors. For spleen and kidney cold deficiency, use Shenfu Decoction with Four Shen Pill. If the pulse is deep and thin, and food cannot be ingested, use Jiangfu Decoction; many recover from this.[191p]

　　一疮疡小便频数，或茎中濇痛者，乃肾经阳气亏损，阴无以化之恶证也，用加减八味丸以补阴；足胫逆冷者，用八味丸以补阳；小便频而黄者，四物加参、朮、麦门、五味以滋肺肾；小便短而黄者，补中益气加山药、麦门、五味以补肾；若热结膀胱而不利者，五淋散以清热；脾肺气燥而不化者，黄芩清肺饮以滋阴；若膀胱阴虚，阳无以生者，宜滋肾丸；膀胱阳虚，阴无以化者，宜肾气丸；若老人阴痿，精内败者，用加减八味丸加车前、牛膝；如不应，加附子；若大小便牵痛，愈痛则愈便，愈便则愈痛，以前药加附子，多有生者。苟用黄蘗、知母淡渗之剂，既泻真阳，复损真阴，速其危矣。[192p]

A sore accompanied by frequent urination, or pain in the perineum, indicates a deficiency in the kidney's yang energy, which cannot properly transform the negative condition. Use the modified Eight Flavor Pill to replenish the yin. For cold in the legs, use the Eight Flavor Pill to replenish the yang. If urination is frequent and yellow, use the Four Substance Decoction with ginseng, atractylodes, barley, and schisandra to nourish the lungs and kidneys. If urination is short and yellow, supplement with the Middle-Boosting Qi Decoction adding yam, barley, and schisandra to strengthen the kidneys. If there is heat stagnating in the bladder leading to difficulty urinating, use the Five Lin Powder to clear heat. If the spleen and lung's qi is dry and unable to transform, use Huangqin Qingsuan Decoction to nourish the yin. If the bladder is yin deficient and unable to generate warmth, consider the Nourishing Kidney Pill; if the bladder's yang is deficient and cannot transform fluids, consider the Kidney Qi Pill. For elderly men with impotence due to internal decay, use the modified Eight Flavor Pill adding plantago and achyranthes; if there is no response, add aconite. If there is pain during urination and defecation, the more pain there is, the more frequent urination occurs, leading to increased pain—previous medicines may be augmented with aconite for better results. Using Huangbo and Zhimu, which drain excessive true yang, will also damage true yin and hasten danger.[192p]

　　一疮疡作渴，焮痛发热，便利调和者，上焦热也，用竹叶石膏汤；肿痛发热，大便秘濇者，内脏热也，用四顺清凉饮；焮肿痛盛者，热毒蕴结也，用仙方活命饮；漫肿微痛者，气血虚壅也，用补中益气汤；若因胃火消烁而津液短少者，用竹叶黄芪汤；若因胃气虚而不能生津液者，用补中益气汤；若因胃气伤而内亡津液者，用七味白朮散；若因肾水干涸作渴，或口舌干燥者，用加减八味丸。或先口干作渴，小便频数而后患疽；或疽愈后作渴饮水，或舌黄干硬，小便数而疽生者，尤其恶也。苟能逆知其因，预服加减八味丸、补中益气汤以滋化源，可免是患。　　一疮疡出血，因五脏之气亏损，虚火动而错经妄行也。[193p]

When a sore causes thirst, along with burning pain and fever, and the person has a smooth and balanced stool, it indicates heat in the upper burner; use the bamboo leaf and gypsum decoction. If there is swelling, pain, and fever with constipation, it indicates heat in the internal organs; use the Four Shun Qing Liang drink. For severe swelling and pain, indicating accumulated heat and toxins, use the Xian Fang Huo Ming drink. For diffuse swelling with slight pain, indicating deficiency and stagnation of qi and blood, use the Bu Zhong Yi Qi decoction. If thirst arises due to stomach fire consuming fluids, use the bamboo leaf and astragalus decoction. If thirst arises from a deficiency of stomach qi that cannot produce fluids, use the Bu Zhong Yi Qi decoction. If thirst arises from damage to stomach qi, leading to the loss of bodily fluids, use the Seven Flavor Atractylodes powder. If thirst arises from depleted kidney water, or dryness of the mouth and tongue, use the modified Eight Flavor Pill. Sometimes, thirst may first appear with dry mouth, frequent urination, followed by the occurrence of sores; or thirst may arise after the sores have healed. If the tongue is yellow, dry, and hard, and there is frequent urination with sores developing, this is particularly concerning. If one can discern the cause in advance, taking the modified Eight Flavor Pill or Bu Zhong Yi Qi decoction to nourish the source of digestion can help avoid such afflictions.

Sores that bleed result from a deficiency in the vital energy of the internal organs, causing empty fire to move abnormally and disrupt the meridians.[193p]

若因肝热而血妄行者，四物加炒栀、丹皮、苓、朮；肝虚不能藏血者，六味地黄丸；心虚不能主血者，四物加炒连、丹皮、苓、朮；若脾虚热不能统血者，四君加炒栀、丹皮；若脾经郁结者，用归脾汤加五味子；若脾肺气虚者，用补中益气加五味子；若气血俱虚者，用十全大补；若阴火动者，用六味丸加五味子。　　一疮疡用针，当辨生熟浅深。若小按即痛者，脓浅也；大按方痛者，脓深也。按之而不复起者，脓未成也；按之而即起者，脓已成也。[194p]

If due to liver heat there is chaotic movement of blood, use Siwu Decoction plus fried Gardenia, Danpi, Poria, and Atractylodes; if the liver is deficient and cannot store blood, use Liuwei Dihuang Pills; if the heart is deficient and cannot govern blood, use Siwu Decoction plus fried Lianhua, Danpi, Poria, and Atractylodes; if the spleen is deficient and cannot control blood, use Sijunzi Decoction plus fried Gardenia and Danpi; if the spleen meridian is blocked, use Guipi Decoction plus Schisandra; if both spleen and lung qi are deficient, use Buzhong Yiqi Decoction plus Schisandra; if both qi and blood are deficient, use Shi Quan Da Bu Decoction; if there is movement of yin fire, use Liuwei Pills plus Schisandra.

For sores and ulcers needing a needle, we must distinguish between fresh and mature, shallow and deep. If gentle pressure causes pain, the pus is shallow; if firm pressure causes pain, the pus is deep. If pressing does not cause it to rise again, the pus is not yet formed; if pressing causes it to rise immediately, the pus is already formed.[194p]

若脓生而即针，则徒泄其气血而脓反难成；若脓熟而不针，则腐溃益深，疮口难敛。若疮深而针浅，则内脓不出，外血反泄，若疮浅而针深，则内脓虽出，良肉反伤。其元气虚弱，必先补而后针，不论尻神。若脓出而反痛，或烦躁呕逆，皆由血气亏损，宜急补之。不论尻神者，盖因患处已溃故也。　　一疮疡肌肉不生：若赤色而不生者，血热也，四物汤加牡丹皮；晡熟内热，血虚也，四君子加归、地、丹皮；若脓水清稀，气血俱虚也，十全大补汤；食少体倦，脾气虚也，补中益气汤；烦热作渴，起居如常，胃火也，竹叶黄芪汤；烦热作渴，日晡热甚，肾虚也，用加减八味丸。[195p]

If pus forms and is immediately punctured, it simply drains the vital energy and blood, making the pus even harder to resolve; if the pus is ripe but not punctured, the decay deepens and the wound mouth is difficult to close. If the wound is deep but the puncture is shallow, the internal pus does not come out, while external blood leaks; if the wound is shallow but the puncture is deep, although the internal pus may flow out, it injures the healthy flesh. When the original vital energy is weak, replenishing must come before puncturing, without exception. If pus comes out but there is pain or irritability with nausea and vomiting, it is due to the depletion of blood and energy, requiring urgent replenishment. The mention of not considering the vital energy pertains to the fact that the affected area is already decaying.

For a wound or ulcer where muscle does not grow: if it is red and does not grow, it is due to blood heat; use Four Substance Decoction with the addition of peony root. If there is internal heat and blood deficiency, use Four Gentlemen Decoction with added angelica, earth, and peony root. If the pus is clear and watery, both vital energy and blood are deficient; use Ten Complete Great Tonifying Decoction. If there is little food intake and fatigue, it indicates spleen energy deficiency; use the Decoction for Augmenting Energy. If there is irritability and thirst, living normally, it indicates stomach fire; use Bamboo Leaf and Astragalus Decoction. If there is irritability and thirst, especially in the afternoon heat, it indicates kidney deficiency; use Modified Eight Flavor Pill.[195p]

　　　　　论多骨疽

　　多骨疽者，由疮疡久溃，气血不能营于患处，邪气陷袭，久则烂筋腐骨而脱出，属足三阴亏损之证也，用补中益气汤以固根本。若阴火发热者，佐以六味丸，壮水之主以镇阳光；阳气虚寒者，以八味丸，益火之源以消阴翳。外以附子饼葱熨法，祛散寒邪，补接荣气，则骨自脱，疮自敛也。夫肾主骨，若肾气亏损，其骨渐肿，荏苒岁月，溃而出骨，亦用前法。若投以克伐之剂，复伤真气，鲜有不误者。古今图书集成医部全录卷三百六十二

外科痈疽疔毒门

　　　　医学入门 【明　李梴】[196p]

On Osteomyelitis

Osteomyelitis arises when an ulcer has festered for a long time, failing to nourish the affected area with qi and blood. The pathogenic qi invades and, over time, decays the tendons and bones until they are expelled. This is associated with the deficiency of the three yin of the foot. Use the "Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang" (Tonifying the Middle and Benefiting Qi Decoction) to strengthen the foundation.

If there is heat from yin fire, add "Liu Wei Di Huang Wan" (Six-Flavor Rehmanniacapsule) to strengthen the water element and calm the yang. If there is deficiency and coldness of yang qi, use "Ba Wei Wan" (Eight-Flavor Pill) to nourish the source of fire and dispel the yin obstruction. Externally, apply a paste of aconite and scallion to dispel the cold evil and supplement the nourishing qi; thus, the bones will detach and the sores will heal naturally.
