Grind into fine powder, mix with fresh Dihuang juice for application around the edges, or with bitter wine root juice. For swelling, use juice from ground Shangalugengen. Apply fully if not yet suppurated; if there are raised areas, leave the ulcer opening exposed.[409p]

　　水师晶明　治诸发已破未破，皆洗。如成脓溃烂，最要洗净。去故肉，生新肉。洗后净干，再用角贴掺药，一日一次。　　大蘗皮　泽兰　莽草　荆芥　赤芍　山大黄　土白芷　土当归　独活各等分　　右銼粗散，用水一斗，入葱白、大椒、橘叶同煎熏洗。如已烂，入猪蹄下膝爪骨肉煎，可免干痛。洗净为度。
　　硇砂膏　治痈疽肿毒，并治瘰疬，点落疣痣等。　　硇砂生用，一钱　石矿灰一两，炒黄色　白丁香三钱，炒黄色　黄丹半斤，生用　碱一斤，淋水五碗　　右四味，研为极细末，次将碱水煎作一碗，成膏待冷，以前末入膏和匀，藏磁器中。一应毒物，以此膏点之。白丁香即麻雀儿屎，用坚尖者，不用软颓者。[410p]

The naval forces are clear and bright. Treat all lesions, whether they have burst or not, by washing. If there is pus and decay, it is crucial to clean thoroughly. Remove old flesh and bring forth new flesh. After washing, dry it completely, then apply medicated plaster made with powdered drugs once a day.

Components: Da Huang (Rhubarb), Ze Lan (Lanceleaf Aster), Mang Cao (Herb of Tricolor), Jing Jie (Schizonepeta), Chi Shao (Red Peony), Shan Da Huang (Rhubarb), Tu Bai Zhi (White Angelica), Tu Dang Gui (Earth Angelica), Du Huo (Angelica) – all in equal parts.

Grind them coarsely, use one bucket of water, add scallion whites, large peppers, and tangerine leaves to boil and fumigate for washing. If there is already decay, add pig’s feet below the knee into the bone and meat to boil, which can avoid dry pain. Clean thoroughly for best results.

Nü Sha Gao (Cinnabar Ointment) treats boils, abscesses, swellings, and also treats scrofula, warts, and moles.

Ingredients: Nü Sha (cinnabar) – 1 qian (3.3 grams), Stone Ash – 1 liang (37.5 grams), sautéed until yellow; White Clove – 3 qian (10 grams), sautéed until yellow; Yellow Lead – 0.5 jin (250 grams), raw; Alkaline Salt – 1 jin (500 grams), and 5 bowls of water.

Grind these four ingredients into an extremely fine powder, then boil the alkaline water until it becomes one bowl. Allow it to cool into a paste, mix in the powdered ingredients evenly, and store in a ceramic container. For any toxic substances, apply this ointment. White clove refers to the droppings of sparrows, using the firm and pointed kind, avoiding the soft and decayed.[410p]

　　六灰膏　治发背、疔疮、疖子、肿毒、疬疮、痔疮、痣子、疣子，其功用与硇砂膏同也。　　灰苋　桑木　枣木　荞麦科　茄科各烧为灰　石矿灰研细　　右件多少不妨，和匀，汤泡水淋，淋下之水，煎成膏如糊，装磁器中。一应毒物，以膏点之。若点疬疮痔疮，待烂去少许，再点之，再烂去，如是渐渐点去。
　　援生膏　治诸般恶疮，及瘰疬鼠疮才起者，点破即愈。　　血竭一钱　蟾酥　轻粉各三钱　麝香五分　雄黄五钱　乳香　没药各一钱　　右件俱为极细末，再用荞麦秸灰或真炭灰一斗三升，淋灰汤八九碗，用栗柴或桑柴文武火煎作三碗，取一碗收留，将二碗盛于好磁器内，候温将药末入灰汤内，用铁瓢或桑柳枝右搅，又用好细石灰一升入药，灰汤搅匀，取出候冷，过宿盛于小白磁罐内。凡遇诸恶疮，点在当头，一日二次，次日又一次。疮头食破约五分，血水出为妙。恐日久药干，将前收留灰汤和用。[411p]

Liu Huai Gao treats various ailments such as hair loss, carbuncles, boils, swollen toxins, ulcers, hemorrhoids, moles, and warts, with effects similar to that of Nao Sha Gao. The ingredients include ash from gray amaranth, mulberry wood, jujube wood, buckwheat, and nightshade, all burned to ash. The quantity of these can vary; mix them evenly, steep in water, and strain the water to boil down to a thick paste, which is to be stored in ceramic containers. Apply the paste to any toxic lesions. For ulcers or hemorrhoids, wait until part of the lesion decays before applying again, repeating the process gradually.

Yuan Sheng Gao treats various malignant sores, especially newly formed ones like scrofula or mouse sores; puncturing them leads to healing. The ingredients include one qian (3 grams) of blood gall, three qian each of toad oil and light powder, five fen (1.5 grams) of musk, five qian of realgar, and one qian each of myrrh and frankincense. All ingredients are to be ground into a fine powder. Additionally, use one dou (approximately 10 liters) and three sheng (roughly 0.54 liters) of buckwheat straw ash or real charcoal ash, steep in eight or nine bowls of ash soup. Use chestnut or mulberry wood to simmer down to three bowls, reserve one bowl, and store the remaining two bowls in good ceramic containers. Once cooled, mix the powdered medicine into the ash soup, stir well with an iron ladle or mulberry twig, then add one sheng of good fine lime to the mixture. Allow it to cool, and then store it overnight in a small white ceramic jar. Whenever encountering malignant sores, apply to the affected area two times a day; the next day, apply once more. Ideally, the sore will break open for optimal healing, and if the medicine dries out over time, use the previously reserved ash soup to rehydrate it.[411p]

　　替针丸　治痈疽已溃未破，或破后脓出不快者。　　白丁香　硇砂　没药　乳香各一字　石灰药汁内种糯米十四粒。其法用石灰五升，炉灰三升，以水五升，淋取清汁，入大锅内熬浓汁，至三二升，用瓦器盛贮。临用时，以小青盏盛取半盏浓汁，却用皮纸贴盏中浓汁面上安定，然后取糯米十四粒，种在皮纸面上一宿即是。　　右同为细末，糯米饭丸如麦粒大，每用一粒，未破用津贴疮头薄处即破，脓滞不快则用一粒纳疮口内，使脓不滞，好肉易生。　　又方
　　雄雀粪二十粒　硇砂　陈仓米　没药各一字　　右研匀，以米饭丸如粟大，每用一粒，贴疮口眼中，即溃脓出。[412p]

Replacing Needle Pills: For treating abscesses that have already suppurated but have not ruptured, or for those that are slow to drain after breaking.

Ingredients:

  • White Clove
  • Nansha
  • Myrrh
  • Frankincense (each one character)
  • Fourteen grains of glutinous rice soaked in lime juice.

Method:
Take five liters of lime, three liters of ash, and five liters of water. Extract the clear juice and boil it in a large pot until it reduces to about three to two liters. Store this thickened juice in a pottery container. When ready to use, pour half a cup of thick juice into a small blue cup, then carefully cover the surface of the thick juice with a piece of paper to secure it. Afterward, place the fourteen grains of glutinous rice on the paper and let them sit overnight.

Preparation:
Grind the above ingredients into a fine powder. Form glutinous rice pills the size of wheat grains. For use, if the abscess has not yet broken, place one pill gently on the thin edge of the sore, and it will rupture. If the pus is stagnant, insert one pill into the sore to facilitate drainage, promoting healthy flesh growth.

Another Formula:
Use twenty grains of male sparrow droppings, one character each of nansha, aged rice, and myrrh. Grind these evenly, form into rice pills the size of millet, and place one on the eye of the abscess to promote drainage.[412p]

　　替针丁香丸
　　草乌尖　硇砂　白丁香坚者
　　右为末，酸酢调点，将破者令速溃。若急则无如刀快。蜞针一法亦妙，见后。
　　托里温中汤　治疮为寒变而内陷者，脓出清稀，皮肤凉，心下痞满，肠鸣切痛，大便微溏，食则呕，气短促，呃逆不绝，不得安卧，时有昏愦。　　丁香　陈皮　沉香　茴香　益智仁各一钱　木香一钱半　黑附子炮去皮脐，四钱　羌活　干姜炮，各三钱　甘草炙，二钱
　　加味十全汤　治痈疽溃后，补气血，进饮食。　　黄芪蒸　地黄蒸　当归　川芎　人参　茯苓　芍药炒　白朮　陈皮各一两　粉草炙　桂心　五味子各半两　乌药七钱　　右(口父)咀，每服一两，用水一碗，生姜五片，枣二枚，同煎，分作二服。留滓晒干为末服之。丹溪云：加味十全汤，须看年之老壮，资之强弱，证之缓急，时之寒热，加减用之。[413p]

Ding Xiang Wan (Clove Pill)
Contains: aconite tips, realgar, and firm clove.
Grind the above into a powder, mix with vinegar to adjust, and apply to those that are about to burst for quick relief. In emergencies, nothing is as swift as a knife. The method of the "Qin Needle" is also exquisite; see later.

Tuo Li Wen Zhong Decoction
For treating sores that have turned cold and sunk inwards, resulting in clear, thin pus, cool skin, a feeling of fullness below the heart, rumbling in the intestines with sharp pain, slightly loose stools, nausea upon eating, shortness of breath, continuous belching, inability to lie down comfortably, and occasional fainting.
Contains: clove, dried tangerine peel, sandalwood, fennel, and each one qian; mu xiang one and a half qian; black fuzi processed and with skin removed, four qian; qiang huo and dried ginger, both three qian; roasted licorice, two qian.

Jia Wei Shi Quan Decoction
For treating carbuncles and abscesses after they have burst, tonifying qi and blood, and promoting food intake.
Contains: steamed astragalus, steamed rehmannia, angelica, chuanxiong, ginseng, poria, fried peony, white atractylodes, and dried tangerine peel, each one liang; powdered grass, cinnamon heart, and schisandra, half a liang; and seven qian of wuyao.
Grind the above for each dose of one liang, using a bowl of water, five slices of fresh ginger, and two dates, all simmered together, divided into two doses. Keep the residue, dry it, and powder it for consumption. Danxi says: Jia Wei Shi Quan Decoction must consider the patient's age, strength, and the urgency of the condition, adjusting according to time and temperature.[413p]

　　补中益气汤　治疮疡之人，元气不足，四肢倦怠，口干发热，饮食无味，或饮食失节，或劳倦身热，脉洪大而无力，或头痛恶寒自汗，或气高而喘，身热而烦。　　黄芪炙，一钱五分　甘草炙　人参　当归酒拌　白朮炒，各一钱　升麻　柴胡　陈皮各三分　作一剂，水二锺，姜三片，枣二枚，煎一锺，空心服。
　　人参养荣汤　治溃疡发热，或恶寒，或四肢倦怠，肌肉消瘦，面色痿黄，吸吸短气，饮食无味，不能收敛，或气血原不足，不能收敛。若大疮愈后，多服之，不变他病。　　白芍药一钱半　人参　陈皮　黄芪蜜炙　桂心　当归酒拌　白朮　甘草炙，各一钱　熟地黄酒拌　五味子炒杵　茯苓各七分半　远志去心炒，五分　作一剂，水二锺，姜三片，枣一枚，煎八分，食前服。[414p]

Buzhong Yiqi Decoction: This is used for individuals with ulcers, characterized by insufficient vital energy, fatigue in the limbs, dry mouth, fever, tastelessness in food, irregular eating, fatigue leading to body heat, a strong but weak pulse, or symptoms such as headaches, chills, spontaneous sweating, shortness of breath, and overall agitation. Ingredients: 1.5 taels of roasted astragalus, 1 tael of roasted licorice, 1 tael of ginseng, 1 tael of wine-mixed angelica, 1 tael of fried white atractylodes, 0.3 taels each of bulbus caulis, bupleurum, and dried mandarin peel. Prepare one dose with two decanters of water, add three slices of ginger and two jujubes, decoct to one decanter, and take on an empty stomach.

Ren Shen Yang Rong Decoction: This is used for ulcer-related fever, characterized by chills, fatigue in the limbs, muscle wastage, a pale yellow complexion, shortness of breath, tastelessness in food, and inability to consolidate, or for cases where there is insufficient qi and blood, leading to failure to consolidate. Particularly useful after large ulcers heal, it should be taken frequently without worsening other conditions. Ingredients: 1.5 taels of white peony root, 1 tael each of ginseng, dried mandarin peel, honey-roasted astragalus, cinnamon heart, wine-mixed angelica, fried white atractylodes, and roasted licorice; 0.75 taels each of cooked rehmannia (wine-mixed) and ground schisandra; 0.5 taels of toasted polygala (seed removed). Prepare one dose with two decanters of water, add three slices of ginger and one jujube, decoct to eight tenths, and take before meals.[414p]

　　四君子汤　治脾胃虚弱，或因克伐肿痛不散，溃敛不能，宜用此以补脾胃，诸证自愈。若误用攻毒，七恶随至，脾胃虚弱，饮食少思，或食而难化，或欲作呕，或大便不实。若脾胃气虚，疮口出血，吐血便血，尤宜用之，盖气能摄血故也。凡气血俱虚之证，宜于前汤但加当归。脾胃既旺，饮食自进，阴血自生。若用四物沉阴之剂，脾胃复伤，诸证蜂起。若命门火衰而脾土虚寒，必用八味丸以补土母。　　人参　茯苓　白朮各二钱　甘草炙，一钱　　右，姜枣水煎服。

　　六君子汤　治脾胃虚弱，或寒凉克伐，肿痛不消，或不溃敛，宜服此汤，以壮营气，诸证自愈。　　即四君子汤加陈皮、半夏。

　　异功散　治脾胃虚弱，饮食少思。
　　即四君子汤加陈皮。[415p]

Four Gentlemen Decoction treats weakness of the spleen and stomach, which may cause swelling and pain that does not dissipate, and inability to heal wounds. It is suitable for replenishing the spleen and stomach, and the various symptoms will resolve on their own. If one mistakenly uses a purging remedy, seven misfortunes will follow: weakness of the spleen and stomach, reduced appetite, difficulty in digesting food, nausea, or unsatisfactory bowel movements. If there is qi deficiency of the spleen and stomach, leading to bleeding from ulcers or vomiting and passing blood, this remedy is particularly indicated, as qi can contain blood. In cases of both qi and blood deficiency, it is advisable to add Dang Gui (Angelica sinensis) to the above decoction. When the spleen and stomach are thriving, nourishment will naturally increase, leading to the generation of yin blood. However, if one uses yin-replenishing formulas, the spleen and stomach may be harmed, resulting in a surge of symptoms. If the fire of Mingmen (the Gate of Life) is weak and the spleen earth is cold and deficient, one must use the Eight Flavor Pill to replenish the Earth Mother.

Ingredients: Ginseng, Poria, Angelica (each 2 qian), and honey-fried licorice (1 qian). Boil with ginger and jujube in water.

Six Gentlemen Decoction treats weakness of the spleen and stomach, which may be exacerbated by cold and dampness, causing swelling and pain that does not diminish, or inability to heal. This decoction is recommended to strengthen the nutritive qi, and the various symptoms will resolve on their own. It is the Four Gentlemen Decoction with the addition of dried tangerine peel and pinellia.

Different Function Powder treats weakness of the spleen and stomach with reduced appetite. It is the Four Gentlemen Decoction with the addition of dried tangerine peel.[415p]

　　四物汤　洽血虚发热，或因失血，或因克伐，或因溃后致晡热内热，烦躁不安，皆宜服之。经云：血生于脾。若脾虚不能生血者，宜用四君子汤，加当归酒炒、白朮以补脾。
　　熟地黄　当归各三钱　芍药二钱　川芎一钱半　　右，水煎服。

　　八珍汤　调和荣卫，顺理阴阳，滋养血气，进美饮食，退虚热，此气血虚之大药也。　　当归酒拌　川芎　芍药炒　熟地黄酒拌　人参　白朮炒　茯苓各一钱　甘草炒，五分　作一剂，水二锺，姜三片，枣二枚，煎八分，食前服。
　　十全大补汤：治溃疡发热，或恶寒，或作痛，或脓多或清，或自汗盗汗，及流注、瘰疬、便毒，久不作脓，或脓成不溃，溃而不敛，或血气不足之人，结肿未成脓者，宜加枳壳、香附、连翘，服之自消。　　人参　肉桂　地黄酒洗蒸焙　川芎　茯苓　白芍药炒　白朮土炒　黄芪用盐水拌炒　当归酒拌，各一钱　甘草炙，五分　作一剂，用水二锺，姜枣煎服。[416p]

Si Wu Decoction: This is suitable for conditions of blood deficiency with fever, which may result from loss of blood, or from actions that harm the body, or after ulcers leading to afternoon fevers and internal heat, causing restlessness. It is advised to take this. The classics say: "Blood is produced in the spleen." If the spleen is deficient and cannot generate blood, it is recommended to use the Si Jun Zi Decoction, adding wine-stir-fried Angelica and Atractylodes to nourish the spleen.
Ingredients: 9 grams of Rehmannia, 9 grams of Angelica, 6 grams of Peony, and 4.5 grams of Ligusticum. Decoction with water to take.

Ba Zhen Decoction: This harmonizes the nutrient and protective Qi, balances yin and yang, nourishes blood and Qi, promotes healthy eating, and dispels vacant heat. It is a powerful remedy for Qi and blood deficiency.
Preparation: Mix Angelica with wine, stir-fried Ligusticum, stir-fried Peony, and wine-mixed Rehmannia, each 4.5 grams; 4.5 grams of Ginseng; stir-fried Atractylodes and Poria, each 4.5 grams; 2.5 grams of stir-fried Licorice. Combine into one dose, using 480 ml of water, 3 slices of ginger, and 2 dates, decocting down to 240 ml to take before meals.

Shi Quan Da Bu Decoction: Used for treating ulceration fever, chills, pain, excessive pus or clear discharge, spontaneous sweating or night sweats, as well as for abscesses, scrofula, toxic stool, or long-lasting pus formation, whether it has not formed or has formed but is not discharging properly, or for individuals deficient in blood and Qi, with swelling that has not formed pus, it is advisable to add bitter orange peel, Cyperus, and Forsythia for natural resolution.
Preparation: 4.5 grams of Ginseng, 4.5 grams of Cinnamon, steam-baked Rehmannia with wine, 4.5 grams of Ligusticum, 4.5 grams of Poria, stir-fried White Peony and salt-fried Atractylodes, both 4.5 grams; wine-mixed Angelica 4.5 grams; and 2.5 grams of roasted Licorice. Combine into one dose with 480 ml of water, adding ginger and dates for decoction.[416p]

　　归脾汤　治忧思伤脾，血虚发热，食少体倦；或脾不能摄血，以致妄行吐下；或健忘怔忡，惊悸少寐；或心脾作痛，自汗盗汗；或肢体肿痛，大便不调；或妇人经候不准，晡热内热；或唇疮流注等证，不能消散溃敛。　　白朮　白茯苓　黄芪炒　当归　龙眼肉　远志肉　人参　酸枣仁炒，各一钱　木香五分　甘草炙，三分　　右，姜枣水煎服。

　　黄芪人参汤　治诸疮破后，食少无睡，及有虚热，秽气所触者。　　黄芪二钱　人参　白朮　麦门冬　苍朮　陈皮　升麻　五味子　当归身　甘草各一钱　黄蘗炒，四分　炒曲五分　　右作一服，水二锺，煎至一锺，食远服。[417p]

Guipi Decoction: Treats spleen damage due to worry and thought, blood deficiency causing heat, decreased appetite, and body fatigue; or spleen's inability to control blood, resulting in erratic behaviors like vomiting and diarrhea; or forgetfulness, restlessness, palpitations, and insomnia; or heart and spleen pain, spontaneous sweating, and night sweats; or swelling and pain in limbs, and constipation issues; or irregular menstrual cycles and internal heat; or lip sores and leakage that cannot disperse or heal.

Ingredients: Bai Zhu, Bai Fu Ling, Huang Qi (roasted), Dang Gui, Longan flesh, Yuan Zhi flesh, Ren Shen, and Suan Zao Ren (roasted) each 1 qian; Mu Xiang 5 fen; Gan Cao (stir-fried) 3 fen. Prepare by decocting with ginger and jujube water.

Huang Qi and Ren Shen Decoction: Treats after-sore conditions following injury, lack of appetite, insomnia, and cases of虚热 (false heat) caused by foul odors.

Ingredients: Huang Qi 2 qian; Ren Shen, Bai Zhu, Mai Men Dong, Cang Zhu, Chen Pi, Sheng Ma, Wu Wei Zi, Dang Gui (root), and Gan Cao each 1 qian; Huang Bo (roasted) 4 fen; roasted Qu (fermented grain) 5 fen. Prepare as one dose, using 2 sheng of water, and decoct until reduced to 1 sheng. Take away from meals.[417p]

　　托里当归汤　治溃疡气血俱虚，疮口不敛，晡热内热，寒热往来，妇人诸疮，经候不调，小便频数，大便不实等证。　　当归　黄芪炙　人参　熟地黄　川芎藭　芍药各一钱　柴胡　甘草各五分　　右，水煎服。

　　人参散　治痈疽内虚不足。
　　人参　白朮　上白茯苓　枸杞子各一两　熟地黄　黄芪銼，各二两　桂心　白芍药　当归微炒　甘草炙，各半两　　右銼碎，每服四钱，水一中盏，入生姜半分，枣三枚，煎至六分，去滓，不拘时温服。
　　麦门冬汤　治痈疽溃后，脓水不绝。　　麦门冬去心　黄芪銼　五味子炒　人参去芦　白茯苓去黑皮　官桂去粗皮　当归切焙　远志去心　芎藭各一两　甘草炙，七钱半　　右(口父)咀，每服五钱，水一盏半，入生姜半分擘碎，大枣二枚擘破，同煎至一盏，去滓，空心温服。[418p]

Tori Danggui Decoction: Treats ulcers with both qi and blood deficiencies, non-healing sores, internal heat with afternoon fevers, alternating chills and fevers, various sores in women, irregular menstrual cycles, frequent urination, and unsatisfactory bowel movements. Ingredients: Danggui (Angelica sinensis) 1 qian, Huangqi (Astragalus) roasted 1 qian, Renshen (Ginseng) 1 qian, Shudi (Rehmannia) 1 qian, Chuanxiong (Ligusticum) 1 qian, Shaoyao (Peony) 1 qian, Chaihu (Bupleurum) 5 fen, Gan Cao (Licorice) 5 fen. Prepare by boiling in water.

Renshen Powder: Treats internal deficiency of carbuncles and sores. Ingredients: Renshen (Ginseng) 2 liang, Baizhu (Atractylodes) 1 liang, Sh白 Peony (Bai Fuling) 1 liang, Gouqizi (Goji berries) 1 liang, Shudi (Rehmannia) 2 liang, Huangqi (Astragalus) 2 liang, Guixin (Cinnamon) half a liang, Baishaoyao (White Peony) half a liang, Danggui (Angelica) lightly roasted half a liang, Gan Cao (Licorice) roasted half a liang. Prepare by crushing into powder; for each dose, take 4 qian with 1 medium cup of water, add 5 fen of fresh ginger and 3 jujubes, boil until reduced to 6 fen, strain, and consume warm at any time.

Mai Men Dong Decoction: Treats carbuncles after rupture with continuous drainage. Ingredients: Maidong (Ophiopogon) without the heart 1 liang, Huangqi (Astragalus) 2 liang, Wuweizi (Schisandra) roasted 1 liang, Renshen (Ginseng) without the peel 1 liang, Baifuling (White Poria) without the dark skin 1 liang, Guogui (Cinnamon) without the rough skin 1 liang, Danggui (Angelica) sliced and roasted 1 liang, Yuan Zhi (Polygala) without the heart 1 liang, Chuanxiong (Ligusticum) 1 liang, Gan Cao (Licorice) roasted 7.5 qian. Prepare by grinding; for each dose, take 5 qian with 1.5 cups of water, add 5 fen of fresh ginger in pieces and 2 jujubes broken apart, boil until reduced to 1 cup, strain, and consume warm on an empty stomach.[418p]

　　护壁都尉　治诸发已溃，去旧生新。老人气血虚弱，宜补之。此溃后服，至愈而止。　　防风去芦　厚朴去粗皮姜汁炒　苦梗　白芷　黄芪炙，各半两　人参二钱　川芎　甘草　柳桂　当归各三钱　　右为末，每服二钱，空心，温盐酒调服。至疮口合后，更服为佳。不饮酒，木香汤。兼服降气汤尤妙。
　　六味丸　一名六味地黄丸。此壮水之剂。夫人之生，以肾为主。凡病皆由肾虚而致。此方乃天一生水之剂，无有不可用者，世所罕知。若肾虚，发热作渴，小便淋秘，痰气壅盛，咳嗽吐血，头目眩运，小便短少，眼花耳聋，咽喉燥痛，口舌疮裂，齿不坚固，腰腿痿软，五脏齐损，肝经不足之证，尤当用之，水能生木故也。此肾虚发热，自汗盗汗，诸血失血，失音，水泛为痰之圣药，血虚发热之神剂也。　　熟地黄生者，自制，八两　山萸肉　山药各四两　白茯苓　牡丹皮　泽泻各三两　　右地黄杵膏，余为末，蜜和丸桐子大，每服七八十丸，滚汤下。[419p]

Guard Wall Colonel: Treat the afflicted areas that have already decayed, removing the old and generating the new. The elderly tend to have weak vital energy and blood, so they should be replenished. This medicine should be taken after the decay, continuing until recovery.

Ingredients:

  • Fangfeng (Siler) and Liu (bulrush) - removing coarse skins and frying with ginger juice
  • Bitter stems
  • Baizhi (Angelica dahurica)
  • Huangqi (Astragalus) roasted, all half a tael each
  • Renshen (Ginseng) - two qian
  • Chuanxiong (Szechuan lovage)
  • Gancao (Licorice)
  • Liugui (Cinnamon)
  • Danggui (Angelica sinensis) - three qian each

Grind these into a powder. Take two qian on an empty stomach, mixed with warm salted wine. It’s optimal to take more after the wound closes. Do not drink alcohol; use Mukxiang Decoction and, if combined with Qi-reducing Decoction, it’s even better.

Liuwai Pill: Also known as Liuwai Dihuang Wan. This is a tonic for nourishing water. The human body fundamentally relies on the kidneys. All diseases arise from kidney deficiency. This formula is a transformative water tonic, of which there are no contraindications, though it is rarely known in the world. If kidney deficiency manifests as fever and thirst, painful urination with dribbling, excessive phlegm and Qi stagnation, coughing up blood, dizziness, reduced urination, blurry vision and hearing loss, sore throat and mouth ulcers, cracked tongue, loose teeth, weakness in the waist and legs, and deficiencies in the five organs, especially in the liver channel, this is especially suitable for use; as water can nourish wood.

This condition of kidney deficiency leads to fever, spontaneous sweating, blood loss, loss of voice, and phlegm. It is a miraculous remedy for blood deficiency and heat.

Ingredients:

  • Shudi Huang (prepared Rehmannia) - eight taels
  • Shanyurou (Cornelian cherry fruit)
  • Shanyao (Chinese yam) - each four taels
  • Baifuling (Poria)
  • Mudanpi (Peony root)
  • Zexie (Plantago) - each three taels

Grind the prepared Rehmannia into paste; the rest should be ground into powder. Mix with honey and form into pills the size of a tongzi (Chinese date). Take seventy to eighty pills washed down with boiling soup.[419p]

　　八味丸　治命门火衰，不能生土，以致脾土虚寒而患流注鹤膝等证，不能消溃收敛；或饮食少思，或食而不化，脐腹疼痛，夜多漩溺。　　前方加肉桂、附子各一两。

　　加减八味丸　治证同前。
　　即六味丸加肉桂、五味子各一两。

　　人参内托散　治疮疡溃脓而作痛者。　　人参　黄芪　当归　川芎　厚朴　防风　桔梗　白芷　官桂　紫草　木香　甘草　　右，入糯米一撮，水煎服。

　　黄芪散　治痈溃后，补虚去客热。
　　黄芪　石膏各二两　知母　麦门冬去心　白芍药　白茯苓　桂心　熟地黄　人参去芦　川升麻各一两　甘草炙微赤，半两　　右銼碎，每服四钱，水一中盏，煎六分，去滓温服，日三四服。[420p]

Eight Ingredients Pill: Treats diminished fire of the life gate, unable to generate earth, leading to spleen deficiency and cold, resulting in symptoms like flow and swelling in the knees, unable to resolve or restrain. Symptoms may include reduced appetite or food not being digested, pain in the abdomen, and frequent nighttime urination. Add one tael each of cinnamon and aconite to the formula.

Modified Eight Ingredients Pill: Treats the same conditions as above. This is the six ingredients pill with one tael each of cinnamon and Schisandra added.

Ginseng Internal Suppression Powder: Treats painful lesions and abscesses that have burst and are purulent. Ingredients include ginseng, astragalus, angelica, Chuanxiong, magnolia bark, saposhnikovia, balloon flower root, white atractylodes, cinnamon, purple gromwell, costus, and licorice. Combine with a pinch of glutinous rice and decoct with water.

Astragalus Powder: Treats after abscess rupture, replenishes deficiency, and removes excess heat. Ingredients include astragalus and gypsum, each two taels; anemarrhena, ophiopogon (without heart), white peony, white poria, cinnamon heart, prepared rehmannia, ginseng (without husk), and Chuan shengma, each one tael; licorice, half tael, roasted until slightly red. Grind all into a powder, take four qian per dose, boil with one medium cup of water until reduced to six parts, strain and take warm, three to four doses daily.[420p]

　　当归补血汤　治疮疡溃后，气血俱虚，肌热躁热，目赤面红，烦渴引饮，昼夜不息，脉洪大而虚，重按全无。此脉虚，血虚也，若误服白虎汤必死。宜此主之。　　黄芪炙，一两　当归酒拌，三钱　作一剂，水一锺半，煎六分服。
　　沉香散　治痈脓溃已绝，肌肉内虚，尚有余热。　　沉香銼　柴胡去苗　黄芪　麦冬去心，各一两　白朮七钱半　熟地黄二两　黄芩　(艹舌)蒌根　甘草生銼，各半两　　右銼，每服四钱，水一中盏，入竹叶二七片，小麦五十粒，煎至六分，去滓，不拘时温服。
　　加味逍遥散　治肝脾血虚，内热发热，或遍身瘙痒寒热，或肢体作痛，头目昏重，或怔忡颊赤，口燥咽干，或发热盗汗，食少不寐，或口舌生疮，耳内作痛，或胸乳腹胀。小便欠利。　　甘草炙　当归　芍药酒炒　茯苓　白朮炒　柴胡各一钱　牡丹皮　山栀炒，各七分　　右，水煎服。[421p]

Angelica Blood-Enriching Decoction: Treats post-sore ulceration with both qi and blood deficiency, characterized by skin heat and irritability, red eyes, flushed face, thirst prompting drinking, restlessness day and night, with a pulse that is flooding, large, yet weak, completely absent upon firm pressure. This pulse indicates blood deficiency; if mistakenly taking White Tiger Decoction, it would be fatal. This is the suitable prescription.

Ingredients:

  • Honey-fried astragalus, 1 tael
  • Angelica mixed with wine, 3 qian
  • Prepare one dose with 1.5 cups of water, simmer to 6 parts and take.

Incense Powder: Treats boils and pus that have resolved but with residual internal heat and weakness in the muscles.

Ingredients:

  • Ground incense,
  • Chai Hu (Bupleurum) without sprouts,
  • Astragalus,
  • Mai Dong (Ophiopogon) without heart, each 1 tael
  • Bai Zhu (Atractylodes), 7.5 qian
  • Cooked Rehmannia, 2 taels
  • Huang Qin (Scutellaria)
  • (Cocklebur) root
  • Fresh licorice, each half a tael.

Grind the above and take 4 qian per dose, with 1 cup of water, adding 2-7 pieces of bamboo leaves and 50 grains of wheat, simmer to 6 parts, strain, and drink warm at any time.

Modified Xiao Yao Powder: Treats liver and spleen blood deficiency with internal heat presenting as fever, generalized pruritus, intermittent chills and heat, limb pain, heaviness in head and eyes, palpitations with flushed cheeks, dry mouth and throat, possibly with night sweats, little appetite, insomnia, or sores in mouth and tongue, ear pain, or swelling in chest and abdomen, with urinary difficulties.

Ingredients:

  • Honey-fried licorice,
  • Angelica,
  • Fried peony root,
  • Poria,
  • Fried Bai Zhu,
  • Chai Hu, each 1 qian
  • Peony bark,
  • Fried gardenia, each 7 fen.

Simmer the above in water for administration.[421p]

　　栀子黄芩汤　治发背痈疽溃后，因饮食有伤，调摄不到，发热不住，用以退热。　　漏芦　连翘　山栀仁　黄芩去心　防风　石苇如无，以桑白皮代　生甘草　生犀角屑　人参　苦参各去芦　茯苓上白者，去皮，各二钱半　生黄芪去叉芦，一两　　右为粗末，每四大钱，水一锺，煎至六分，去滓温服。
　　六合回生丹　一名六合夺命散。治发背痈疽溃烂，有回生之妙。　　铅粉一两　轻粉　银朱　雄黄　乳香箬上炙　没药炙，各二分半　　右六味，各择真正好者，研为极细末，收贮。凡治其病，先煎好浓茶，将疮洗净，软帛拭干，后剖开猪腰子一枚，用药一分，掺于猪腰子上，敷患处，待猪腰子上发热如蒸，良久取去。自此拔毒气，减痛苦，定疮口。出脓秽，不可手挤。次日依前法仍敷之，第三日亦敷之。疮势恶甚，可敷七八九次，疮小只敷一次可愈。猪腰子不发热，勿治。又治对口疮同前。[422p]

Gardenia and Scutellaria Decoction
Used to treat carbuncles and abscesses that have burst, caused by dietary damage and improper care, resulting in persistent fever; it is effective for reducing fever.
Ingredients:

  • 2.5 qian each of:
    • Rehmannia root (if unavailable, substitute with mulberry bark)
    • Gardenia fruit (remove the kernel)
    • Scutellaria root (remove the heart)
    • Ash bark
    • Fresh licorice root
    • Fresh rhinoceros horn shavings (note: this is illegal to use today)
    • Ginseng
    • Bitter gentian (remove the stem)
    • Poria (white part only, remove the skin)
  • 1 liang of fresh Astragalus (remove the forked root)
    Prepare a coarse powder, take 4 large qian, add to 1 zhong of water, and decoct until reduced to six parts. Strain and take warm.

Six Harmonies Rejuvenation Pill, also known as Six Harmonies Life-Rescuing Powder
Used to treat carbuncles and abscesses that are rotting, possessing remarkable effects for revitalization.
Ingredients:

  • 1 liang of lead powder
  • 2.5 fen each of:
    • Light powder
    • Cinnabar
    • Realgar
    • Frankincense (roasted)
    • Myrrh (roasted)
      Use only the best quality for these six ingredients, grind into an extremely fine powder, and store. For treatment, first brew strong tea, clean the wound, dry it with soft cloth, then take one pig kidney, use 1 fen of the powder, apply it to the kidney, and place it on the affected area until it becomes hot like steamed. After a long while, remove it. This will draw out the toxic gas, reduce pain, and close the wound. Let the pus drain out without squeezing. The next day, repeat the process, and on the third day as well. If the wound is particularly severe, it can be applied seven, eight, or nine times; if small, once may suffice. If the pig kidney does not heat up, do not treat. This method is also applicable for oral ulcers.[422p]

　　骊龙散　治发背痈疽，破与不破二者之间，功能捷奏。　　珍珠五分　牛粪十二月生用，余月烧存性　铁锈各重一两　　右研极细末，以猪脑髓和好酢，调敷疮口三五次愈。初起者自消。凡发毒品味忌食之。
　　麦饭石膏　在脓溃后围疮口。
　　麦饭石不拘多少，炭火煅至红，以好酢淬之，如此煅焠数次，研为末，重罗去粗者，取细末入乳钵，数人更递研五七日，如面极细为妙　白蔹研为细末　鹿角不用自脱者，须用带脑顶骨全者，却是生取之角，截作二三寸长，炭火烧令烟尽，研罗为末，再入乳钵，更递研令极细　　右用麦饭石细末二两，白蔹末二两，鹿角灰四两。最要研得极细方有效。粗则反致甚痛，细则能止痛收口排脓，精粗之异如此。[423p]

Li Long San: Used for treating back carbuncles and boils, it effectively addresses both situations with quick results.

Five parts of pearl, twelve-month-old cow dung for use; remaining months burned to preserve its properties; iron rust each weighing one tael. Grind into a very fine powder, mix with pig brain marrow and good vinegar, and apply to the wound three to five times for healing. For early-stage issues, it resolves on its own. Avoid consuming any toxic substances.

Mai Fan Shi Gao: Apply around the wound after pus has discharged.

For Mai Fan Shi, no fixed amount is required; calcine over charcoal until red, then quench in good vinegar. Repeat this calcination several times, grinding it into powder. Sift out the coarse parts, use the fine powder in a mortar, and grind thoroughly with several people for five to seven days until it becomes extremely fine. Grind Bai Lian into a fine powder as well. For deer horn, avoid those that have naturally shed; use only those that still have the brain and bone intact. Cut them into two- or three-inch lengths, burn them to eliminate smoke, then grind and sift for a fine powder.

Combine two taels of finely ground Mai Fan Shi, two taels of Bai Lian powder, and four taels of deer horn ash. It is crucial to grind them to an extremely fine consistency for effectiveness. Coarse powders can lead to severe pain, while fine ones can alleviate pain, close wounds, and expel pus; thus, the distinction between fine and coarse is vital.[423p]

和合量药末多寡，用经年好米酢入银石器内，熬令鱼眼沸，却旋旋入药末，用竹篾子不住手搅，熬一二时久，令稀稠得所，提出，以磁器盛之，候冷，以纸盖覆，勿令着尘。用时先以猪蹄汤洗去脓血，以故帛挹干，鹅翎蘸膏涂敷四围，凡有赤处尽涂之，但留中心一口如钱大。未溃能令内消，已溃则排脓如湍水，逐日疮口收敛。疮久，肌肉腐烂，筋骨出露，用旧布片涂药贴疮，但内膜不穿，亦能取安。洗疮勿可手触嫩肉，亦不可口气吹着。合药亦忌腋气之人，及月经有孕妇人见之。仍可熬好米酢一大碗，收磁器内，候逐日用药于疮上。久则药干，以鹅翎点酢拂拭药上，勿令绷紧也。初则一日一洗一换药，十日后两日一换。[424p]

To determine the amount of medicinal powder needed, take high-quality rice vinegar and put it into a silver container. Heat it until it bubbles like fish eyes, then gradually add the medicinal powder while continuously stirring with a bamboo stick. After simmering for one to two hours, achieve the desired consistency, then transfer it to a ceramic vessel to cool. Cover it with paper to prevent dust.

Before using, wash away any pus and blood with pig trotter soup, then dry the area with a clean cloth. Use a goose feather dipped in ointment to apply around the wound, covering all red areas while leaving the center about the size of a coin exposed. If the wound is not yet open, this method can help it heal from within; if it is already open, the pus will drain out like rushing water, and the wound will gradually close.

For longstanding wounds where muscle has rotted and tendons are exposed, apply a piece of old cloth with medicine over the wound, taking care not to break the inner membrane, which can also provide relief. When cleaning the wound, avoid touching the tender flesh and do not blow on it with your breath.

Also, avoid having anyone with underarm odor or menstruating pregnant women nearby while preparing the medicine. You can also boil a large bowl of good rice vinegar, store it in a ceramic container, and use it daily on the wound. If the medicine dries out over time, use the goose feather to lightly wipe the medicine with vinegar, ensuring it doesn't become tight.

Initially, change the dressing and wash the wound once a day; after ten days, switch to every other day.[424p]

　　解毒百用膏
　　猪牙皂角煨　南星各一两　大米一合炒黑　臭小粉干者四两炒焦去火毒　　右为末，和匀，蜜水调围，治颠扑酒酢调围。
　　逼毒散　刘氏贴发背痈疽，脓尽，四面皮粘，恐有脓毒攻起，宜用此。　　黄药子　白药子各一两　透明雄黄一钱　赤小豆二两　　右为末，水调敷。

　　青散子　治发背痈疽，脓尽生肉平满，宜用此紧疮口生肌。　　槿花叶盛时收阴干，取四两为末　青赤小豆　白芨各二两　　右为末，临时用槿花末三钱匕，白芨、小豆末各一钱匕相和，新汲水调摊纸上，贴四畔，中心疮口不用贴。古今图书集成医部全录卷三百六十五[425p]

Detoxifying Ointment
To prepare: One tael each of pig tooth soap and South star, one small handful of roasted black rice, and four taels of roasted stale powdered small beans to remove fire toxins. Grind them into a fine powder, mix well, and adjust with honey water for treating convulsions from alcohol intoxication.

Poison Dispelling Powder
For treating carbuncles and sores on the back, when pus has been drained and the skin around is adhering, to prevent further infection, use this. Ingredients: One tael each of yellow and white medicinal powders, one pennyweight of transparent realgar, and two taels of red beans. Grind into a fine powder and mix with water for application.

Green Powder
For treating carbuncles and sores, when pus has been drained, and the flesh is forming well, use this to tighten the sore and promote flesh growth. Collect hibiscus leaves at their peak and dry them in the shade, then take four taels in powder form. Also, use two taels each of green and red beans and white atractylodes. Grind these into a fine powder, and when needed, mix three pennyweights of hibiscus powder with one pennyweight each of white atractylodes and bean powder, combine with fresh water and apply on paper to the four sides, leaving the center sore uncovered.
(From the Comprehensive Medical Texts, Volume 365)[425p]

外科痈疽疔毒门

　　　　方

　　雄黄解毒散　治一切痈肿溃烂毒势盛者，先用此药二三次，以后用猪蹄汤。　　白矾四两　雄黄　寒水石煅，各一两　用滚水二三碗，乘热入前药一两，洗患处，以太乙膏或神异膏贴之。
　　猪蹄汤　治一切痈疽肿毒，消毒气，去恶肉。凡疮有口，便用此汤洗。　　香白芷不见火　黄芩去心　赤芍药　羌活　露蜂房取有蜂儿者　当归去芦　生甘草各等分　　右为粗末，看疽大小用药。如疽大，加料用。先将獖猪前蹄两只一斤，只用白水三升煮软，将汁分作二次，澄去面上油花，尽下面滓肉，每次用药一两，投于汁中，再用文武火煎十数沸，去滓，以故帛蘸药汤，温温徐薄揩疮上，死肉恶血，随洗而下。净洗讫，以帛挹干。仍避风，忌人口气吹之。有狐臭人、并月经见行妇人、鸡犬并不许入病人房。洗疮切勿以手触着。洗疽之方，所敷甚多，惟此方极效。其用露蜂房有理，盖以毒驱毒也。[426p]

Surgical Pustules and Ulcers Section

Formula

Realgar Detoxification Powder: Treats all kinds of boils, swellings, and severe toxic conditions. First, use this medicine two to three times, then follow with pig's trotter soup.

  • Ingredients: 4 taels of alum, 1 tael each of realgar and calcined cold water stone. Use 2 to 3 bowls of boiling water, while hot add 1 tael of the previous medicine. Wash the affected area and apply Taiyi ointment or Shenyi ointment.

Pig’s Trotter Soup: Treats all boils and toxic swellings, dispels toxic qi, and eliminates foul flesh. For any wound with an opening, use this soup for washing.

  • Ingredients: Equal parts of: raw white angelica, yellow root without hearts, red peony root, qianghuo, bee’s nest with live bees, raw licorice, and others. Grind into coarse powder, adjusting the dosage according to the size of the boil. If the boil is large, increase the ingredients.

First, take two front trotters of a wild pig weighing one jin, using only 3 liters of plain water to boil until soft. Divide the juice into two portions, clarifying the surface oil and removing the sediment and meat. For each usage, take 1 tael of medicine and add to the juice, then simmer with steady heat until boiling numerous times. Remove dregs, and use clean cloth to soak in the medicinal soup. Gently and gradually apply it to the wound; dead flesh and foul blood will wash away accordingly. After cleaning, dry the area with cloth. Avoid wind and do not let breath blown from the mouth touch it. Individuals with foul body odor, menstruating women, and chickens or dogs are not allowed to enter the patient's room. Avoid touching the wound with hands during washing. Many methods exist to wash abscesses, but this recipe is especially effective. The use of bee’s nest serves a purpose, driving out poison with poison.[426p]

　　集香散　洗痈疽溃烂。
　　白芷　藿香　茅香　香附子　防风各三钱　木香　甘草各一钱　作一剂，用水三碗，煎数沸，去渣，淋洗患处。
　　熏洗方　凡诸发及痈疽瘰疬臁疮，汤荡火烧等疾，或有别作一种秽臭，气息不堪闻者，最是恶证。或已破未破，或小或大，皆当作急治之。可用忍冬藤一握擂细，用无灰酒滤汁服之，以滓敷疮四围，用云母膏别研，亦可剪开大口，以护其疮之上，俟其疮出脓，便以獖猪蹄汤等十分净洗，久洗为妙，至一二时辰不妨。次用后药熏之。　　好降真香末　枫香末
　　右二味于铫中搅匀，丸如弹子大，却取香炉一枚，依炉口造纸烟筒一个，如烧龙涎香样，慢火爇之，紧以烟筒口熏疮上，不拘丸数，稍倦暂止，然后更熏。未出脓者即出，已出脓者即干，直候生肌合口，然后止。向后有赤肿去处，又再熏。大概欲屏去秽气也。[427p]

Gather incense and disperse; cleanse sores that are festering and rotten.

Three qian each of Bai Zhi, Huo Xiang, Mao Xiang, Xiang Fu Zi, and Fang Feng; one qian each of Mu Xiang and Gan Cao. Prepare into one dose, using three bowls of water. Boil until it has reduced, strain, and wash the affected area.

For fumigation and washing: For all hair, places of pus, carbuncles, swollen lymph nodes, sores, or conditions accompanied by a foul odor that is unbearable, these are the worst afflictions. Whether already ruptured or not, small or large, urgent treatment is required. Use a handful of honeysuckle vine, pound finely, and filter its juice with ashless wine to drink. Apply the residue around the wound, using ground muscovite ointment for extra protection. You may also cut a larger opening to protect the wound above, waiting for it to produce pus. Then, thoroughly cleanse it with an absolute and pure wash like pig hoof broth, washing persistently for a duration of one or two hours. Following this, use the medicinal fumigation.

For the incense mixture, take two flavors: fine powder of sandalwood and fragrant maple. Mix these two in a pan evenly, rolling into balls the size of bullets. Then, take a censer and fashion a paper smoke tube for the opening. Like burning ambergris, use a slow fire to combust it, placing the tube firmly over the sore. The number of balls is not fixed; if tired, pause briefly, then resume fumigation. If pus has yet to emerge, it will appear; if it has emerged, let it dry, and wait for the flesh to heal before stopping. If there is still redness and swelling, continue to fumigate. Generally, the aim is to eliminate the foul odor.[427p]

　　追毒丹　治疮疽黑陷者，用刀针开疮，内此丹，使之溃，然后去败肉排脓，随证治之。痈疽疔疮附骨疽，并皆治之。　　巴豆七粒，去皮心，不去油，研如泥　白丁香　轻粉各一钱　雄黄　黄丹各二钱　　右件研和，加白面三钱，滴水为丸如麦大，针破疮，内之，复以乳香膏，追出脓血毒物。漏疮四壁，死肌不去，不可治，亦以此追毒去死肌，乃养肉令愈。疾小者，用一粒，大者加粒数用之。
　　追毒乌金散　治疮口恶肉，毒溃脓血。　　巴豆五钱　寒食面一两　好细墨一绽　　右为细末，用水和面作饼子，将巴豆包定，休教透气，文武火烧成深黑色为细末，量疮贴之。用胆汁就和成锭子，新水磨用，扫五七次妙。　　又方 【《保命》】 　治恶疮有死肉者及追脓。　　白丁香　轻粉　粉霜　雄黄　麝香各一钱　巴豆霜三个　　右为细末，新饭和作锭子用之。[428p]

Pursuing the Poison Pill

For treating deep ulcers and black sores, use a knife or needle to open the ulcer, insert this pill, and allow it to burst. Then remove the necrotic tissue and drain the pus, treating according to the symptoms. This method applies to boils, sores, and ulcers that attach to bones, all of which should be treated in this manner.

Ingredients:

  • 7 pieces of bitter bean, peeled and pitted, but not de-oiled, ground to a paste
  • 1 qian of white clove
  • 1 qian of light powder
  • 2 qian of realgar
  • 2 qian of yellow lead

Combine the above ingredients, add 3 qian of flour, and mix with water to form pills the size of wheat grains. After puncturing the ulcer, insert it, and apply frankincense ointment to expel the pus and toxic substances. If the ulcer has dead tissue on all sides and cannot be removed, use this method to expel the poison and dead tissue, then nourish the flesh to promote healing. For smaller ailments, use one pill; for larger ones, increase the quantity as needed.

Pursuing the Poison Black Gold Powder

For treating foul flesh at the ulcer's edge and toxic pus and blood.

Ingredients:

  • 5 qian of bitter bean
  • 1 liang of cold food flour
  • A small amount of fine ink

Grind the above into a fine powder. Mix with water to form a dough, wrapping the bitter bean inside, ensuring no air escapes. Roast it over a medium heat until it turns deep black, then grind into a fine powder to apply to the ulcer. Use bile to form pills with new water, sweeping five to seven times for efficacy.

Additional Formula [from "Preserving Life"]

For treating malignant ulcers with dead tissue and expelling pus.

Ingredients:

  • 1 qian of white clove
  • 1 qian of light powder
  • 1 qian of powdered frost
  • 1 qian of realgar
  • 1 qian of musk
  • 3 portions of bitter bean powder

Grind the above into a fine powder, mixing with freshly cooked rice to form pills for use.[428p]

　　神异膏　洽痈疽坏烂，及诸疮发毒。　　雄黄五钱　滑石倍用
　　右为末，洗后掺疮上，外用绵子覆盖相护。凡洗后破烂者，用此贴之。
　　止痛拔毒膏　治一切疮发臭烂，不可近。未破则贴破，已破则生肉。杖疮疔疮皆用之。　　螌蝥四十九枚　柳枝四十九条　木鳖子七个　乳香　没药　麝香各少许　松脂三钱　　右用真清油十四两，煎黑柳条焦枯，滤去渣，入黄丹五两，滴入水中，成珠为度；却入诸药，搅令匀，入瓷器中收了，后用。
　　青金锭子郭氏
　　铜绿三钱　青矾　胆矾　轻粉　白丁香　砒霜　苦葶苈各－钱　脑子少许　麝香　　右将葶苈研细，次下诸药，同研极细，打稠糊为锭子，或炼蜜加白芨末一钱为锭，如麻黄粗细，约二寸长，看疮口深浅纴入。疼者可治，不疼难治。第一般紧峻碧云锭子，砒霜生，开疮口用。第二般紧缓碧霞锭子，砒霜煅，去死肉用。第三般缓慢碧玉锭子，去砒霜，加枯矾，生好肉用。[429p]

Divine Ointment: Effective for sores and ulcers, and for various infected wounds. Use five qian of orpiment and twice the amount of talc. Grind these ingredients into a powder, wash the area, apply the powder to the wound, and cover with cotton for protection. If there is a wound that is broken and rotten after washing, use this to dress it.

Painless Detoxification Ointment: Treats all foul and rotten sores; do not apply near the eyes. If the sore is not broken, apply directly; if it is broken, it promotes flesh regeneration. It can be used for carbuncles and boils. Ingredients include forty-nine beetles, forty-nine willow twigs, seven seeds of the wood-borer, a small amount of frankincense, myrrh, and musk, along with three qian of pine resin. Combine these with fourteen liang of pure oil, fry the willow twigs until charred, strain out the residue, then mix in five liang of yellow lead, adding water until it forms beads. Incorporate the various medicines, stir well, and store in porcelain for later use.

Azure Gold Tablets (from the Guo family): Includes three qian of copper green, blue vitriol, gallstone, light powder, white clove, arsenic, and bitter lepidium, each at one qian, a small amount of brain matter, and musk. Grind lepidium finely, then add the other ingredients and grind extremely fine, forming into a thick paste for tablets. Alternatively, refine honey and add one qian of white bletilla powder to form tablets, about two inches long, thick as ephedra, adjusted for the depth of the wound. Those that are painful can be treated; those that are not painful are difficult to treat.

The first type is the strict and intense azure cloud tablets, made with raw arsenic, for opening the wound. The second type is the gentle and gradual azure mist tablets, made with roasted arsenic, for removing dead flesh. The third type is the slow and relaxing jade tablets, removing arsenic, adding burnt alum, to promote healthy flesh growth.[429p]

　　翠霞锭子　治年深冷漏日久，恶疮，有歹肉用之。　　铜绿　寒水石煅滑石各三钱　明矾　腻粉　砒霜　云母石研如粉，各一钱二分半　　右研极细末，糊为锭子，如麻黄粗细，长短不拘，量疮口深浅纴之。如修合，候天色晴明则可。
　　信效锭子　治一切恶疮。
　　红娘子　黄丹　砒霜　鹰屎　土硝　白芨　铜绿各一钱半　脑子　麝香各少许　　右研细末，些少儿乳汁和为锭子用，中病即止。
　　红玉锭子　去歹肉生肌。
　　干胭脂　白矾枯，各三钱　轻粉　砒霜　黄丹　脑子　麝香各少许　　右研极细末，稠糊和为锭子用之。

　　时效针头散　追蚀恶疮歹肉，兼治瘰疬。　　赤石脂半两　乳香　白丁香各二钱　砒霜生　黄丹各一钱　轻粉　麝香各半钱　蜈蚣一条，焙　　右为极细末，掺于疮口，歹肉自去矣。若动刀针，其疮虽可，有瘢。[430p]

Cui Xia Ding Zi: For treating deep, long-standing cold sores with malignant flesh. Ingredients: 3 qian each of copper green, cold water stone, and talcum; 1.5 qian of alum, powder, arsenic, and muscovite, finely ground into powder. Mix into a paste to form pills about the thickness of Ephedra, of any length. Adjust according to the depth of the sore. If the condition stabilizes, apply when the weather is clear.

Xin Xiao Ding Zi: Treats all types of malignant sores. Ingredients: 1.5 qian each of red lady, yellow lead, arsenic, eagle droppings, soil nitrate, white rhizome, and copper green; a little each of brain and musk. Grind into fine powder, mixing with a small amount of breast milk to form pills, use until the illness stops.

Hong Yu Ding Zi: Removes malignant flesh and promotes healing. Ingredients: 3 qian each of dry rouge and white alum; a little of light powder, arsenic, yellow lead, brain, and musk. Grind into fine powder, mix with a thick paste to form pills.

Shi Xiao Zhen Tou San: Targets malignant sores and rotten flesh, also treats scrofula. Ingredients: 2 qian each of red stone resin, frankincense, and white clove; 1 qian each of raw arsenic and yellow lead; 0.5 qian each of light powder and musk; and one centipede, roasted. Grind into very fine powder, sprinkle on the sore, and the rotten flesh will come off. If you use a knife or needle, while the sore might heal, there will be a scar.[430p]

　　追毒饼　治诸般恶疮，因针开了口后，又闭合生脓，胀痛不可忍，用此捻成小麦子大，放入疮中，永不闭，脓水自出，疮自干好。　　极好信石半钱　雄黄　雌黄　大朱砂各一钱　轻粉少许　　右研为细末，糯米糊丸如麦子大，若疮口闭合生脓，将药入内，仍以膏药贴之。
　　翠青锭子　又名善效锭子。治脑疽发背恶疮并溃烂，追脓水长肌。　　铜青四钱　明矾枯　韶粉　乳香炙另研　青黛各一钱半　白蔹　轻粉真者，各一钱　麝香半钱　杏仁二七粒，去皮尖另研　如有死肉，加白丁香一钱。　　右为细末，稠糊为饼子，或糯米饭和亦得，看浅深纴之，直至疮平复，犹可用之，大有神效。如前数方不宜多用。谓犯生砒也。此药无毒，恐病家猜疑是毒药，请口内尝之为凭也。[431p]

Chasing Poison Cakes: This remedy treats various types of sores. After a needle opens the sore, if it closes and produces pus, causing intolerable swelling and pain, take this and form it into the size of a millet grain, place it inside the sore, and it will never close. The pus will flow out on its own, and the sore will dry up and heal.

For a highly effective remedy: one coin each of realgar, orpiment, and vermilion, and a little slaked lime. Grind these into a fine powder, make into pills the size of wheat grains, and if the sore's opening closes and pus forms, put the medicine inside and apply a medicated plaster.

Cyanine Pills: Also known as Effective Cyanine Pills. This treats brain sores, back sores, and ulcers, promoting the outflow of pus and growth of flesh. Use four coins of blue vitriol, dried alum, Shao powder, frankincense (prepared separately), and indigo, one and a half coins each, white lilac and true slaked lime, one coin each, half a coin of musk, and twenty-seven peeled apricot seeds, ground separately. If there is necrotic tissue, add one coin of white clove.

Grind these into a fine powder, mix with a thick paste to form cakes, or you can also mix with glutinous rice, adjusting the depth of the paste until the sore calms down. It can still be used afterward, with remarkable effectiveness. The previous remedies should not be used excessively, as they may cause issues with arsenic. This medicine is non-toxic, but to dispel any doubts from the patient about it being poison, one may taste it as evidence.[431p]

　　搜脓锭子　先用追蚀等锭子，蚀去歹肉恶物，止有脓水，皆宜用之。　　自然铜酢淬　川芎　白芷各半两　黄连　白蔹各二钱半　木香一钱半　麝香少许　　右为极细末，糯米饭和为锭子用之；或作散末，干上亦佳。此二方乃溃疡必用之要药，余用之救人无算。凡疮口深而窄者，先以绵杖子展净脓水，却以软饭和成锭子，长短大小，一以疮为准，须令药至底乃效，外以膏药护之。若疮口浅而阔大者，药汤洗过拭干，只以干末掺之。如疮口干燥，以自死竹蘸豆油点着，以碗承取滴下油沥，调前药末，鸡羽蘸涂，脓汁自止，疮口又润，新肉自生，神效。[432p]

Pus-Removing Pill
First, use abrasive pills to remove necrotic tissue and harmful substances. Once only pus is left, this remedy is appropriate.

Natural Copper Vinegar Soak:
Equal parts of Chuanxiong and Bai Zhi (each half a tael), 2.5 qian each of Huanglian and Bailian, 1.5 qian of Mukang, and a small amount of Musk.

Grind these into a very fine powder, mix with glutinous rice to form pills; or make into a powder to apply dry, both methods are effective. These two recipes are essential medicines for ulcers, and countless lives have been saved using them. If the ulcer is deep and narrow, first use a cotton swab to clean out the pus, then create pills using soft rice mixed with the medicine, adjusting the size according to the ulcer; the medicine must reach the bottom to be effective, and then protect with a plaster. If the ulcer is shallow and wide, wash with medicinal decoction, dry, and apply the dry powder. If the ulcer is dry, use a dying bamboo to dab bean oil, collecting the drips in a bowl, and mix this with the previous medicinal powder. Apply with a chicken feather; this will stop the pus, moisten the ulcer, and promote the growth of new flesh, yielding miraculous results.[432p]

　　神效当归膏　治痈疽疮毒，及汤火杖疮溃烂，最能止痛，推陈致新。　　当归二两　麻油四两　白蜡五钱，如用黄腊一两尤效　先用当归入油煎至焦黑色，去渣，入蜡镕化，即成膏矣。此方用蜡为君。前人每云蜡为外科之要药，生肌定痛，续筋补血，其功不可尽述。常见善讼者，杖后随食蜡两许，饮酒一两碗，一睡之后，血散痛止，轻者即消，重者虽腐溃亦易愈，可见蜡之功甚大，用者不可忽之！[433p]

Divine Efficacy Angelica Ointment treats furuncles, carbuncles, and toxic sores, as well as burns and ulcerations. It is especially effective in alleviating pain and promoting healing.

Ingredients:

  • 2 taels of Angelica
  • 4 taels of sesame oil
  • 5 qian of white wax (using 1 tael of yellow wax is even more effective).

First, fry the Angelica in oil until it turns dark black. Remove the residue, then add the wax to melt and combine, creating the ointment. Wax is the primary ingredient in this formula. Former practitioners have always emphasized that wax is a crucial remedy in surgery, promoting skin regeneration and pain relief, and helping to mend tendons and replenish blood—its benefits are countless.

It is commonly seen that those who frequently battle in lawsuits, after being struck, take a small amount of wax along with one to two bowls of alcohol. After a night's rest, their blood disperses and the pain ceases; in lighter cases, the issues resolve completely, and even severe cases, though ulcerated, heal easily. This demonstrates the significant power of wax, which users must not overlook![433p]

　　神异膏 【《精要》】 　治诸般恶毒疮疖，发背痈疽，其妙如神。　　露蜂房要峰儿多者细剪净　杏仁各一两　全蛇蜕盐水洗净焙干　元参去芦，各半两　绵黄芪七钱半　黄丹五两，研细水飞，后入　男子乱发洗净焙干如鸡子大　真麻油一斤　　右件药，先将麻油入银铫中，同乱发于风炉上，慢慢文武火熬，候发焦镕尽，以杏仁投入，候杏仁色变黑，好绵滤去渣；再将所熬清油入银铫内，然后入黄芪、元参二味，慢火熬一二时，取出铫子，安一冷风炉上，候半时久，火力稍息，旋入露蜂房、蛇蜕二味，将柳枝急搅，移铫于火上，不住手搅，慢火熬至黄紫色；用绵滤过后，复入清油在铫内，乘冷投黄丹，急搅片时，又移铫于火上，文武火慢慢熬，不住手用柳枝搅千余转，候药油变黑色，滴于水中凝结成珠子，则是膏成就矣。[434p]

Magical Ointment

This cures all kinds of poisonous sores and boils; its effects are miraculous.

Ingredients:

  • Bee's nest (preferably the finer parts) - finely chopped,
  • Almonds - 1 tael each,
  • Snake skin - cleaned and dried,
  • Radix Rehmanniae - 0.5 taels,
  • Astragalus - 7.5 qian,
  • Yellow lead - 5 taels, finely powdered.

Process:

  1. First, combine the hemp oil with the messy hair in a silver pan over a fireplace, using gentle fire to slowly render the hair until it is thoroughly blended.
  2. Add the almonds when the hair turns black; filter out the solids.
  3. Pour the extracted oil back into the silver pan, then add the astragalus and radix rehmanniae; simmer on low heat for 1-2 hours.
  4. After that, place the pan on a cooler part of the fire for half an hour, reducing the heat slightly.
  5. Gradually incorporate the bee's nest and snake skin, stirring quickly with a willow branch.
  6. Return the pan to the heat, stirring continuously until the mixture turns a yellowish-purple color.
  7. Filter it again, then return to the pan and add the yellow lead, stirring vigorously.
  8. Put the pan on the fire again and continuously stir for over a thousand turns until the medicinal oil becomes black, forming beads when dripped into water, indicating that the ointment is complete.[434p]

若珠子稀，再熬少时。必候得所，然后用瓷器内封收待用。或恐偶然熬火太过，稍硬难用，却少入蜡熬，添麻油在内，瓷器盛封盖，于甑上蒸，乘热搅匀，收而用之。膏药熬成了，须用所盛瓷器，置净水盆中，出火毒一昼夜，歇三日方可用。熬此膏药极难于火候，须耐烦看火紧慢，火猛即药中火发，千万谨戒。膏药方甚多，效无出于此右者！
　　热疮寒膏药 【东垣】
　　当归酒洗焙干，一两　杏仁汤浸去皮尖，一百个　黄丹研细，六两　肥嫩柳枝三两半，切寸许洗干　肥嫩桃枝一两，切寸许洗干　麻油一斤　　右件先熬麻油热，下桃柳枝熬令半焦，以绵裹当归、杏仁同煎，至柳枝焦黑为度，去药渣滤油澄清，抹去铫中渣滓令净，再上火令沸，旋旋入黄丹，熬成滴水中不散为度。[435p]

If the medicinal paste is too rare, boil it a little longer. It is essential to wait for the right condition before sealing it in porcelain ware for storage. If there is a fear of accidental overheating that makes it too hard to use, add a bit of wax while simmering and mix in sesame oil. Seal it in porcelain, steam it above water, and stir it while hot until homogeneous, then store it for use. Once the paste is prepared, place the porcelain container in a clean basin of water to eliminate the fire's residual toxicity for a full day and night, then leave it to rest for three days before use. Preparing this paste is very challenging in terms of heat; one must be patient and observe the fire closely, as too fierce a flame will cause it to burn. Be extremely cautious. There are many formulas for medicinal pastes, but none surpass the efficacy of the one described herein.

Hot and Cold Patches for Sores [from Dongyuan]

  • One liang of dried Angelica root washed in wine
  • One hundred almonds, soaked to remove the skin tip
  • Six liang of yellow crocus ground finely
  • Three and a half liang of tender willow branches, cut into inch-long pieces and washed
  • One liang of tender peach branches, cut into inch-long pieces and washed
  • One jin of sesame oil

First, heat the sesame oil, then add the peach and willow branches and cook until half-charred. Wrap the Angelica and almonds in cotton and simmer until the willow branches are charred black. Remove the herb residues and filter the oil to clarify it. Clean the pot of any remaining debris and bring it to a boil again, then gradually add the yellow crocus until the paste reaches the consistency where it does not disperse in water droplets.[435p]

　　神仙太乙膏　治八发痈疽及一切恶疮软疖，不问年月深浅，已未成脓，并宜治之。蛇虎伤、蜈蚣螫、犬咬伤、汤火刀斧所伤，皆可内服外贴。如发背先以温水洗疮净，软帛拭干，却用绯帛摊膏药贴疮，即用冷水下，血气不通，温水送下；赤白带下，当归酒下；咳嗽及喉闭缠喉风，并用新绵裹膏药置口中含化。　　元参　白芷　当归　赤芍药　肉桂去粗皮　大黄　生地黄各一两　　右銼碎，用麻油贰斤浸，春五、夏三、秋七，冬十日，火熬黑色，滤去渣，入黄丹一斤，青柳枝不住手搅，候滴水中成珠，不粘手为度。倾入磁器中，以砖盖口，掘窖子埋阴树下，以土覆三日，出火毒。欲服，丸如鸡头子大。[436p]

The Daoist Immortal's Taiyi ointment treats boils and sores of all kinds, regardless of how long they have been present or whether they have formed pus. It is also suitable for treating snake bites, tiger wounds, centipede stings, dog bites, and injuries from fire or sharp instruments, which can be taken internally or applied externally. For sores on the back, first wash the wound with warm water to clean it, dry with a soft cloth, then apply the ointment on a red silk cloth to the wound, followed by cold water ingestion; if there is blood stagnation, use warm water to wash it down. For red or white discharges, take with wine and angelica; for coughs or throat constrictions, use new cotton to wrap the ointment and place it in the mouth to dissolve.

Ingredients:

  • 1 tael of Yuan Shen (garden balsam)
  • 1 tael of Bai Zhi (angelica daurica)
  • 1 tael of Dang Gui (Chinese angelica)
  • 1 tael of Chi Shao Yao (red peony root)
  • 1 tael of Rou Gui (cinnamon, bark only)
  • 1 tael of Da Huang (rhubarb)
  • 1 tael of Sheng Di Huang (raw Rehmannia)

Crush the above ingredients and soak in 2 jin of sesame oil, simmering for 5 days in spring, 3 days in summer, 7 days in autumn, and 10 days in winter. Boil until it turns a dark color, filter out the residue, and add 1 jin of yellow lead. Stir continuously with willow branches until the mixture drips into water forming beads that do not stick to the hands. Pour it into a ceramic container, cover it with a brick, dig a pit to bury it under a shady tree, and cover it with soil for three days to expel fire toxins. When ready to use, form into pills the size of a chicken egg.[436p]

　　金丝万应膏　治颠扑伤损手足肩背，并寒湿脚气，疼痛不可忍；小儿脾疳泻痢，咳嗽不肯服药者。　　沥青二斤半　威灵仙　黄腊各二两　没药　乳香各一两，别研　木鳖子四七个，切片研　蓖麻子一百个，研　麻油夏二两，春秋三两，冬四两　　右先将沥青同威灵仙下锅熬化，以槐柳枝搅候焦黑色，重绵滤过，以沥青入水盆候冷成块，取出秤二斤净，再下锅镕开，下麻油、黄腊、蓖麻、木鳖子泥，不住手槐柳枝搅匀，须慢火滴入水中不粘手，扯拔如金丝状方可。如硬，再旋加油少许，如软加沥青，试得如法，却下乳没末，起锅在炭火上，再用槐柳条搅数百次，又以粗布滤膏在水盆内，扯拔如金丝，频换水，浸一日，却用小铫盛顿。如落马坠车，于被伤疼痛处，火上炙热，贴透骨肉为验，连换热水数次浴之，则热血聚处自消。小儿脾疳贴患处，泻痢贴肚上，咳嗽贴背心上。[437p]

Golden Silk Universal Ointment treats injuries to hands, feet, shoulders, and back from falls, as well as pain from cold, dampness, and foot ailments that are unbearable; it is also effective for children's spleen disorders, diarrhea, dysentery, and coughs when they refuse to take medicine.

Ingredients:

  • 2.5 pounds of asphalt
  • 2 ounces each of Xuanwu, yellow wax
  • 1 ounce each of myrrh and frankincense, to be ground separately
  • 4 to 7 seeds of tortoise shell, sliced and ground
  • 100 castor beans, ground
  • 2 ounces of sesame oil in summer, 3 ounces in spring and autumn, and 4 ounces in winter

Instructions:
Firstly, combine asphalt and Xuanwu in a pot and melt them, stirring with branches of Sophora and willow until it reaches a dark, charred color. Strain through cotton, pour the asphalt into a basin of water, let it cool into blocks, and weigh out 2 pounds of the pure substance. Then return it to the pot, melt it down again, and add sesame oil, yellow wax, castor bean paste, and the ground tortoise shell. Continuously stir with the willow branch, ensuring the mixture can drop into water without sticking to the hands, and can be pulled to resemble golden threads. If it becomes too hard, add a little oil; if too soft, add more asphalt. Once the proper consistency is achieved, add the powdered myrrh and take the pot off the heat. Stir vigorously with the willow branch hundreds of times, then filter the ointment with coarse cloth in the basin, pulling it into golden strands while frequently changing the water for a day. Finally, use a small scoop to store it.

For injuries resembling falls from horses or vehicles, heat the affected area to the bone and test for tenderness, bathing it in hot water multiple times until the stagnation of blood dissipates. For children's spleen disorders, apply to the affected area, for diarrhea apply on the stomach, and for coughs apply on the back.[437p]

　　善应膏 【《得效》】 　治诸般恶疮肿毒、发背、脑疽、疬子、牙肿、打扑接骨，闪肭，刀斧伤、杖疮、蛇虫毒、狗马咬、汤火、漆疮、疥癣，贴之即愈。又治妇人吹乳，以药丸如桐子大，新汲水下二十丸。肺痈肠痈，亦可为丸吞服，温酒米饮，或北梗甘草煎汤皆可。不可犯荤手及火焙。[438p]

Good Response Ointment 【From 'Achieving Effect'】
This remedy treats various types of malignant sores and swellings, carbuncles, boils, dental swellings, bone fractures, sprains, knife and axe wounds, bruises from beating, snake and insect bites, dog and horse bites, burns from boiling water and fire, lacquer sores, scabies, and more; applying it will lead to healing. It also treats women who experience soreness from breastfeeding; for this, take pills the size of a paulownia seed and swallow twenty pills with fresh spring water. For lung or intestinal abscesses, these can also be made into pills to be taken with warm wine or rice drinks, or with broth made from licorice root. Do not let it come into contact with raw meat or fire.[438p]

　　上等黄丹八两，研极细　白胶香　明没药　滴乳香并别研　大当归　川白芷　大黄　杏仁去皮尖　草乌头　川乌头　赤芍药　槟榔　生干地黄　乱发洗净　沥青别研　土芎各一两　　右除乳香、没药外，将瓷石铫子盛香油一斤，浸药一宿，慢火煎熬诸药黑色，再入葱白、乱发煎少时，用生绢帛滤去滓，留下一两药油，复将所滤油于慢火上熬，却将黄丹入油内，用长柳条、槐条不住手搅，候有微烟起，提起药铫，将柳条点药滴在水面上，凝结成珠不散，方成膏。如不成珠，上火再熬。直待成膏，提起药铫，搅无烟出，却入乳香、没药、白胶香末搅匀，倾出瓷器中，将元留下浸药铫油一并收拾器内，用新汲水将药器坐于水内，一日一换，过三日出火毒，方可用之。如膏药硬，约量加黄蜡、清油入膏内，搅匀得所。熬膏极难于火候，须耐烦看火紧慢，火猛则药中火发，不但失药性，又燎伤制药人面目，慎之！[439p]

Eight taels of top-grade yellow lead are to be ground very fine. Add white frankincense, myrrh, and lactiferous resin, and grind separately. Include large angelica, Sichuan white atractylodes, rhubarb, peeled apricot kernels, dried and fresh aconite, red peony, areca nut, fresh dried rehmannia, and cleaned wild hair, with each ingredient measured at one tael, except for the frankincense and myrrh.

Take a porcelain mortar and add one jin of sesame oil, soaking the herbs overnight. Slow-cook the herbs over a gentle flame until they turn black. Then, add chopped spring onion and wild hair, cooking for a short time. Filter through raw silk to remove residue, leaving one tael of herbal oil.

Further heat the filtered oil over a slow flame, adding the yellow lead. Stir continuously with long willow or locust branches until slight smoke appears. Lift the mortar and let drops of the medicinal mixture fall onto the water's surface; they should form beads that do not disperse. This indicates that it has turned into an ointment. If it does not bead, continue to heat it.

Once it has become salve, remove the mortar and stir it without smoke forming. Then mix in powdered frankincense, myrrh, and white frankincense evenly, pouring it out into a porcelain vessel. Gather the oil used for soaking and store it in the same container. Place the medicinal vessel in fresh water, changing the water once a day for three days to eliminate the fire's toxic properties before use.

If the salve is too hard, measure and add yellow wax and refined oil to achieve the desired consistency. Cooking the salve is very difficult; one must patiently monitor the heat. If the fire is too strong, the medicinal properties may be destroyed, and it may injure the person making the medicine. Be careful![439p]

　　元武膏　治痈疽发背、疔肿、内外臁疮、阴疰下诸恶疮，及头项痈肿，不问已溃未溃皆可用，大能排脓散毒，止疼生肌，累有神验。若疔肿，先用银篦或鹿角针，于疔疮中间及四畔针破，令恶血出，以追毒饼如小麦大，插入孔中，却用此膏贴之。如疮坏烂至甚，难以药贴，则将皂角二三片煎油，调匀此膏如稠糊，薄敷之；脓水或转多，不数次敷之干，愈妙。　　大巴豆去壳膜　木鳖子去壳切片，各二两，净　黄丹四两，研细　槐柳嫩枝各七寸长，七条，銼碎　真麻油十两　　右依前法，煎熬成膏贴用。[440p]

Yuan Wu Gao is used to treat abscesses, carbuncles, internal and external ulcers, various severe sores, and head and neck swellings, regardless of whether they have ruptured or not. It effectively dispels pus, relieves pain, promotes tissue regeneration, and has proven effective numerous times. For carbuncles, first use a silver probe or deer horn needle to pierce the center and edges of the abscess to release the stagnant blood. Then prepare a toxin pancake about the size of a wheat grain, insert it into the puncture, and apply this ointment on top. If the sore is severely necrotic and difficult to apply ointment, boil two or three pieces of soapberry in oil to make a thick paste and apply it thinly. If pus becomes excessive, repeat the application several times until it dries; this method is remarkably effective.

For the preparation, use two taels each of shelled and sliced Areca nut and Ba Dou (the seed of the Croton plant), four taels of yellow arsenic finely ground, and seven sticks of tender branches of Sophora japonica, each seven inches long, crushed finely. Add ten taels of pure hemp oil, and follow the aforementioned method to brew it into a paste for application.[440p]

　　金丝膏　治伤筋动骨，损痛闪肭，风毒恶疮，风湿筋寒诸病。　　当归尾　川白芷　杏仁去皮尖双仁　元参　猪牙皂角去皮弦　黄蘗　草乌生銼，各三钱　白胶香明者，八两　连须叶葱肥大者，十根　沥青明者，半斤　乳香　没药别研为末，各半两　黄蜡明者，一两　男子乱发洗净挼，如鸡子大　　右用清油半斤，将八味依前法熬滤，却入胶香、沥青搅匀，下黄蜡又搅，无烟方下乳香、没药。
　　长肌膏　治年久诸般烂疮，贴之即愈。　　白烛油四钱　黄蜡　香油各八钱　黄连三钱　大枫子去壳切细，五钱　番木鳖肉切细，二钱。以上七味，同煎滤，去渣入后药　枯矾　轻粉各三钱　密陀僧五分，各研细　　右将前七味煎滤，入后三味，拌匀俟凝，看疮口大小，做薄饼，簪穿小孔十数，贴疮上，或日易之。盐茶汤洗疮，并洗饼再贴，以好为度。[441p]

Gold Silk Ointment treats injuries to muscles and bones, pain from sudden strains, harmful sores from wind and toxins, rheumatic conditions, and cold-related diseases.

Ingredients:

  • Three qian each of Angelica tail, Sichuan Bai Zhi, peeled and blanched apricot kernels, Yuan Shen, peeled and sliced pig's tooth soap pod, Huang Bo, and Caowu.
  • Eight liang of pure white resin.
  • Ten large amounts of green onion.
  • Half a jin of pitch.
  • Each half a liang of frankincense and myrrh, ground into a fine powder.
  • One liang of clarified yellow wax.
  • Wash and knead the men's hair until it's egg-sized.

Instructions: Use half a jin of clean oil, heat all eight ingredients as previously mentioned, filter them, then mix in the resin, pitch, and blend thoroughly. Add the yellow wax and mix again. After the mixture is smoke-free, add frankincense and myrrh.

Long Muscle Ointment treats chronic sores; applying it will heal them.

Ingredients:

  • Four qian of beeswax oil.
  • Eight qian each of yellow wax and fragrant oil.
  • Three qian of Huang Lian.
  • Five qian of shelled and finely chopped large hamfat.
  • Two qian of finely chopped seeds of the Jackfruit plant.

The above seven ingredients are decocted and filtered, then the dregs removed and the following medications added:

  • Three qian each of burnt alum and light powder, and five fen of myrrh, all ground finely.

Instructions: Combine the first seven ingredients, bring to a boil, filter, mix in the last three ingredients until uniform, and wait for it to congeal. Based on the size of the sore, make thin cakes, pierce several small holes with a needle, and apply to the sore. Change daily. Use salt tea to wash the sore and clean the cake before reapplying, adjusting as needed for the best results.[441p]

　　精要生肌散　寒水石碎　滑石　乌鲗骨　龙骨各一两　定粉　密陀僧　白矾灰　干胭脂各半两　　右为细末，干掺用之。

　　平肌散　治诸疮久不敛。
　　密陀僧煅研　花蕊石煅研　白龙骨各一两　乳香另研　轻粉各一钱　　右为细末，和匀干掺。

　　生肌散
　　白矾枯　槟榔各一两　黄丹　血竭各一钱　轻粉半钱　密陀僧一钱半
　　红玉散
　　软石膏煅，半两　黄丹炒，一钱半

　　完肌散
　　定粉　枯矾　黄连　乳香　龙骨各二钱　黄丹　轻粉各一钱　　右为极细末，贴疮口，生肌长肉，看轻重选用之。[442p]

Essence for Skin Regeneration Powder
Crushed cold water stone, talc, black eel bone, and dragon bone, each one tael;
Ding powder, myrrh, white alum ash, and dried rouge, each half tael.
Grind finely and use after mixing.

Calming Skin Powder
Used for sores that do not heal.
Myrrh, flower ore, and white dragon bone, each one tael;
Frankincense, ground separately; light powder, each one qian.
Grind finely, mix well, and use dry.

Skin Regeneration Powder
White alum (dried), areca nut, each one tael;
Yellow lead and dragon's blood, each one qian;
Light powder, half qian; myrrh, one and a half qian.

Red Jade Powder
Soft plaster, roasted, half tael;
Yellow lead, roasted, one and a half qian.

Complete Skin Powder
Ding powder, dried alum, coptis, frankincense, and dragon bone, each two qian;
Yellow lead and light powder, each one qian.
Grind into extremely fine powder, apply to the sore, to regenerate skin and promote tissue growth; select according to weight.[442p]

　　生肌散　治疮口不合。
　　木香　轻粉各二钱　黄丹　枯矾各五钱　　右件各另为细末，用猪胆汁拌匀，晒干再研细，掺患处。　　又方　治寒疮敛口药。
　　归身一钱，洗晒干　青皮去白，二分　木香一分　黄连五分　　右四味为极细末，蜡油调涂，取效甚速。
　　保命乳香散　治疮口大者。
　　寒水石煅　滑石各一两　乳香　没药各半两　脑子少许　　右各研细，和匀少许，掺疮口上。

　　圣效散　收敛疮口。
　　黄蘗一两，去粗皮炒赤黑色　穿山甲一两，炒　槟榔　木香各半两，炒黄色　鸡(月坒)胵七枚，生用　　右为细末，每用少许，候大脓出尽，洗净，方可干掺疮上。
　　桃红散　敛疮口，定痛，辟风邪。
　　滑石四两　乳香　轻粉各二钱　小豆粉一两　寒水石三两，煅　　右为细末，干掺口上。　一方，改小豆粉为定粉。　　又方　治疮口久不收。[443p]

Shengji San: Treats non-union of ulcer edges.
Ingredients: 2 qian of Mu Xiang and Qing Fen each; 5 qian of Huang Dan and Ku Fan each. Grind them into fine powder separately, mix with pig bile, dry, and then grind finely again to apply to the affected area.

Another formula: Treats cold ulcers and promotes closure.
Ingredients: 1 qian of Gui Shen, washed and dried; 2 fen of Qing Pi, white part removed; 1 fen of Mu Xiang; 5 fen of Huang Lian. Grind these four ingredients into extremely fine powder, mix with wax oil, and apply for quick effect.

Bao Ming Ru Xiang San: Treats large ulcer edges.
Ingredients: 1 liang each of Han Shui Shi and Hua Shi; 0.5 liang each of Ru Xiang and Mo Yao; a little of Na Zi. Grind all ingredients finely, mix a small amount, and apply to the ulcer.

Sheng Xiao San: Closes ulcer edges.
Ingredients: 1 liang of Huang Bo, remove coarse skin and fry to black; 1 liang of Chuan Shan Jia, fried; 0.5 liang each of Bing Lang and Mu Xiang, fried to yellow; 7 pieces of Jiao (Mayou) Xia, used fresh. Grind into fine powder, use a little each time after the pus has drained well, clean, and then dry sprinkle on the ulcer.

Tao Hong San: Closes ulcer edges, alleviates pain, dispels wind evils.
Ingredients: 4 liang of Hua Shi; 2 qian each of Ru Xiang and Qing Fen; 1 liang of Xiao Dou Fen; 3 liang of Han Shui Shi, calcined. Grind these into fine powder and dry sprinkle on the ulcer. Another formula substitutes Xiao Dou Fen with Ding Fen. Another formula treats ulcers that have long been open.[443p]

　　小椒去目炒黑　乳香　没药各一钱　定粉　风化硝各二钱　白矾二钱半　　右为细末，掺之。

　　黄丹散　敛疮口。
　　黄丹煅枯矾　龙骨　寒水石　乳香　黄连　木香不见火　黄芩　槟榔　腻粉各三钱　脑子少许　　右为末，随疮干湿用之。干则用温盐汤洗，湿净干却掺其上。用不可太早，须脓血去尽，临好方用，不然则又臖作。
　　橘半胃苓汤　治痈疽呕吐不下食，不知味。　　橘红　半夏姜制，各一钱　苍朮米泔浸一宿炒　白朮炒　厚朴姜制　甘草炙　茯苓　人参　泽泻　茅根各二钱　姜汁敷匙水二锺，煎一锺，入姜汁煎一二沸，作十余次饮之。
　　托里健中汤　治疮疡元气素虚，或因凉药伤胃，饮食少思，或作呕泻等证。　　肉桂三分　人参　白朮　茯苓各二钱　半夏　炮姜各一钱　炙甘草五分　黄芪一钱五分　　右，姜枣水煎服。[444p]

Small pepper ground to a fine powder, frankincense, and myrrh each one qian; stabilize powder and wind-blown salt each two qian; white alum two and a half qian. Mix these into a fine powder.

Yellow Dan powder to close wound openings.
Yellow Dan calcined, dry alum, dragon bone, cold water stone, frankincense, coptis, wood fragrance not exposed to fire, yellow root, betel nut, and oily powder each three qian; a small amount of brains. Mix these into a powder, and use according to the dryness or wetness of the wound. If dry, wash with warm salt water; if wet, clean and dry, then apply this powder. Do not use too early; ensure all pus and blood are gone before applying, otherwise it may become inflamed again.

Tangerine Half Stomach Mixture treats boils, vomiting, inability to eat, and absence of taste. Tangerine peel, pinellia prepared with ginger, each one qian; fragrant poria soaked overnight, then fried; white atractylodes fried; magnolia bark prepared with ginger; honey-fried licorice; poria; ginseng; water plantain; and reed root each two qian. Mix ginger juice with two bowls of water, decoct to one bowl, add ginger juice and boil for a brief moment, take ten or more doses.

Supporting the Middle Mixture treats chronic sores and ulcers with deficiency of vital energy, or due to cool medicines harming the stomach, leading to a decrease in appetite, or causing vomiting and diarrhea. Cinnamon three fen; ginseng, white atractylodes, and poria each two qian; pinellia and fried ginger each one qian; honey-fried licorice five fen; astragalus one qian and five fen. Mix these, and decoct in ginger and jujube water for consumption.[444p]

　　托里益中汤　治中气虚弱，饮食少思，或疮不消散，或溃而不敛。　　人参　白朮土炒　陈皮　半夏　白茯苓　炮姜各一钱　木香　炙甘草各五分　　右，姜枣水煎服。

　　托里抑青汤　治脾土虚弱，肝木所侮，以致饮食少思，或胸膈不利等证。　　人参　白朮　茯苓　陈皮　半夏各一钱　芍药　柴胡　甘草各五分　　右，姜枣水煎服。

　　托里清中汤　治脾胃虚弱，痰气不清，饮食少思等证。　　人参　白朮　陈皮　茯苓各一钱　半夏八分　桔梗七分　甘草五分　　右，姜枣水煎服。

　　托里益黄汤　治脾土虚寒，水反侮土，以致饮食少思，或呕吐泄泻等证。　　人参　白朮　陈皮　茯苓　半夏各一钱　炮姜　丁香　炙甘草各五分　　右，姜枣水煎服。

　　托里越鞠汤　治六郁所伤，脾胃虚弱，饮食少思等证。　　人参　白朮各二钱　陈皮　半夏各一钱　山栀　川芎　香附　苍朮各七分　炙甘草五分　　右，姜枣水煎服。[445p]

Torii Yi Zhong Decoction: Treats weak central qi, lack of appetite, non-healing sores, or sores that do not close. Ingredients: ginseng, white atractylodes (stir-fried), dried tangerine peel, pinellia, white poria, and fried ginger, each 3 grams; musk and roasted licorice each 2.5 grams. Prepare by decocting with ginger and jujube water.

Torii Yi Qing Decoction: Treats weak spleen qi, bullied by liver wood, leading to lack of appetite or chest stagnation symptoms. Ingredients: ginseng, white atractylodes, poria, dried tangerine peel, and pinellia, each 3 grams; peony, bupleurum, and licorice each 2.5 grams. Prepare by decocting with ginger and jujube water.

Torii Qing Zhong Decoction: Treats weak spleen and stomach, unclear phlegm and qi, and lack of appetite. Ingredients: ginseng, white atractylodes, dried tangerine peel, and poria, each 3 grams; pinellia 2.5 grams, platycodon 2.5 grams, and licorice 1.5 grams. Prepare by decocting with ginger and jujube water.

Torii Yi Huang Decoction: Treats cold and weakness of spleen qi, water damaging the earth, leading to lack of appetite or symptoms like vomiting and diarrhea. Ingredients: ginseng, white atractylodes, dried tangerine peel, poria, and pinellia each 3 grams; fried ginger, clove, and roasted licorice each 2.5 grams. Prepare by decocting with ginger and jujube water.

Torii Yue Ju Decoction: Treats injuries from six stagnations, weak spleen and stomach, and lack of appetite. Ingredients: ginseng and white atractylodes each 6 grams; dried tangerine peel and pinellia each 3 grams; gardenia, ligusticum, cyperus, and aster each 2.5 grams; roasted licorice 1.5 grams. Prepare by decocting with ginger and jujube water.[445p]

　　人参理中汤　治疮疡，脾胃虚寒，呕吐泄泻，饮食少思，肚腹作胀，或胸膈虚痞，饮食不入。　　白朮　人参　干姜　甘草炙，各等分　　右，姜枣水煎服。

　　黄芪人参汤　痈疽脓血大泄，败臭痛甚，宜用。　　人参　苍朮米泔浸炒　白朮炒　麦门冬去心　陈皮　当归酒拌　神曲炒　甘草炙　五味子杵，各一钱　黄芪炙，二钱　黄蘗炒　升麻各四分　　右作一剂，水二锺，姜三片，枣二枚，煎八分，食远服。
　　加味解毒汤　痈疽大痛不止，宜用。　　黄芪盐水拌炒　黄连炒　黄芩炒　黄蘗炒　连翘　当归酒拌，各七分　甘草炙　白芍药　栀子仁炒，各一钱　　右作一剂，水二锺，煎八分服之，药下痛即止。
　　内补黄芪汤
　　黄芪盐水拌炒，二钱　熟地黄酒拌　人参　茯苓　甘草炙，各五分　芍药炒　川芎　官桂　远志去心　当归酒拌，各八分麦门冬去心五分　作一剂，水一锺半，姜三片，枣二枚，煎六分，食远服。[446p]

Ren Shen Li Zhong Decoction: Treats sores and ulcers, spleen and stomach deficiency with cold, vomiting and diarrhea, decreased appetite, abdominal distention, or empty nausea in the chest with inability to consume food. Ingredients: Bai Zhu, Ren Shen, Gan Jiang, and Gan Cao, equal parts. Prepare by decocting with ginger and jujube water.

Huang Qi Ren Shen Decoction: For boils with purulent blood and severe pain, should be used. Ingredients: Ren Shen, Cao Zhu Mi soaked and stir-fried, Bai Zhu stir-fried, Mai Men Dong (with hearts removed), Chen Pi, Dang Gui mixed with wine, Shen Qu stir-fried, Gan Cao, and Wu Wei Zi, each one qian; Huang Qi stir-fried, two qian; Huang Bo stir-fried and Sheng Ma, each four fen. Prepare as one dose, with two sheng of water, three slices of ginger, two jujubes, decoct to eight parts, take away from meals.

Jia Wei Jie Du Decoction: For severe and persistent pain from boils. Ingredients: Huang Qi mixed with salt water and stir-fried, Huang Lian stir-fried, Huang Qin stir-fried, Huang Bo stir-fried, Lian Qiao, Dang Gui mixed with wine, each seven fen; Gan Cao stir-fried, Bai Shao Yao, and Zhi Zi Ren stir-fried, each one qian. Prepare as one dose, with two sheng of water, decoct to eight parts, take when pain subsides.

Nei Bu Huang Qi Decoction: Huang Qi mixed with salt water and stir-fried, two qian; Shu Di Huang mixed with rice wine, Ren Shen, Fu Ling, and Gan Cao stir-fried, each five fen; Bai Shao stir-fried, Chuan Xiong, Guan Gui, Yuan Zhi (with hearts removed), Dang Gui mixed with wine, each eight fen; Mai Men Dong (with heart removed) five fen. Prepare as one dose, with one and a half sheng of water, three slices of ginger, two jujubes, decoct to six parts, take away from meals.[446p]

　　当归和血散　治疮疡未发出，内痛不可忍；及治妇人产前产后腹痛。　　当归二钱　乳香半钱　没药一钱半　芍药三钱　　右为细末，每服一钱，水一中盏，煎七分，和滓温服，日二。妇人酒煎。疮既发，不须用。疮痒者，加人参、木香。妇人服之，加赤芍药。
　　回疮金银花散　治疮疡痛甚，色变紫黑者。　　金银花连枝叶俱用，銼研二两　黄芪四两　甘草一两　　右(口父)咀，用酒一升，同入壶瓶内，闭口，重汤煮三两时辰，取出去滓顿服之。一方无黄芪。
　　郭氏定痛托里散　治一切疮肿疼，痛不可忍。如少壮气充实，先用疏利，后服此药。　　粟壳去蒂炒，二两　当归　芍药　川芎各半两　乳香　没药　桂各三钱　　右(口父)咀，每服五钱，水煎。[447p]

Angelica and Blood Dispersing Powder: For the treatment of sores that have not yet erupted, with unbearable internal pain; also for abdominal pain before and after childbirth in women.

  • Ingredients: 2 qian of Angelica, 0.5 qian of Frankincense, 1.5 qian of Myrrh, 3 qian of Peony.
  • Prepare a fine powder. Take 1 qian each time, with 1 medium bowl of water, simmer to 70% remaining, mix and take warm with residue, twice a day. For women, decoct in wine. If sores have already appeared, it is not necessary to use this. For itching sores, add Ginseng and Wood Fragrance. For women, add Red Peony.

Returning Sores Honeysuckle Powder: For the treatment of sores that are very painful, with purple-black discoloration.

  • Ingredients: Honeysuckle with branches and leaves, 2 liang ground finely, 4 liang of Astragalus, 1 liang of Licorice.
  • Chew and consume with 1 sheng of wine, place in a container, seal it, and boil in heavy water for 3 to 6 hours. Take it after straining. In some cases, Astragalus may be omitted.

Guo's Pain Relieving Tuo Li Powder: For all types of painful swellings that are unbearable. If you are strong and full of energy, first use a laxative, then take this medicine.

  • Ingredients: 2 liang of roasted Vetch hulls, 0.5 liang each of Angelica, Peony, and Chuanxiong, 3 qian each of Frankincense, Myrrh, and Cinnamon.
  • Chew each dose, take 5 qian, and prepare with water.[447p]

　　乳香止痛散　治一切疮肿疼痛不止。　　粟壳六两　白芷三两　炙草　陈皮各一两半　乳香　没药各一两　丁香半两　　右(口父)咀，每服三钱，水一盏半煎。
　　乳香黄芪散　治一切恶疮、痈疽、发背、疔疮，疼痛不可忍者，或未成者速散，已成者速溃，败脓不假刀砭，其恶肉自下；及治打扑伤损，筋骨疼痛。　　黄芪去芦　当归酒洗　川芎　麻黄去根节　甘草生　芍药　人参去芦　粟壳蜜炒，各一两　乳香另研　没药另研，各五钱陈皮一两　　右为细末，每服三钱，水一盏，煎至七分，去渣温服。如疮在上，食后；在下，食前服之。
　　人参内托散　治疮疡溃脓而作痛者。　　人参　黄芪　当归　川芎　厚朴　防风　桔梗　白芷　官桂　紫草　木香　甘草　　右，入糯米一撮，水煎服。[448p]

Frankincense Pain Relief Powder: Treats all kinds of sores, swellings, and persistent pain.
Ingredients: 6 liang of buckwheat husks, 3 liang of white atractylodes, 1.5 liang each of honey-fried licorice and dried tangerine peel, 1 liang each of frankincense and myrrh, and 0.5 liang of cloves.
Preparation: Grind the ingredients together and take 3 qian with 1.5 cups of water, decocting.

Frankincense Astragalus Powder: Treats all kinds of foul sores, boils, carbuncles, abscesses that are intolerably painful. Whether not yet formed or already formed, it should disperse quickly; if mature, it should burst quickly, pus can be expelled naturally without surgical intervention, and necrotic tissue will fall off on its own. Additionally, it treats injuries from strikes, and pain in muscles and bones.
Ingredients: 1 liang of astragalus (removed from husk), alcohol-washed angelica, 1 liang each of ligusticum, ephedra (roots removed), fresh licorice, mock peony, and ginseng (removed from husk), honey-fried buckwheat husks, 5 qian each of frankincense and myrrh, and 1 liang of dried tangerine peel.
Preparation: Grind into a fine powder, take 3 qian with 1 cup of water, decoct until down to 70%, strain and take warm. If the sore is above, take after meals; if below, take before meals.

Ginseng Internal Suppression Powder: Treats painful sores and abscesses that have burst and caused pain.
Ingredients: Ginseng, astragalus, angelica, ligusticum, magnolia bark, saposhnikovia, balloon flower, white atractylodes, cinnamon, indigo, aromatic wood, and licorice.
Preparation: Add a small amount of glutinous rice and decoct in water.[448p]

　　乳香丸　治发背及一切疽疮溃烂，痛不可忍。　　乳香　没药并另研极细　羌活　五灵脂　独活各三钱　川芎藭　当归　真菉豆粉　交址桂　川白芷　白胶香各半两　　右为细末，炼蜜丸如弹子大，每服一丸，细嚼薄荷汤送下。手足损痛，不能起者，加草乌，用木瓜盐汤送下。
　　乳香定痛散　治一切疮疡溃烂疼痛。　　乳香　没药各五钱　滑石　寒水石各一两　冰片一钱　　右为细末，擦患处，痛即止。敷药中加南星、半夏，能止痛；更加蓖麻仁尤佳。
　　乳香膏　治诸疮痛久不瘥。
　　乳香另研，一两　食盐　杏仁去皮尖双仁研　松脂各一两半　生地黄取汁三合　黄蜡三两　白羊肾(月臣)脂半斤　　右先熬脂令沸，下杏仁、地黄汁、蜡煎，候蜡镕尽，入乳香、盐、松脂煎，以柳蓖搅令匀，稀稠得所，磁盒盛，敷疮上，日二三度。[449p]

Frankincense Pills: Treats hair follicle issues and all types of boils and ulcers that are unbearably painful. Ingredients include frankincense, myrrh (both ground very finely), Qianghuo, Wulingzhi, and Duhuo, each three qian; Chuanxiong, Danggui, Zhenlungdou flour, Jiaozhi桂, Chuanbaizhi, and Baijiaoxiang, each half a liang. Grind these into a fine powder, mix with honey to form pills the size of a marble. Take one pill, chew it well, and wash it down with mint tea. For severe pain in hands and feet that prevents movement, add cao wu and take with papaya salt water.

Frankincense Pain-Relief Powder: Treats all wounds and ulcers with pain and swelling. Ingredients include frankincense, myrrh, each five qian; talc and han shui stone, each one liang; and ice powder one qian. Grind into a fine powder and apply to the affected area; pain will cease. Adding nanshen and banxia can also relieve pain; adding castor seeds is even better.

Frankincense Ointment: Treats wounds that are painful and do not heal over time. Ingredients include frankincense (ground separately, one liang), salt, peeled apricot kernels (two kernels crushed), pine resin (one and a half liang), fresh Rehmannia juice (three doses), yellow wax (three liang), and white sheep kidney fat (half a jin). First, simmer the fat until boiling, then add apricot kernels, Rehmannia juice, and wax to boil. Once the wax has melted completely, add frankincense, salt, and pine resin, stirring with a willow stick to achieve a proper consistency. Store in a ceramic box and apply to wounds two to three times a day.[449p]

　　乳香膏
　　木鳖子去壳细銼　当归各一两　柳枝一尺六寸銼，同以清油四两煎令黑色，次用后药　乳香　没药各半两　白胶香明净者四两，同研极细，入油煎化，用绵子滤之右，炼药铁铫令极净，再倾前药油蜡在内，候温入黄丹一两半，以两柳枝搅极得所，再上火煎，不住手搅，候油沸起住搅，注在水中成珠不散为度，秋冬欲软，春夏欲坚，倾在水中出火毒，搜成剂收之。
　　东垣圣愈汤　治诸恶疮血出不止，以寒水石细末掺之，立止。或疮时间作黑色，不可溃也，药力去尽，却红和。如血出多而心烦不安，不得眠睡，此亡血也，此汤主之。　　熟地黄　生地黄各三钱　当归身一钱半　川芎二钱　黄芪五分　人参三分　　右(口父)咀，都作一服，水一盏半，煎至一盏，去滓稍热服，无时。[450p]

Frankincense Ointment
Take the shell of the wood-bitter fruit and finely shave it, along with one tael each of angelica root, and six inches of willow branch, all mixed with four taels of clean oil and decocted until it turns black. Then use the following: half a tael each of frankincense and myrrh, and four taels of pure white resin, ground extremely fine. Add this to the oil and decoct until melted, then filter it using cotton. Refine the medicine in an iron pan until it is very clean. Then pour the previous medicinal oil-wax into it, and when warm, add one and a half taels of yellow lead. Stir extremely well with two willow branches, then apply heat to simmer. Keep stirring until the oil boils, then stop stirring, and when testing in water, it should form beads and not disperse. In autumn and winter, it should be soft; in spring and summer, it should be hard. Pour into water to remove the toxic fire, gather the resulting formulation.

Dongyuan Shengyu Decoction
This treats various malignant sores with blood that won't stop bleeding. Mix fine dust of cold water stone with it to stop the bleeding immediately. If the sore turns black over time, it must not be allowed to ulcerate. When the medicinal power is exhausted, it will turn red. If there is excessive bleeding and the heart is disturbed, leading to insomnia, this is due to blood loss; this decoction is the treatment for it.
Use three qian each of cooked and raw rehmannia, one and a half qian of angelica root, two qian of chuanxiong, five fen of astragalus, and three fen of ginseng. These are to be ground, made into one dose, using a cup and a half of water, decocted until it reduces to one cup, then remove the dregs and take while slightly warm, at any time.[450p]

　　和气散　治痈疽溃后，气虚滑泄，四肢逆冷。　　苍朮四两，米泔浸三日，洗净晒干，再以米酢炒令香黄色　甘草炙　青皮去穰，各一两　良姜炒　肉桂　干姜炮，各半两　陈粟半升　　右七味为末，每服一钱，用炒茴香末半钱相和，温酒调下，不拘时。
　　瞿麦散　治痈疽发背，排脓止痛，利小便。　　桂心　赤芍药　当归　黄芪芎藭　瞿麦　白蔹　麦门冬去心，各等分　赤小豆一合，酒浸炒　　右(口父)咀，每服四钱，酒煎温服。如诸痈已溃未溃，疮中脓血不绝，痛难忍者，加细辛、白芷、白蔹、薏苡仁。
　　参苓白朮散
　　人参　茯苓　白朮炒　莲肉去心　砂仁炒杵　薏苡仁炒　山药各二两　桔梗炒　甘草炙　白扁豆去皮姜汁浸炒，各一两　　右为细末，每服二钱，用石菖蒲煎汤调下。[451p]

Harmony Powder
For treating sores and abscesses after they drain, with yang deficiency and coldness in the limbs. Two taels of Atractylodes, soak in rice wash for three days, rinse clean and dry, then stir-fry with rice vinegar until fragrant and yellow.
