I quickly administered two doses of Ginseng and Astragalus Decoction, but the heat increased further, suggesting that the medicinal power had not yet taken effect. After another two doses, the condition was indeed responding; I then prescribed several doses of Angelica Blood-Nourishing Decoction, and he recovered. Dongyuan states: If there is a fever with a dislike of heat, relentless thirst, irritability with a hot body, and a pulse that is large but weak upon pressure, or if there is pain in the eyes and dryness in the nose, it is not a case for Baihu Decoction; this is a case of blood deficiency causing agitation, and the Angelica Blood-Nourishing Decoction should be used for treatment.

A woman, having a weak spleen qi, suffered from a toxin that had not yet formed pus, with concurrent chills and fever and vomiting. After two doses of Jinzhengqi Powder, her symptoms ceased; she then took six doses of Tuoli Powder, and the sore ruptured; further, I administered spleen-strengthening medicine to help heal.[568p]

　　一男子患痈，脓成不溃，投以补剂而溃，更以健脾药而愈：气血壮实，脓自涌出。信夫！
　　一男子溃而瘀血不腐，以参、芪、归、朮峻补气血；更以桑木灸之腐而愈。
　　一童子腋下患痈，不敛脓清，脉大倦怠，懒食少寐，自汗口干，以内补黄芪汤及豆豉饼灸之，两月而愈。凡疮脓溃而清，或疮口不合，或聚肿不赤，肌寒肉冷，自汗色脱者，皆气血俱虚也，非补不可。
　　一男子腰患毒，脓熟不溃，针之脓大泄，反加烦躁，以圣愈汤四剂而宁；更以人参养荣汤加麦门冬、五味子两月而愈。此人后患湿气，遂为痼疾。凡疮脓血去多，疮口虽合，尤当补益，务使气血平复，否则更患他证，必难治疗。慎之！
　　一妇人患臂痈，疮口紫陷，脓清不敛。彼以为毒未尽，欲服攻毒之剂。予谓疮疡之证，肿起坚硬，脓稠者，实也；肿下软慢，脓稀者，虚也。遂用附子饼灸之，及饮十全大补汤百剂始愈。[569p]

A man suffered from a carbuncle; the pus had formed but had not yet ruptured. After taking a restorative remedy, it burst, and with further treatment to strengthen the spleen, he recovered: his vital energy and blood became robust, and the pus naturally flowed out. Indeed!

A man had a carbuncle that ruptured but the stagnant blood did not decay. He was given ginseng, astragalus, angelica, and atractylodes to vigorously replenish his qi and blood and was further treated with moxibustion on the affected area, leading to recovery.

A young boy had a carbuncle under his armpit, with the pus not clearing. His pulse was large and he was weak, disinterested in food, had difficulty sleeping, experienced spontaneous sweating, and had a dry mouth. He was treated internally with astragalus soup and moxibustion with fermented soybeans, resulting in recovery after two months. Generally, if a wound's pus ruptures and cleans, or if the wound does not close, or if there is a swelling that is not red and the flesh feels cold, or spontaneous sweating with a pale complexion, it indicates a deficiency in both qi and blood, thus supplementation is essential.

A man had a toxic swelling in his waist; the pus was ripe but had not ruptured. After needling, the pus leaked profusely but then caused him increased anxiety. He was treated with Shengyu Decoction for four doses, which brought him some peace; he then took Ren Shen Yang Rong Decoction with added Ophiopogon and Schisandra for two months before recovery. This man later suffered from dampness, which became a chronic ailment. If pus and blood from a wound reduce significantly, even if the wound closes, it is still crucial to provide nourishing support to restore qi and blood. Otherwise, he may develop other conditions that are difficult to treat. Be cautious!

A woman had a carbuncle on her arm; the wound was purple and sunken with clear pus that would not contain itself. She thought the toxicity was not yet exhausted and wanted to take purgative detoxifying medicine. I indicated that in cases of ulcers, if the swelling is hard and raised with thick pus, it shows excess; if the swelling is soft and slow to resolve with thin pus, it indicates deficiency. Therefore, I applied aconite paste for moxibustion and prescribed one hundred doses of a fortifying tonic, ultimately leading to her recovery.[569p]

　　一妇人患附骨痈，久而不敛，致腿细短软，脉来迟缓，以十全大补汤加牛膝、杜仲，及附子饼灸之，两月余而愈。凡脓溃之后，脉濇迟缓者易愈，以其有胃气故也；脉来细而沉，时止者，里虚而欲变证也。若烦痛尚未痊也。洪滑粗散者难疗，以其正气虚而邪气实也。
　　一男子风袭疮口，牙关紧急，腰背反张，以玉真散一服而愈，仍以托里药而敛。
　　一男子患痈将敛，遍身作痒，脉浮，以消风散二服而止；更以托里药而愈。
　　一男子肩下患疽，已数日，漫肿微痛，头甚多，皆如粟许，色不变，不起发，此气血虚也，诊其脉果然。先以仙方活命二剂杀其大势；更以托里药而起发疮头，虽溃，但流血水，气血尚虚，不能为脓也。彼欲服太乙锭子，予谓此药止能攻毒，不能托里。彼不深信，至四次饮食不进，疮色黑陷，吃逆不绝，胃气虚极也，不治。强投温中健脾之剂，不应而死。[570p]

A woman suffered from a bone abscess, which did not heal for a long time, resulting in a thin and shortened soft leg, and her pulse was slow. I treated her with the Ten Complete Great Supplement Decoction, adding Achyranthes and Eucommia, and moxibustion with aconite cake. After more than two months, she recovered. Generally, after pus has ruptured, if the pulse is weak and slow, it is easier to heal, as there is still stomach qi; if the pulse is thin and submerged, intermittently stopping, it indicates internal deficiency and a desire for change. If there is still pain and discomfort, it is difficult to heal when the pulse is coarse, slippery, and scattered, as it indicates a deficiency of righteous qi and excess of pathogenic qi.

A man was attacked by wind at a sore, with his jaw tightly closed and his back arched. I prescribed one dose of the Jade True Powder, and he recovered, then used a remedy to consolidate the sore.

Another man had an abscess about to resolve, with itching all over his body and a floating pulse. I gave him two doses of the Wind-Dispersing Powder, and the itching stopped; then I used a remedy to consolidate, and he recovered.

A man had a boil under his shoulder for several days, slightly swollen and painful, with many small lumps like millet, the color unchanged, and not yet maturing. This indicated deficiency of qi and blood, confirmed by his pulse. First, I prescribed two doses of the Immortal Formula to suppress the major condition. Then I used a remedy to stimulate the boil's maturation. Although it ruptured, it only oozed blood and water, indicating that qi and blood were still deficient and unable to produce pus. He wanted to take the Taiyi Pill, but I said this medicine merely attacks toxins and cannot consolidate. He did not believe me, and after he failed to eat for four meals, the sore turned black and concave, with relentless nausea, indicating extreme deficiency of stomach qi, leading to no treatment. I forcefully prescribed warming and strengthening the spleen medicine, but it did not respond, and he died.[570p]

　　一男子近胁患疽，肿而不溃，投大补之剂，溃而已愈，后患弱证而殁。
　　一男子腰中患疽，发而不溃，其气血止能起发，不能培养为脓也。投大补药数剂而溃，又数剂脓出尚清。乃服参芪归朮膏斤余，脓少稠；数斤，脓渐稠，肌肉顿生。凡大痈疽，借气血为主。若患而不起，或溃而不腐，或不收敛，及脓少或清，皆气血之虚也，宜大补之，最忌攻伐之剂。亦有脓反多者，乃气血虚而不能禁止也。若溃后发热作渴，脉大而脓愈多，属真气虚而邪气实也，俱不治。常见气血充实之人，患疮皆肿高色赤，易腐溃而脓且稠，又易于收敛；怯弱之人，多不起发，不腐溃，及难于收敛。若不审察而妄投攻剂，虚虚之祸不免矣。及患后当调养，若瘰疬流注之证，尤当补益也；否则更患他证，必难措治。慎之！[571p]

A man had a swelling by his side due to an abscess that did not rupture. He was given a strong tonic, and once it ruptured, he was cured; however, he later suffered from weakness and died.

Another man had an abscess in his lower back that appeared but did not rupture. His energy and blood could only initiate the symptoms but could not develop into pus. After several doses of a strong tonic, it ruptured, and after additional doses, the pus that came out was still clear. He then took a mixture of ginseng, astragalus, and other tonics; when the pus was scant and thick, after a few more doses, the pus gradually became thicker, and muscle tissue began to regrow.

For serious abscesses, energy and blood are crucial. If the condition does not progress or if it ruptures but remains unhealed, or if it does not close up and the pus is scant or clear, it indicates a deficiency of energy and blood, necessitating strong tonics, with a strict avoidance of aggressive treatments. In cases where there is an excess of pus, this also stems from a deficiency of energy and blood that cannot be restrained. If after rupture there is fever and thirst, with a strong pulse and increasing pus, this signifies a deficiency of true energy alongside an excess of pathogenic qi, and treatment becomes difficult.

Generally, people with sufficient energy and blood tend to have swollen, high, red abscesses that are prone to easy rupture and thick pus, making it easier for recovery. Conversely, weak individuals often do not develop or rupture abscesses easily, and their conditions are hard to treat. If one does not carefully assess and recklessly administer aggressive treatments, they will inevitably encounter disaster due to deficiency.

After any illness, especially in cases of scrofula and suppurative diseases, it is crucial to focus on nourishment. Otherwise, if other illnesses arise, treatment will be extremely challenging. Be cautious![571p]

　　一男子肩患毒，肿硬作痛，恶证迭见，用白矾末三钱糊丸，以葱头七茎煎汤送下，肿痛悉退；再服，诸证亦退；更以仙方活命饮二剂出水而消。此秘方，名千金化毒汤，本矾末葱汤调服，因末难服，故易为丸。
　　一男子胸患痈，焮痛烦躁，发热作渴，脉数而实，时季冬，予谓此热毒内畜也，须舍时从证，欲治以内疏黄连汤。彼以时当隆冬，乃杂用败毒药，愈炽，仍求治。投前汤二剂，后去二次，诸证悉退；以金银花散加连翘、山栀四剂，出水而消。大抵证有主末，治有权宜。治其主则末病自退，用其权则不拘于时，泥于守常必致病势危甚。况杂用攻剂，动损各经，故丹溪云：凡疮发于一经，只当求责本经，不可干扰余经。罗谦甫云：守常者，众人之见；知变者，智者之事。知常而不知变，细事因而取败者多矣。[572p]

A man suffered from a toxic condition in his shoulder, exhibiting swelling, hardness, and pain, with worsening symptoms recurring. A treatment was prepared with three qian of powdered alum to form pills, which were taken with a broth made from seven stalks of scallions. The swelling and pain completely subsided; after taking it again, all symptoms also disappeared. Furthermore, two doses of a miraculous life-saving drink were used, which expelled fluids and resolved the issue. This secret formula is named "Thousand Gold Detox Soup," prepared with powdered alum and scallion broth. Due to the difficulty in ingesting the powder, it was shaped into pills.

Another man had an abscess in his chest, accompanied by burning pain, agitation, fever, and thirst, with a rapid and strong pulse. During the winter season, I diagnosed this as an internal buildup of heat and toxins, needing treatment based on the symptoms at this time. I recommended using Huanglian Decoction for internal clearance. However, since it was mid-winter, he mixed in some toxic-damp dispelling medications, which caused the condition to worsen, and he continued to seek treatment. After administering the initial decoction twice and then stopping for two times, all symptoms subsided. By adding honeysuckle flower powder with Lianqiao and Sanjizhi in four doses, fluids were expelled and the problem resolved. Generally, one must identify the main symptoms and treat them accordingly. If the main issue is treated, the secondary symptoms will diminish. The choice of treatment should not be fixed to a particular time, as being tied to conventions can lead to serious illness. Moreover, the improper use of aggressive medications can harm the meridians. Therefore, Danxi taught that if a sore erupts in one meridian, we should address the root in that meridian without disturbing the others. Luo Qianfu stated, "Following conventions is the common perspective; understanding change is the wisdom of the discerning." Many fail due to ignorance of change while being overly concerned with details.[572p]

　　一上舍年逾四十，因怒胁内作痛不止，数日后外结一块，三寸许，漫肿色不赤，按之微痛，余谓怒气伤肝，致血伤气郁为患，以小柴胡汤对四物，倍用芎、归、黄芪、贝母、肉桂治之。彼谓丹溪云：肿疡内外皆壅，宜托里表散为主。又云：凡疮未破，毒攻脏腑，一毫热药，断不可用。况此证为气血凝滞，乃服流气饮，愈虚，始信而复求。始视之，虚证并臻，诊之胃气更虚。[573p]

At the age of over forty, an outbreak of anger caused persistent internal pain. After several days, an exterior lump formed, about three inches in size, swollen but not red, and slightly painful when pressed. I believed that the anger had harmed the liver, leading to blood injuries and stagnation of qi, resulting in these issues. I prescribed a formula of Xiao Chai Hu Decoction along with Si Wu Decoction, increasing the amounts of Chuanxiong, Angelica, Astragalus, Fritillaria, and Cinnamon to treat it. Others quoted Danxi, saying that the swelling and sores were due to internal and external stagnation, suggesting an approach that focused on resolving the excess. They further stated that before a sore has broken, if toxins attack the internal organs, no heat-inducing herbs should be used. Moreover, in this case, it was due to qi and blood stagnation, leading to using a qi-moving drink which seemed to worsen the deficiency, thus I began to trust it and sought further help. Upon examination, it was clear that signs of deficiency had collected, and the diagnosis revealed greater deficiency of stomach qi.[573p]

彼欲服余前药，余谓急者先治，遂以四君子汤加酒炒芍药、炮干姜四剂少安；更加当归，又四剂，胃气渐醒；乃去干姜，又加黄芪、芎、归、肉桂数剂，疮色少赤，并微作痛；又二十余剂而脓成，针之，却与十全大补汤。喜其谨疾，又两月余而瘳。夫气血凝滞，多因营卫之气弱，不能运散，岂可复用流气饮以益其虚？况各经血气，多寡不同，心包络、膀胱、小肠、肝经，多血少气；三焦，胆、肾、心、脾、肺，少血多气。然前证正属胆经少血之脏，人年四十以上，阴血日衰，且脉证俱属不足，肿疡内外皆壅，宜托里表散为主，乃补气血药而加之以行散之剂，非专攻之谓也。若肿焮痛甚，烦躁脉大，辛热之剂，不但肿疡不可用，虽溃疡亦不可用也。凡患者须分经络气血，地部远近，年岁老幼，禀气虚实，及七情所感，时令所宜而治之。常见以流气、十宣二药，概治结肿之证，以致取败者多矣。[574p]

He wanted to take the medicine I had prescribed earlier, but I advised that those in critical condition should be treated first. Therefore, I used the Four Gentlemen Decoction with wine, stir-fried with white peony and processed ginger in four doses to gradually ease his condition. I added more angelica, then four more doses, and his stomach qi began to recover. I then removed the processed ginger and added astragalus, chuanxiong, angelica, and cinnamon in several doses; the abscess was less red and had slight pain. After more than twenty doses, pus formed, and I circumcised it, followed by giving him the Complete Nutritional Decoction. Delighted with his careful recovery, it took just over two more months for him to heal completely.

In cases where qi and blood are stagnant, it often results from weakened nutritive and defensive qi, which fail to circulate and disperse. How can one use qi-stagnating drinks to strengthen its deficiency? Moreover, blood and qi in each meridian vary greatly: the pericardium, bladder, and small intestine meridians have more blood and less qi, while the triple burner, gallbladder, kidneys, heart, spleen, and lungs have more qi and less blood. The previous symptoms particularly belonged to the gallbladder meridian, which is deficient in blood. Those over forty experience a daily decline in yin blood, and both pulse and symptoms indicate deficiency; the swelling and sores both signify obstruction. Thus, it is advisable to focus on relieving the exterior and dispersing the congestion, while reinforcing qi and blood with additional dispersing agents, rather than a direct attack.

If the swelling and pain are severe, with irritability and a forceful pulse, warming and stimulating medications should not only be avoided for swollen sores but also should not be used for ulcers. In all cases, the treatment must distinguish between the meridians, the proximity or distance from the earth, the age of the patient, their innate qi deficiency or excess, as well as the emotional influences and seasonal appropriateness of the treatment. It is common to misuse qi-stagnating and ten-points-expelling medications to treat cases of swelling, thus leading to many failures.[574p]

　　一妇人疮溃后，吐鲜血三碗许，余用独参汤而血止；用四君、熟地、芎、归而疮愈。此血脱补气，阳生阴长之理也。若用凉血降火沉阴之剂，脾土生气复伤，不惟血不归源，而死无疑矣。
　　一武职患脑疽，内溃热渴，头面肿胀如斗，胸背色焮如涂丹，烦热便秘，此表里俱实，若非苦寒之剂，内疏外泄，则不救。遂针周项出脓，及用清凉饮一剂加大黄五钱，再用消毒散而痊。[575p]

A woman, after a sore ruptured, vomited about three bowls of fresh blood. I used a decoction of Radix Codonopsis (Dong Cong Xia Cao) and the bleeding stopped; then I administered Si Jun Zi Tang, Shou Di Huang, Chuan Xiong, and Dang Gui, resulting in the healing of the sore. This illustrates the principle that when blood is lost, one must replenish the qi; yin grows and yang is generated. If one were to use cold blood-cooling agents to reduce heat and subdue yin, it would harm the spleen and qi, not only failing to return the blood to its source but also undoubtedly leading to death.

A military man suffered from a brain abscess, experiencing internal rupture and extreme thirst, with his face and head swollen like a bowl, and his chest and back bright red as if painted with cinnabar, alongside irritability and constipation. This indicates both exterior and interior are full. If not addressed with bitter cold remedies to disperse internally and drain externally, he would not be saved. Thus, I performed acupuncture around the neck to drain the pus, and administered a cooling drink with five qian of Da Huang, followed by Xiao Feng San, resulting in recovery.[575p]

　　一男子疮溃而烦渴不安，以圣愈汤二剂而宁；以人参、黄芪、当归、地黄四剂渴止；又以八珍汤二十余剂而愈。大抵溃后有此证，属气血不足，须用参、芪以补气，当归、地黄以养血。若用苦寒之剂，必致有悞。
　　一男子患毒作渴，右关脉数，以竹叶黄芪汤治之少愈；更以补中益气汤加黄芩而愈。
　　一男子溃后口干，遇劳益甚，以补中益气汤加五味子、麦门冬治之而愈，更以黄芪六一汤而敛。
　　一男子患毒，溃后作痛，肢体倦怠，疮口不合，饮食不甘，以六君子汤加黄芪、川芎、当归，四剂而愈；更以托里散，月余而敛。
　　一男子溃后作痛，脉数而无力，以托里散加生地黄、黄蘗二剂而止；更以托里散数剂而安。
　　一男子溃后发热，左手脉数而有力，以人参败毒散一剂而止；更以托里散而瘥。[576p]

A man suffered from sores that festered and caused him intense thirst and restlessness. He was calmed with two doses of Shengyu Decoction; for his thirst, he was treated with four doses of ginseng, astragalus, angelica, and rehmannia. After receiving over twenty doses of Eight Treasures Decoction, he was cured. Generally, after such sores, if there are symptoms like this, it indicates insufficient qi and blood, necessitating the use of ginseng and astragalus to tonify qi, and angelica and rehmannia to nourish blood. If bitter and cold remedies are used, it will surely lead to adverse effects.

Another man experienced thirst due to toxicity, with a rapid pulse in the right guan position. He was treated with Bamboo Leaf and Astragalus Decoction and improved slightly; he was later cured with a modified Baizhong Yiqi Decoction with added Huangqin.

A man had dry mouth after sores, which worsened with exertion. He was treated with a modified Baizhong Yiqi Decoction with added Schisandra and Ophiopogon and improved, afterward further treated with Huangqi Liuyi Decoction to help consolidate.

Another man, afflicted with toxicity, experienced pain and bodily fatigue after the sores, with unhealed wounds and loss of appetite. He was treated with a modified Liu Junzi Decoction with added Astragalus, Chuanxiong, and Angelica, and improved after four doses; he was further treated with Tieli San and consolidated after about a month.

A man had pain after sores with a rapid and weak pulse. He was alleviated with two doses of Tieli San augmented with raw Rehmannia and Coptis; he then took several doses of Tieli San and became stable.

A man experienced fever after sores, with a rapid but strong pulse in the left hand. He was treated with one dose of Ren Shen Bai Du San, which provided relief; he then took Tieli San and recovered.[576p]

　　一男子溃后，发热，焮痛不止，烦躁便秘，右手脉沉实，以清凉饮一剂而止；更以托里消毒散四剂而瘳。
　　一男子溃后作痛，而脉濇，以定痛托里散饮之，敷乳香定痛散而止；更以托里散数剂而愈。
　　一男子溃而作痛，脉浮紧，以内补黄芪汤四剂而止，又二十余剂而愈。
　　一男子项患毒，溃而作痛；以参、芪、地黄、芎、归补之而止；更以八珍汤加黄芪、桔梗，三十余剂而愈。
　　一男子患痈，溃而作痛，脉软而濇。余谓气血虚，欲补之。彼不信，乃服攻伐之剂。反发寒热，始信之。仍投大补药而痊。大抵疮之始作也，先发为肿，气血郁积，蒸肉为脓，故多痛。脓溃之后，肿退肌宽，痛必渐减，若反痛，乃虚也。丹溪云：脓出而反痛，此为虚也，宜以补之。亦有秽气所触者，和解之；风寒所逼者，温散之。齐氏云：疮疽之证，有脏腑、气血、上下、真邪虚实不同也，不可不辨。如漫肿坚硬脓稠者，疮疽之实也；肿下软慢脓稀者，疮疽之虚也。[577p]

A man developed a sore after a rupture, experienced fever, constant pain, restlessness, and constipation, with a strong pulse in the right hand. He was given a cooling drink which alleviated his symptoms; subsequently, he took four doses of the Tori Detoxifying Powder and recovered.

Another man had pain following a rupture, with a dry pulse. He took the Settle Pain Tori Powder drink, applied a blend of myrrh for pain relief, and his pain ceased. Later, he took several doses of the Tori Powder and was cured.

A man experienced pain after a rupture, with a floating and tight pulse. He took four doses of the Inner Nourishing Astragalus Decoction which stopped the pain, and after more than twenty doses, he was healed.

A man suffered from a toxic condition in the neck, leading to a rupture and pain. He was treated with ginseng, astragalus, rehmannia, ligusticum, and angelica, which alleviated his issues. He then received over thirty doses of the Eight Treasures Decoction with added astragalus and platycodon, resulting in his recovery.

A man had a boil, which ruptured and caused pain; his pulse was soft and weak. I suggested he was suffering from deficiency in qi and blood and needed nourishment. He doubted this and took aggressive medicinal treatments instead, which led to chills and fever, causing him to believe in my diagnosis. He then took a potent tonic and recovered. Generally, at the early stage of sores, swelling appears first, with qi and blood stagnating, resulting in pus formation, hence the pain. Once the pus is discharged, swelling decreases and muscles relax, pain will gradually lessen. If pain returns, it indicates deficiency. Danxi noted: if pain is experienced again after pus has emerged, it signifies deficiency, necessitating nourishment. There are also cases touched by foul qi that require harmonization; and those constrained by wind and cold that need warming dispersals. The Qi clan stated that in the case of sores and boils, there are various factors involving the organs and meridians, qi and blood, the internal and external, and true evil vs. deficiency. These must be discerned. For example, if the swelling is hard and accompanied by thick pus, it indicates a solid condition; if the swelling below is soft and slow with thin pus, it indicates a deficient state.[577p]

泻利肠鸣，饮食不入，呕吐无时，手足并冷，脉弱皮寒，小便自利，或小便时难，大便滑利，声音不出，精神不爽者，悉脏腑之虚也；大便鞕，小便濇，饮食如故，腹满膨胀，胸膈痞闷，肢体疼痛，口苦喉干，烦躁多渴，身热脉大，精神昏塞者，悉脏腑之实也。凡诸疮疽，脓水清稀，疮口不合，聚肿不赤，肌寒肉冷，自汗色脱者，气血之虚也；肿起色赤，寒热疼痛，皮肤壮热，脓水稠粘，头目昏重者，气血之实也。[578p]

Diarrhea and abdominal rumbling, inability to eat or drink, vomiting without interval, cold hands and feet, weak pulse and cold skin, frequent urination or difficulty urinating, smooth and loose bowel movements, absence of voice, and dulled spirit indicate deficiency of the organs; hard stool, frequent urination, normal appetite, abdominal fullness and distension, chest tightness and discomfort, body pain, bitter mouth and dry throat, irritability and excessive thirst, body heat and strong pulse, and foggy spirit indicate excess in the organs. For sores and boils, if the pus is clear and thin, the sore edges do not come together, the swelling is not red, the flesh is cold, and there is spontaneous sweating and colorlessness, it indicates deficiency of qi and blood; if the swelling is red, with cold and hot pain, hot and vigorous skin, thick and sticky pus, and heaviness in the head and eyes, it indicates excess of qi and blood.[578p]

头痛鼻塞，目赤心惊，咽喉不利，口舌生疮，烦渴饮冷，睡语咬牙者，上实也；精滑不禁，大便自利，腰脚沉重，睡卧不宁者，下虚也。肩项不便，四肢沉重，目视不正，睛不了了，食不知味，音嘶色败，四肢浮肿者，真气虚也；肿焮尤甚，痛不可近，多日不溃，寒热往来，大便秘濇，小便如淋，心神烦闷，恍惚不宁者，邪气之实也。又日：真气夺则虚，邪气胜则实。又曰：诸疮为痒，为虚也。又曰：诊其脉洪大而数者实也，细微而软者虚也。虚则补之，和其气托里也；实则泄之，疏利而导其气。《内经》谓血实则决之，气虚则掣引之，是也。[579p]

Headache and nasal congestion, red eyes and heart palpitations, difficulty in the throat, sores in the mouth and tongue, thirst and drinking cold, talking in sleep and grinding teeth indicate excess in the upper body. If one experiences slippery essence that cannot be contained, spontaneous bowel movements, a heavy feeling in the waist and legs, and restless sleep, it indicates deficiency in the lower body. If one has discomfort in the shoulders and neck, heavy limbs, improper vision, unclear eyesight, lack of taste in food, hoarse voice and pale complexion, and swelling in the limbs, it indicates deficiency in vital energy. If there is severe swelling and pain that is unbearable, persistent without healing, alternating between cold and heat, constipation and diarrhea, painful urination, and disturbed spirit with confusion and restlessness, it indicates the presence of evil qi. Moreover, it is said: when vital energy is depleted, deficiency ensues; when evil qi prevails, excess occurs. Additionally, it is said: all sores that itch are due to deficiency. Furthermore, it is stated: a pulse that is large and rapid indicates excess, while a pulse that is fine and soft indicates deficiency. When deficient, one should tonify and harmonize the qi; when excessive, one should drain and guide the qi out. The "Inner Canon" states that if blood is excess, it should be drained; if qi is deficient, it should be gently pulled.[579p]

　　一男子溃后发热作痛，脉浮数，按之无力，劳而尤甚，以补中益气汤治之而止；更以十全大补汤而愈。常治左手脉小于右手而热者，用血药多于气药；右手脉小于左手而热者，用气药多于血药。
　　一男子溃后，发热头痛，脉浮紧，虚而兼表邪也，以补中益气汤加川芎、白芷二剂而止；更以托里药而愈。
　　一妇人溃后，发热少寐，四肢倦怠，以黄芪人参汤治之而安；更以十全大补汤加贝母、远志、麦门冬、酸枣仁、香附，月余而愈。[580p]

A man experienced fever and pain after a suppuration, with a floating and rapid pulse, weak upon pressure, and worsening with exertion. He was treated with the Bu Zhong Yi Qi Decoction, which alleviated his condition; he then fully recovered with the Shi Quan Da Bu Decoction. It is noted that when the left hand pulse is weaker than the right and exhibits heat, one should use more blood-tonifying herbs than qi-tonifying herbs; conversely, when the right hand pulse is weaker than the left and exhibits heat, one should use more qi-tonifying herbs than blood-tonifying herbs.

Another man, after suppuration, presented with fever and headache, with a floating and tense pulse, indicating both deficiency and an exterior pathogen. He was treated with the Bu Zhong Yi Qi Decoction, adding Chuan Xiong and Bai Zhi, which resolved the symptoms; he then recovered with the use of herbs to resolve phlegm.

A woman, following suppuration, exhibited fever and insomnia, with fatigue in her limbs. She was treated with a decoction of Huang Qi and Ren Shen, which provided stability; she then fully recovered after over a month using the Shi Quan Da Bu Decoction, adding Bei Mu, Yuan Zhi, Mai Men Dong, Suan Zao Ren, and Xiang Fu.[580p]

　　一妇人溃后发热，服清热败毒药愈甚，诊之脉濇，以四物汤加粟壳、乳香、没药二剂少止；又二剂而安。
　　一男子溃后，发热头微痛，日晡尤甚，脉浮，按之则濇，以人参养荣汤加柴胡、地骨皮而愈；又月余而敛。
　　一男子溃而恶寒，用四君子汤加桂，倍用黄芪大料，四剂而止；脓水尚多，投八珍汤加桂，数剂渐少；惟疮口不合，以附子饼及十全大补汤，每剂加炮附子五分，数剂乃去附子，又服月余而愈。
　　一男子溃后将愈，因劳四肢发热，烦躁不寐，以圣愈汤四剂而宁；更以托里药而愈。丹溪云：有四肢热，逢风寒如炙于火者，是人阴气虚而阳气盛也。
　　一男子溃后畏寒，脉虚，以四君子汤加炮姜四剂而愈；以十全大补汤月余而敛。仲景云：脉虚则血虚，血虚生寒，阳气不足也。疮肿脉虚，宜托里养血。信夫！[581p]

A woman with a boil developed a fever after its rupture; taking heat-clearing and detoxifying medicine worsened her condition. Upon examination, her pulse was thin, and she was treated with a modified Siwu Decoction, adding husks of millet, frankincense, and myrrh, resulting in some relief; after another two doses, she was stable.

A man had a boil that ruptured, causing fever and slight headache, especially worse in the evening. His pulse was floating and thin; he was treated with Ren Shen Yang Rong Decoction, adding Chai Hu and Di Gu Pi, which led to recovery after some time.

Another man experienced chills after a boil; he was treated with Si Jun Zi Decoction, adding cinnamon and doubling the quantity of astragalus major. After four doses, his condition improved; however, pus was still present, so he took Ba Zhen Decoction with cinnamon, gradually reducing it over several doses. His wound remained unhealed, so he was given a cake of aconite and Shi Quan Da Bu Decoction, with five fen of processed aconite added in each dose; after several doses, aconite was removed, and he continued taking the medicine for over a month until fully healed.

A man, nearing recovery from a boil, experienced fever in his limbs due to exertion, feeling restless and unable to sleep. He was treated with Sheng Yu Decoction for four doses, which calmed him; then he was given a restorative medicine, leading to recovery. Dan Xi noted that when one's limbs feel hot and they are sensitive to wind and cold, it indicates a deficiency of yin and an excess of yang.

Another man felt cold after a boil ruptured, with a weak pulse; he was treated with Si Jun Zi Decoction, adding processed ginger, and he improved after four doses. He was then given Shi Quan Da Bu Decoction for over a month, achieving stabilization. Zhongjing stated that a weak pulse signifies a deficiency of blood, leading to cold and insufficient yang qi. For swollen wounds with a weak pulse, nourishment and restorative measures should be used. Indeed![581p]

　　一妇人溃后发热，服凉药，反畏寒，以十全大补汤二剂而止；又以托里药而痊。
　　一男子溃后发热，服凉药益甚，诊之脉浮，乃气虚也，以补中益气汤加五味子、麦门冬，治之而止；更以托里药而敛。
　　一妇人溃后发热，脉浮而数，虚而兼表证也，以补中益气汤倍柴胡、升麻一剂而止；以托里药月余而敛。
　　一男子患痈溃而饮酒，焮痛发热，服黄连解毒汤二剂而止；更以托里消毒散而愈。常治痛而大便秘脉实者，用清凉饮治之。
　　一男子患痈，时值阴寒，忽恶寒，右手脉有而似无，此胃气虚而不任风寒也，以四君子汤加炮姜、肉桂二剂少止；又四剂而安。丹溪云：有卫气虚衰，不能温分肉实表而恶寒者；又有上焦之邪，隔绝荣卫，不能升降出表而恶寒者。东垣云：夜则恶寒，昼则安静，是阴血自旺于阴分也；夜则恶寒，昼亦恶寒，是重阴无阳也，当急泻其阴，峻补其阳；夜则安静，昼则恶寒，是阴气上溢于阳中也。[582p]

A woman developed a fever after an ulcer; she took cool medicine but instead felt cold, so she stopped after two doses of the Shiquan Dabu Decoction. Later, she took a medicine to reduce her internal dampness and recovered.

A man experienced increased fever after an ulcer and worsened after taking cooling medicine. Upon examination, his pulse was浮, indicative of qi deficiency, so he was treated with the Buzhong Yiqi Decoction, adding schisandra and ophiopogon, and he improved after treatment; he then took a damp-reducing medicine to recover.

A woman with a fever following an ulcer had a pulse that was浮 and rapid, showing deficiency alongside exterior symptoms. She was given a dose of the Buzhong Yiqi Decoction with double the amounts of bupleurum and cicely, and after this she stopped; she then took a damp-reducing medicine for a month and recovered.

A man with a carbuncle drank alcohol, developing pain and fever; he took the Huanglian Jiedu Decoction twice and improved. Later, he took a medicine to reduce internal dampness and detoxify, leading to his recovery. He would often treat pain and constipation with a cooling drink.

Another man suffering from a carbuncle experienced sudden chills while in a cold and damp environment; his pulse was present but faint in his right hand, indicating deficiency of stomach qi which could not withstand cold. He was treated with the Four Gentlemen Decoction, adding roasted ginger and cinnamon, and after two doses he felt better; after four doses more, he stabilized. Danxi remarked that when protective qi is weak and cannot warm the flesh in the exterior, it leads to coldness; there could also be evil in the upper chamber blocking the nourishment and protective qi, preventing elevation or dispersion of wind and causing chills. Dongyuan said: if cold is felt at night but not during the day, this indicates blood is thriving in the yin; if chills occur at night and during the day, it implies an excess of yin with insufficient yang, calling for urgent purging of the yin and strong support of the yang; if one feels calm at night but experiences chills during the day, this indicates yin energy overflowing into the yang.[582p]

　　一男子胸患毒焮肿，作呕喜冷，脉洪数，以黄连解毒汤二剂顿退；更以金银花散六剂而消。
　　一男子因疮痛伤胃气，少食作呕恶寒，以六君子汤加当归四剂少愈；以十宣散加白朮、茯苓、陈皮数剂而脓成；针之，又以前散去防风、白芷，数剂而痊。
　　一妇人脾气素弱，患毒未作脓，发寒热兼呕，以不换金正气散二剂而止；以托里散六剂而溃；更以健脾药而敛。
　　一男子作渴，欲发疽，以加减六味丸治之而消。
　　一男子患脑疽发热，脉数无力，以前丸治之。不信，自服滋阴药，以致不救。
　　一男子日饮水数碗，冬月亦然，彼恃壮窃喜，后口舌生疮，欲治以前丸。彼以为谬，乃服生津液药，渴不能止，发背疽而殁。
　　一男子脚面发疽，愈而作渴，以前丸治之而愈。夫加减八味丸，治阴虚火动之圣药也，有是证者，何以舍此？[583p]

A man suffered from a toxic swelling in his chest, felt nauseous and preferred cold. His pulse was strong and rapid. Two doses of Huanglian Jiedu Decoction immediately reduced the symptoms; he was then given six doses of Honeysuckle Powder, leading to resolution of the condition.

Another man, who had a sore that injured his stomach qi, experienced reduced appetite, nausea, and chills. Four doses of a modified Liu Jun Zi Decoction provided slight improvement; then, by adding Baizhu and Fuling to Shixuan Powder in several doses, pus formed. After acupuncture, he was treated with a powder minus Fangfeng and Baizhi, and he eventually recovered.

A woman with inherently weak spleen qi suffered from a toxic condition with no pus formation, experiencing chills, fever, and vomiting. Two doses of Buhuajinqi San stopped the symptoms; six doses of Tuo Li San allowed for discharge; subsequently, she was treated with spleen-nourishing medicinal herbs to consolidate her recovery.

A man who felt thirsty and wanted to expel pus was treated with a modified Liu Wei Di Huang Wan, which led to resolution.

A man suffered from cerebral pyogenic fever with a rapid and weak pulse. He was treated with a previous formula. Doubting the treatment, he took Yin-nourishing herbs himself, which led to his demise.

One man drank several bowls of water daily, even in winter, and boasted of his vitality. Later, he developed sores in his mouth and believed he could treat himself with the previous formula. He thought it was wrong, then took fluid-generating medications, but his thirst could not be quelled, resulting in a back abscess that led to his death.

Another man developed a sore on the top of his foot and felt thirsty after recovering. He was treated with the previous formula and healed. The modified Bawei Wan is an excellent remedy for yin deficiency and fire activation; in cases like this, why abandon it?[583p]

　　一富商禀赋颇厚，素作渴，日饮水数碗。面发一毒，用消毒药溃而虽愈，尺脉尚数，渴亦不止。时孟秋，余谓心火，难免疽毒之患，须服加减八味丸，以补肾水。彼不信，至夏果脚背发疽，脉数，重按之则濇而无力，此水涸火旺之脉也，足竟黑腐而死。
　　一男子禀颇实，乏嗣，服附子等药致作渴，左足大指患疽，色紫不痛，脉亦数而濇，亦死。大抵发背脑疽脱疽，肿痛色赤，水衰火旺之色，尚可治；若黑若紫，火极似水之象也，乃肾水已竭，精气已涸，决不治。
　　又一贵人病疽疾，未安而渴作，一日饮水数升，愚遂献加减八味丸方。诸医大笑云：此药若能止渴，我辈当不复业医矣。乃用木瓜、紫苏、乌梅、人参、茯苓、百药煎等生津液之药止之而渴愈甚，数剂之后，茫无功效，不得已而用此，服之三日，渴止。因此相信，遂久服，不特渴疾不作，血气亦壮，饮食加倍，强健过于少壮之年。盖用此药，非余敢自执鄙见，实有源流。[584p]

A wealthy merchant had a considerable disposition and was persistently thirsty, drinking several bowls of water daily. He developed a boil on his face; though he treated it with disinfectant and healed, his pulse remained rapid, and the thirst did not cease. It was early autumn when I suggested that it was due to heart fire, predicting unavoidable issues arising from the boil and advised him to take the modified Eight Flavor Pill to supplement his kidney water. He did not believe me, and by summer, a boil appeared on the back of his foot. His pulse was rapid, and when pressed, it felt weak and without strength; this indicated a pulse of dry water and excessive fire, leading eventually to black necrosis, resulting in death.

A man of substantial build, lacking descendants, took aconite and other medicines that caused thirst. He developed a boil on the big toe of his left foot, which was purple and painless; his pulse was also rapid and weak, and he died. Generally, if boils occur on the back or brain, showing swelling, pain, and redness, with a pulse indicative of diminished water and excessive fire, it may still be treated; however, if the color is black or purple, indicating extreme fire resembling lack of water, it means the kidney water has been depleted, and vital essence has dried up—there is no possibility of cure.

Another nobleman suffered from an illness with boils and was thirsty without relief, drinking several liters of water daily. I foolishly offered the modified Eight Flavor Pill. Other physicians laughed, saying, "If this medicine can quench thirst, we might as well abandon our practice." Instead, they used remedies like papaya, perilla, dried plum, ginseng, poria, and various herbs to produce body fluids, but the thirst only intensified. After several doses without effect, they had no choice but to use my suggestion, and after three days, the thirst ceased. Thus, they came to believe in it, and continued its use; not only did the thirst not return, but his blood and qi strengthened, allowing for increased appetite and vitality, even surpassing his youth. It was not merely my opinion; there is indeed a valid source for this treatment.[584p]

自为儿时，闻先君云：有一士夫病渴疾，诸医皆用渴药，治疗累载不安，有一名医诊之，使服加减八味丸，不半载而疾痊。因疏其病源。今医者治痈，却以生津液止渴之药，误矣！其疾本起于肾水枯竭，不复上润，是以心火上炎，不能既济，煎熬而生渴，今服八味丸，降其心火，生其肾水，则渴自止矣。复疏其药性，云内北五味子最为得力，此一味独能生肾水，平补降心火，大有功效。家藏此方，亲用有验，故敢详着之，使有渴疾者信其言，专志服饵取效，无为庸医所惑，庶广前人之志。如臂痛、脚气、风气，四肢拘挛，上气眼运，肺气喘嗽，消食利小便，久服轻身，聪明耳目，令人光泽多子。[585p]

Since my childhood, I have heard my late father say: There was once a scholar who suffered from a debilitating thirst, and all the doctors treated him with thirst-quenching medicines, yet his condition remained unstable for many years. A famous physician then diagnosed him and prescribed the adjusted Eight Flavor Pill, and within half a year, he was cured. This led to an understanding of the source of his illness.

Now, when doctors treat sores, they mistakenly use medicines that generate body fluids to stop the thirst. This is an error! The root of the illness originated from the depletion of kidney water, which no longer provides moisture upward, leading to a fiery heart that burns upward, causing thirst from boiling. Taking the Eight Flavor Pill alleviates the heart fire and replenishes the kidney water, thus quenching the thirst.

Furthermore, analyzing the properties of the medicine, it is said that within the Five Flavors, the north flavor is the most effective. This single ingredient can uniquely nourish kidney water and harmonize heart fire, yielding significant results. Our family has this formula stored away and through personal use, it has proven effective, hence I dare to lay it out in detail, so that those who suffer from thirst may trust its efficacy, focus on taking the medicine to achieve results, and not be misled by incompetent doctors, hopefully broadening the intent of those before us.

Conditions such as arm pain, leg swelling, wind ailments, muscle cramps, shortness of breath, lung issues like cough and asthma, improved digestion, promoting urination, prolonged use leads to lightness in the body, enhanced clarity of hearing and sight, and promotes vitality and fertility.[585p]

　　一妇人面患毒，焮痛发热作渴，脉数，按之则实，以凉膈散二剂少愈；以消毒药数剂而平。
　　一男子肩患疽作渴，脉数有力，以黄连解毒汤三剂而止；更以仙方活命饮四剂溃而愈。
　　一男子患毒作渴，右关脉数，以竹叶黄芪汤治之少愈；更以补中益气汤加黄芩而愈。
　　一人年三十，面患疮，已溃作渴，自服托里及降火药不应。余诊其脉，浮而弱。丹溪云：溃疡作渴属气血俱虚，况脉浮虚？投以参、芪各三钱，归、朮、熟地各二钱，数服渴止；又以八珍汤加黄芪数剂，脉敛而愈。余治疮疡作渴，不问肿溃，但脉数发热而渴，以竹叶黄芪汤治之。脉不数，不发热，或脉数无力而渴，或口干，以补中益气汤。若脉数而便秘，以清凉饮。尺脉洪大，按之无力而渴，以加减八味丸并效。若治口燥舌黄，饮水不歇，此丸尤妙。[586p]

A woman suffered from toxicity, experiencing pain, fever, and thirst, with a rapid pulse that was strong upon palpation. After taking two doses of Liangge San, she improved slightly; then several doses of detoxifying medicine brought her back to normal.

A man with a shoulder abscess experienced thirst, and his rapid pulse was strong. Three doses of Huanglian Jiedu Decoction alleviated his condition; subsequently, four doses of Xianfang Huoming Decoction led to resolution of his symptoms.

Another man showed signs of toxicity and thirst, with a rapid pulse at the right wrist. He was treated with Zhuye Huangqi Decoction, resulting in slight improvement; later, he was given Buzhong Yiqi Decoction with added Huangqin, leading to his recovery.

A thirty-year-old man had sores on his face that had already ulcerated and caused thirst. He self-medicated with expelling and cooling medicines but found no relief. Upon examining his pulse, it was floating and weak. Dan Xi said: “Ulceration and thirst are due to both qi and blood deficiency, especially with a floating and weak pulse.” I prescribed three qian each of Ren Shen and Huangqi, and two qian each of Gui Zhi, Bai Zhu, and Shu Di. After several doses, his thirst diminished; I then added Huangqi to Ba Zhen Tang for several doses, which helped his pulse stabilize and he recovered.

In treating thirst related to sores or ulcers, I do not concern myself with swelling and suppuration, only with rapid pulse, fever, and thirst, thereby using Zhuye Huangqi Decoction. If the pulse is not rapid and there is no fever, or if the pulse is rapid but weak and the person feels thirsty or dry in the mouth, I use Buzhong Yiqi Decoction. If the pulse is rapid but the patient also has constipation, I administer a cooling drink. For a large, strong pulse with weakness on palpation and thirst, I use modified Bawei Wan, which is effective. For treating dry mouth and a yellow tongue, where drinking causes no relief, this pill is particularly marvelous.[586p]

　　一男子患痈，未作脓，焮痛烦躁，便闭脉实，以内疏黄连汤二剂，诸证悉退；以四物加芩连四剂而消。
　　一男子溃后便濇，脉浮，按之则濇，以八珍汤加红花、桃仁、陈皮、杏仁，治之而愈。
　　一弱人溃后，便秘而脉濇，以四物汤加红花、桃仁、黄芪，治之而愈。
　　一男子溃后便秘而脉浮，以四君子汤加陈皮、杏仁、当归，治之而愈。
　　一老人溃后，大便秘，小便赤濇，诊之脉浮数而濇，以八珍汤加黄蘗、知母治之而已愈，后小便复数而赤，大便秘，口干目花，以加减八味丸滋肾丸治之而愈。此证乃阴血虚，阳火盛，故用前药有效。向投苦寒之剂，必致有悞矣。[587p]

A man suffered from a boil that had not yet formed pus, experiencing pain and agitation, with a full pulse. I administered two doses of a decoction with Huang Lian, which alleviated all symptoms; then I used Si Wu Decoction with added Qin and Lian for four doses, and the boil subsided.

A man with a rupture experienced constipation, his pulse was floating, and upon palpation, it felt empty. I treated him with Ba Zhen Decoction augmented with Hong Hua, Tao Ren, Chen Pi, and Xing Ren, resulting in recovery.

A weak man with a rupture faced constipation and an empty pulse. I treated him with Si Wu Decoction plus Hong Hua, Tao Ren, and Huang Qi, and he recovered.

A man with a rupture exhibited constipation and a floating pulse. I used Si Jun Zi Decoction augmented with Chen Pi, Xing Ren, and Dang Gui, leading to his recovery.

An elderly man with a rupture suffered from severe constipation and reddish, scanty urination. Upon diagnosis, his pulse was floating, rapid, and empty. I administered Ba Zhen Decoction with added Huang Bo and Zhi Mu, leading to significant improvement. However, later, his urination became frequent and red, with continued constipation, dry mouth, and blurred vision. I treated him with a modified Ba Wei Pills to nourish the kidneys, resulting in recovery. This case represented a deficiency of Yin blood and excess of Yang fire, hence the usefulness of the previously prescribed medicine. If bitter and cold medicines had been administered, there would certainly have been adverse effects.[587p]

　　一男子溃后，便濇肌肤作痒，余以气血虚不能营于腠理，用补剂治之。彼不信，乃服风药，以致不救。大抵疮疡始作，便秘脉数而濇者，宜降火凉血为主，溃后便秘脉濇者，宜补血气为主。若投风药，祸在反掌。
　　举人于廷器腿患多骨疽年余，出腐骨少许，午前畏寒，午后发热，口干唾痰涎，便频数，余以为足三阴亏损，朝用补中益气汤，暮用八味丸加黄芪、当归、五味子各三十余剂，外用敷药，诸证渐愈；又以十全大补之类，喜其慎疾而愈。
　　一男子上腭肿硬，年余方溃，内热作渴，肢体消瘦，六脉洪大，左手尤甚，用补中益气汤、六味丸，出腐骨一块；仍服前药，诸证悉去，疮口亦敛。
　　一妇人年三十余，素弱，左手背渐肿，二年后溃出清脓，肿黯连臂，内热晡热，自汗盗汗，经水两月一至，此肝脾气血亏损，朝用归脾汤，夕用逍遥散，肿处频用葱熨法，两月余诸证渐愈，疮出腐骨；仍服前药，前后共三百余剂得愈。[588p]

A man experienced a skin itch after an outbreak, which I attributed to a deficiency in qi and blood that couldn’t nourish the pores. I treated him with tonics. He did not believe and instead took remedies for wind, resulting in no improvement. Generally, when sores first appear with a weak pulse and itchiness, the focus should be on reducing fire and cooling the blood. After the onset, if the pulse remains weak, the focus should be on replenishing blood and qi. Resorting to wind medications can lead to calamity.

A scholar suffered from many bone ulcers in his leg for over a year, expelling some necrotic bone. He felt cold before noon and had fever in the afternoon, with dry mouth and phlegm, frequent urination. I believed this to be due to a deficiency in the three yin of the foot. I administered a formula to tonify middle qi in the morning and the Eight Ingredients Pill with added Astragalus, Angelica, and Schisandra in the evening, giving over thirty doses. I also applied external medications, and he gradually improved; he particularly liked the restorative formulas.

A man had a swollen and hardened palate for over a year before it ulcerated. He experienced internal heat leading to thirst and significant weight loss; the pulses were strong, especially on the left side. I used the same tonifying middle qi formula along with a Six-Flavor Pill, which expelled a piece of necrotic bone. Continuing with the previous medications, all symptoms resolved, and the ulcer closed.

A woman over thirty, previously weak, gradually had swelling on the back of her left hand. After two years, it ulcerated with clear pus, the swelling darkened and extended to her arm. She suffered from internal heat with afternoon fevers, spontaneous and night sweats, and menstruation occurring every two months. This indicated a deficiency in liver and spleen qi and blood. I administered a formula to replenish the spleen in the morning and a soothing formula in the evening, frequently applying a scallion poultice to the swollen area. After two months, symptoms gradually improved, and necrotic bone was expelled from the ulcer. She continued with the previous medicines, totaling over three hundred doses until recovery.[588p]

　　一妇左手指患疔，麻痒，寒热恶心，左半体皆麻，脉数不时见。曰：凡疮不宜不痛，不可大痛；烦闷者不治。今作麻痒，尤其恶也，用夺命丹二服不应；又用解毒之剂，麻痒始去，乃作肿痛。余曰︰势虽危，所喜作痛，但毒气无从而泄，乃针之，诸证顿退；又用解毒之剂而瘥。
　　苏庠盛厚博掌后患疔，红丝至腕，恶寒发热，势属表证，与夺命丹一服，红丝顿消；又用和解之剂，大势已退。彼又服败毒药，发渴发热，红丝仍见，脉浮大而虚，此气血受伤而然，以补中益气汤主之而愈。盖夺命既服，疮邪已散，而复用败毒之剂，是诛伐无过，失《内经》之旨矣。
　　一儒者患疔，元气素弱，余补其气血，出脓而愈。后因劳役，疮痕作痒，乃别服败毒散一剂，以致口噤舌强，手足搐搦，痰涎上涌，自汗不止。此气血复伤而致痉也。用十全大补加附子一钱，灌服而苏。[589p]

A woman had a painful carbuncle on her left hand, experiencing itching, chills, fever, and nausea, with her left side becoming numb, and her pulse was rapid but intermittent. She reported that generally, sores should not be painless, and excessive pain is not advisable; if one feels anxious or distressed, treatment should not be given. Now she had itching, which was especially troubling; two doses of a life-rescue pill had no effect. Afterward, detoxifying agents were used, and the itching began to dissipate, but swelling and pain emerged. I said: Although the situation seems dire, the fact that she experienced pain is fortunate; however, the toxic energy had nowhere to escape, so I used acupuncture, and all symptoms quickly retreated. Then another detoxifying agent was used, leading to recovery.

Su Xiang was robust but had a serious carbuncle on his back, with red streaks reaching his wrist, experiencing chills and fever, indicative of a surface condition. After taking a dose of the life-rescue pill, the red streaks quickly disappeared. Another harmonizing remedy was administered, significantly alleviating the symptoms. However, he then took a detoxifying herb, which caused thirst and fever, and the red streaks reemerged. His pulse was floating, large, and weak; this signaled an injury to his qi and blood, which was then treated with a restorative potion, and he recovered. It appears that after taking the life-rescue pill, the pathogenic energy of the sore had dispersed, yet taking the detoxifying agent again was unnecessary, deviating from the principles in the "Inner Canon."

A scholar had a carbuncle and his original qi was weak. I supplemented his qi and blood, leading to pus discharge and recovery. Later, due to overexertion, the scar began to itch, and he took a dose of detoxifying powder which resulted in a locked jaw and rigid tongue, with involuntary spasms in his hands and feet, accompanied by an uncontrollable flow of saliva. This was due to further injury to his qi and blood, leading to spasms. I prescribed a comprehensive restorative formula with an added amount of aconite, which he took, and he revived.[589p]

　　一男子患疔，服夺命汤，汗不止，疮不痛，热不止，便不利，此汗多亡阳而真气伤矣，用参、芪、归、朮、芍、防、五味二剂，诸证悉退，惟以小便不利为忧。余曰：汗出故小便不利，汗止则阳气复而自利矣。仍用前药去防风加麦冬，倍用黄芩、当归，四剂而小便利，疮溃而愈。
　　表甥居富，右手小指患疔色紫，或云小疮，针刺出血，敷以凉药，掌指肿三四倍，黯而不痛，神思昏愦，烦躁不宁，此真气夺而邪气实也，先以夺命丹一服，活命饮二剂，稍可。余因他往，或遍刺其手，出鲜血碗许，肿延臂腕，焮大如瓠，手指肿数倍，不能溃。余用大剂参、芪、归、朮之类，及频灸遍手而肿渐消。但大便不实，时常泄气，此元气下陷，以补中益气加骨脂、肉蔻、吴茱萸、五味，大便实而气不泄；又日以人参五钱，麦冬三钱，五味二钱，水煎代茶饮之；又用大补药五十余剂而渐愈。此证初若不用解毒之剂，后不用大补之剂，欲生也难矣！[590p]

A man suffered from a carbuncle and took a lethal potion, leading to continuous sweating. The sore did not hurt, the fever persisted, and he experienced difficulty with urination. The excessive sweating depleted yang energy and harmed the vital energy. I prescribed two formulas containing ginseng, astragalus, angelica, atractylodes, peony,防风 (notable herb), and five-flavored herbs, after which all symptoms retreated, but there was still concern about the difficulty urinating. I said: "The reason for the difficulty is the excessive sweating; once the sweating stops, yang energy will recover and urination will resume." I continued with the previous herbs, removed 防风, added ophiopogon, and doubled the dosage of scutellaria and angelica. After four doses, urination became easier, and the sore healed.

My cousin, who lives in wealth, had a purple carbuncle on his right little finger, which some called a small sore. After puncturing it to draw blood and applying a cool medicine, his palm and finger swelled three to four times, darkened, and did not hurt. His mind became dulled, and he was restless, indicating a drain of vital energy and an accumulation of evil qi. I first gave him one dose of lethal dan and two doses of a life-saving drink, which helped slightly. Later, I punctured his hand all over, drawing enough fresh blood to fill a bowl, but the swelling extended to his arm and wrist, appearing as large as a gourd, with the fingers swelling several times, making it unable to drain. I used a large dose of ginseng, astragalus, angelica, and atractylodes, and frequently moxibustion on the hand, which gradually reduced the swelling. However, he had difficulty with bowel movements and often experienced a loss of gas, indicating that the vital energy was sinking. To restore it, I added dried succory, nutmeg, evodia, and five-flavored herbs to the formula to solidify his stool. I also prescribed an infusion of ginseng (five qian), ophiopogon (three qian), and five-flavored herbs (two qian) as a substitute for tea. Additionally, I applied over fifty doses of tonifying medicine, and he gradually recovered. If this condition had initially not been treated with detoxifying agents, and subsequently not with strong tonics, it would have been difficult for him to survive![590p]

　　一人年二十，唇患疔四日矣，有紫脉自疮廷至口内，将及于喉。余曰：此真气虚而邪气实也，若紫脉过喉则难治矣！须针紫脉并疮头出恶血以泄其毒则可。乃别用解毒之剂，头面俱肿，求治甚笃。余曰：前日之言不诬矣！诊其脉洪数，按之如无，口中肿胀，针不能入，为砭面与唇，出黑血碗许，势虽少退，略进汤水，终至不起。
　　都宪张恒山左足指患疔，痛不可忍，急隔蒜灸三十余壮，即能行步。欲速愈，或用凉药敷贴，遂致血凝肉死，毒气复炽。再灸百壮，服活命饮，出紫血，毒才得解。脚底通溃，腐筋烂肉甚多，将愈，误用生肌药，反助其毒，元气亏损而不能愈。余治以托里药，喜其禀实，客处三月余方愈。大凡疔患于肢节，灸法有回生之功。设投以凉剂，收敛腠理，隧道壅塞，邪气愈甚，多致不起。若毒未尽，骤用生肌，轻者反增溃烂，重者必致危亡。[591p]

A twenty-year-old person has had a lip sore for four days, with a purple vein leading from the sore to the mouth, nearing the throat. I said: This is a case of true Qi being deficient while evil Qi is strong. If the purple vein reaches the throat, it will be difficult to treat! It is necessary to needle the purple vein and the sore to draw out bad blood to release its poison. Additionally, I used an antidote, but both the head and face became swollen, and the patient sought treatment urgently. I said: My previous words were not mistaken! Upon examining the pulse, it was flood-like and rapid, yet when pressed, felt faint; the mouth was swollen and the needle could not penetrate. I used a stone to scrape the face and lip, drawing out a bowl's worth of black blood. Although the condition slightly improved, after a bit of broth, the patient ultimately did not recover.

The prefect Zhang Hengshan had a sore on the left toe that was unbearably painful. In a hurry, he applied thirty or so clove garlic moxibustion, and he could walk. Wanting a quick recovery, he applied cool medicines, which resulted in blood coagulating and flesh dying, with the toxic air becoming more intense. After moxibusting a hundred times and taking a life-saving drink, purple blood was expelled, and the poison was finally relieved. The bottom of his foot began to fester, with substantial decayed tendons and rotten flesh. He was about to heal when he mistakenly used a flesh-regenerating medicine, which exacerbated the poison, depleting his vital energy and preventing recovery. I treated him with a purging medicine because I was pleased with his constitution, and after over three months in a guest place, he finally healed. Generally, sores on the limbs can benefit from moxibustion methods that have rejuvenating effects. If cool medicines are used, they constrict the pores, block the pathways, and increase the evil Qi, often leading to failure to recover. If the poison is not fully resolved and flesh-regenerating medicines are abruptly used, it can lightly worsen the ulcer or, in severe cases, lead to life-threatening situations.[591p]

　　一男子足指患疔，肿焮痛赤，用隔蒜灸、人参败毒散加金银花、白芷、大黄二剂痛止；又用十宣散加天花粉、金银花去桂，数剂而愈。
　　一男子足患疔疮作痒，恶心呕吐，时发昏乱，脉浮数，明灸二十余壮，始痛；以夺命丹一服肿起；更以荆防败毒散而愈。
　　一男子患疔，发热烦躁，脉实，以清凉饮下之而愈。
　　一男子胸患疔，遍身麻木，脉数而实，急针出恶血，更明灸数壮始痛；服防风通圣散得利而愈。
　　一男子左手背患疔，当日一臂麻木，次日半体皆然，神思昏愦，遂明灸至二十余壮，尚不知痛；又三十余壮始不麻，至百壮始痛；以夺命丹一服，肿始起；更用神异膏及荆防败毒散而愈。[592p]

A man suffered from a boil on his toe, which was swollen, painful, and red. He applied a garlic poultice and used a formula combining ginseng, a detoxifying powder, honeysuckle, white angelica, and rhubarb, which relieved the pain; he also used a formula combining ten ingredients with tianhuafen and honeysuckle, omitting cinnamon, and recovered after several doses.

A man experienced a boil that caused itching, nausea, and vomiting, accompanied by intermittent dizziness. His pulse was floating and rapid. After receiving over twenty acupuncture treatments, pain began; a dose of a deadly pill caused swelling; he then took a formula with schizopeptic and detoxifying properties and recovered.

Another man had a boil resulting in fever and irritability, with a firm pulse; he was cured after taking a cooling drink.

A man had a boil in his chest, resulting in numbness throughout his body. His pulse was rapid and strong. Emergency acupuncture was performed to release bad blood, and after several rounds of moxibustion, pain began; he took a formula with the wind-cold dispelling properties and recovered.

A man had a boil on the back of his left hand. That day, his arm became numb, and the next day, half of his body experienced the same; he felt confused. He underwent over twenty moxibustion treatments but still felt no pain; after thirty treatments, the numbness ceased, and pain began after a hundred treatments. A dose of a deadly pill caused swelling; he then used a miraculous ointment and a detoxifying powder to recover.[592p]

　　一老妇足大指患疔甚痛，令灸之，彼不从，专服败毒散，致真气虚而邪气愈实，竟至不救。盖败毒散虽能表散疮毒，然而所感有表里，所发有轻重，体段有上下，所禀有虚实，岂可一概而用之耶？且至阴之下，药力难到，专假药力则缓不及事，不若灸之为良。故下部患疮，皆宜隔蒜灸之，痛则灸至不痛，不痛则灸至痛。若灸之而不痛者，宜明灸之，及针疔四畔，去恶血，以夺命丹一粒入疮头孔内，仍以膏药贴之。若针之不痛，或无血者，以针烧赤频烙患处，以痛为度。或不痛，眼黑如见火光者，此毒气入脏腑也，不治。若患在手足，红丝攻心腹者，就于丝尽处刺去恶血，宜服荆防败毒散。若丝近心腹者，宜挑破疮头去恶水，亦以膏药贴之。如麻木者，服夺命丹。如牙关繁急，或喉内患者，并宜噙一二丸。凡人暴死，多是疔毒，用灯照看遍身，若有小疮，即是，宜急灸之，俟醒更服败毒药或夺命丹。人汗入肉，食之则生疔疮，不可不慎！[593p]

An elderly woman suffered from severe pain in her big toe due to a boil and requested cauterization, but the person refused and only took a powdered remedy for detoxification, which led to a deficiency in genuine qi and an increase in evil qi, ultimately resulting in her demise. Though the powdered remedy can disperse the poison from superficial sores, ailments affect both the exterior and interior, vary in severity, and have different characteristics of excess and deficiency. Thus, it is inappropriate to use one treatment universally. Furthermore, at the extreme depths, medicinal power is hard to reach, and relying solely on medicine is often inadequate; cauterization would be a better approach. Therefore, for boils in the lower body, they should be treated with garlic-based cauterization: if painful, cauterize to the point of no pain; if not painful, cauterize until pain arises. If cauterization follows and there is still no pain, one should use bright cauterization and needle the areas around the boil to remove stagnant blood, placing a life-saving pill inside the boil and applying an herbal plaster. If the needle causes no pain or there’s no blood, one should heat the needle until red and repeatedly apply it to the affected area, using the degree of pain as the measure. If there is no pain and one sees a blackness like firelight, this indicates that toxic qi has entered the organs, which is untreatable. If the boil is on the hands or feet, with red threads indicating an attack on the heart and abdomen, one should prick until the stagnant blood is removed, and it’s advisable to take a remedy for detoxification. If the thread approaches the heart or abdomen, one should puncture the boil head to release the foul fluid, applying an herbal plaster afterwards. If there is numbness, one should take a life-saving pill. If the jaws are tightly clenched or there are throat ailments, one should hold one or two pills in the mouth. Sudden deaths in people are often due to boil toxins; one should examine the entire body with a lamp, and if any small sores are found, they should be promptly cauterized, followed by the intake of detoxification medicine or life-saving pills upon recovery. If a person sweats into the flesh and subsequently consumes food, they may develop boils; caution is necessary![593p]

　　《外科正宗》曰︰一监生右颧下生疔，三日形如鱼目，询问起居，但麻痒不常，此即肺经受毒之证也，用针刺入四五分，其硬如骨有声；随用蟾酥条插至三日，犹不腐化。此坚顽结聚之病，药力不及，换用三品一条槍，插至七日，外用糊纸封盖，至十一日脱出疔根一块，约有指许；以长肉玉红膏渐搽惭长；先服托里消毒散加金银花二钱、白芷五分；脱后用八珍汤加天花粉、麦冬、黄芪、陈皮各一钱，调理月余；候疮生肉已平，用珍珠散掺上，结皮而愈。[594p]

The "Authentic Text on Surgery" states: A student had a boil develop under the right cheekbone. For three days, it appeared like a fish eye, and when asked about his condition, he felt only slight itchiness, not constant pain. This indicates a toxicity in the lung meridian. A needle was inserted four to five tenths of an inch deep; it was as hard as bone and made a sound. Subsequently, toad venom strips were applied for three days, yet it did not decompose. This is a case of a stubborn and firm mass; the medicinal power was insufficient, so a three-ranked needle was used, inserted for seven days, and covered with a paper plaster. On the eleventh day, a chunk of the boil root came out, about the size of a finger. A nourishing ointment made of meat and jade red balm was gradually applied. Initially, a detoxifying powder with two qian of honeysuckle and five fen of angelica was taken. After the boil was expelled, a mixture of the Eight Treasures Decoction with one qian each of Trichosanthes fruit, Ophiopogon, Astragalus, and dried tangerine peel was used for over a month to adjust the body. Once the wound had healed and flesh had grown back smoothly, pearl powder was sprinkled on it, allowing it to form a scab and heal.[594p]

　　一监生中年丧妻，继娶幼室，乃娇态人也，自服补肾助阳之药，以致肾水受伤，不能上制心火，左颧发生一泡，先紫后黑，麻木不知痛痒。凡黑者肾经之毒也，其毒不浅。且喜疮之四边，尚未走散，此犹可取，随用针刺疔上。量别药不济其事，用冰蛳散厚糊作条，插入患孔，用糊纸密封，勿令泄气。朝服加减八味丸以滋肾水，午服益气养荣汤接补真气以滋不足，晚用琥珀蜡矾丸护心解毒，候至十一日外，疔根与药结成一块，依期脱落。次用生肌敛口，补助调理脾胃之剂，二十日而愈。后因其不慎调理，失于保节，几及三年，复成虚损痨瘵而殁。[595p]

A man of middle age lost his wife and remarried a young woman who was spoiled and delicate. He took medicine to tonify his kidneys and assist yang, which led to harm to his kidney water, unable to regulate the heart fire. A blister appeared on his left cheekbone, first purple then black, numb without pain or itch. All that is black is the poison of the kidney channel, and its toxicity is not mild. Fortunately, the edges of the sore had not dispersed, which was still manageable; he used needles to puncture the sore. Other remedies were ineffective, so a thick paste made from ice and shells was inserted into the affected area and sealed tightly with paper to prevent air leakage. In the morning, he took a modified Eight Flavor Pill to nourish kidney water, at noon a tonic to enhance qi and enrich vitality to restore essence, and in the evening he used a pill of amber, wax, and alum to protect the heart and detoxify. On the eleventh day, the root of the sore combined with the medicine and fell off as scheduled. Next, he used a remedy to promote skin regeneration and aid in adjusting the spleen and stomach, fully recovering in twenty days. However, due to careless management and failure to maintain his health, nearly three years later, he again developed weakness and consumption, which led to his death.[595p]

　　一妇人年近四旬，夫主不和，愁郁种种，抱怀不散，时值季夏，岁荒之极，腮发一疔，六日后方延余视。其时疔毒已经走散，头目唇项俱肿，形色紫赤。余曰：肉肿疮不肿，疔毒走黄，不治之证。彼妇流涕叹曰：一家皆绝也！余问曰：何其如此？妇又曰︰吾夫乃不肖之人。妇有一女二子，俱未适配，设若妇死，寄托于夫，子女日后必为流荡辈也。故妇在－家生，妇逝一家死，自然之理。余时闻之，沉吟不已，如此何以得生？不忍弃之。况此疮势大，又非药力可回。[596p]

A woman nearing her forties had a discordant marriage, troubled by various worries that lingered in her heart. It was the height of summer, while the year suffered great famine. She developed a carbuncle on her cheek, which only became visible six days later. By that time, the poison had already spread; her head, eyes, lips, and neck were all swollen, and her complexion was purple-red. I said: "The flesh is not swollen due to a wound; the poison is turning yellow; this is a case of neglect." The woman lamented, shedding tears, saying: "My whole family is doomed!" I asked: "Why is that?" She replied: "My husband is a worthless man. I have one daughter and two sons, all of whom are unmarried. If I were to die, the children would be left to him; they would surely become drifters in the future. Thus, if the woman lives, the family survives; if she dies, the family perishes; it's the natural order of things." Hearing this, I pondered deeply and wondered how she could survive. I could not bear to abandon her. Moreover, the condition of her wound was severe and beyond the power of medicine to heal.[596p]

思之，当先雇一贫人，以饭餐饱，再用火酒数杯，随用针刺肿上十余处，令彼噙吸恶血数碗，将温汤洗净，用蟾酥锭磨浓涂之，四围敷金黄散，早晚二次；内以护心散、蜡矾丸、清心护里，兼服降火化痰开郁安神之药调治，庶保不变。吸血之后，余肿稍退。至六日，因夫妻反目，复肿，比前尤甚，复用针刺其甚肿之上约十余处，出血三四碗，针孔上小膏盖贴，余肿仍敷。其人出血多而其内必虚，以人参养荣汤加香附、贝母服，数日后针口渐脓，余肿渐消，原疮处复得高肿，仍用蟾酥条插化，亦渐腐溃，外用生肌敛口，内服开郁和中养血健脾等剂，调理百日外方愈。此病设若相论疮势形色，则百无一生之理，此功出于勉强行之，亦得其生。后二子一女，相继婚配，其夫亦守其终，见今已六旬半矣。[597p]

It is my contemplation that one should first hire a poor person, feed them until satisfied, and then give them several cups of hot wine. Following this, needles should be used to prick over ten swollen areas, allowing them to suck out several bowls of bad blood. The area should then be washed with warm broth, and a concentrated paste made from toad venom should be applied. Golden powder should be sprinkled around, twice a day, morning and evening. Internally, one should use herbal formulas to protect the heart, along with medicated pills and calming remedies to reduce fire, transform phlegm, and relieve stagnation, in hopes of ensuring no transformation occurs.

After the blood is sucked out, the remaining swelling slightly decreases. On the sixth day, due to a quarrel between the couple, the swelling returns, worse than before. Needles should again be used to prick about ten areas of the most pronounced swelling, allowing three to four bowls of blood to be drawn. Small adhesive strips should cover the needle holes. The remaining swelling should still be treated.

The individual has lost a lot of blood, so they must be nourished. A restorative formula with ginseng should be supplemented with fragrant cyperus and fritillaria. After several days, the needle holes slowly produce pus, and the remaining swelling gradually diminishes. The original wound site becomes high and swollen again. The process of inserting toad venom should continue, and it too gradually becomes necrotic. Externally, promote healing of the wound and internally take remedies to relieve stagnation, harmonize the middle, nourish blood, and strengthen the spleen. Regulating these for a hundred days should eventually lead to recovery.

If this condition were to be assessed based on the appearance and color of the wounds, there would be virtually no hope for survival. However, through determined effort, life was sustained. Subsequently, the couple had two sons and one daughter, who married in succession. Their husband also held fast till the end, and it is said that they have now lived for over sixty years.[597p]

　　一妇人年二十二岁，右耳垂向前一寸生疔二日，请余视之。形有豆大，顶陷灰色，此肺经感毒发为白刃疔也。又验其根脚绵软，毒不结聚，为陷伏阴证也。未及针刺。伊舅曰：何恙也？余直告曰：疔疮证。彼听冷笑不信。余因辞不用药，随其信否。彼复请客医治之，视曰：风热疙瘩，乃小恙也。彼家告以某医曾曰是疔疮，医者点头而笑曰：此真胡说！患家喜悦。天下事大相悬绝。医用消风散二服，毒气全收，随发昏愦喘急而死。[598p]

A woman, twenty-two years old, had a sore on her right ear that had protruded forward by an inch for two days. She asked me to examine it. The sore was the size of a mung bean, with a grayish depressed center; this was a case of abscess caused by toxins affecting the lung meridian. Upon further examination, I found that the base was soft and lacking consolidation, indicating a hidden condition of yin deficiency. Before I could perform acupuncture, her uncle asked what was wrong. I told him directly that it was an abscess. He laughed coldly and did not believe me. Consequently, I declined to use medicine, leaving it to their belief. They then sought another physician, who examined her and said it was a wind-heat skin lump, merely a minor ailment. The family then reported that another doctor had previously said it was an abscess, to which the physician nodded and laughed, saying, "This is truly nonsense!" The family was pleased. In the end, the patient received a prescription for a wind-dispelling powder, which completely absorbed the toxic qi, resulting in her sudden confusion, breathlessness, and ultimately death.[598p]

　　一年少妇颧下生疔，疙瘩作痒。余欲针之，彼家不信。辞后自灸，次日四边渐肿，疮渐软陷；又三日头面大肿，复请治之。余观原疮灸上已结黑靥，干陷无脓，此毒气内陷，外肉已死；又面目浮肿，光亮发热，形状不堪，此正气衰而邪气实也，虽治亦不效，后必终死。彼家方悔。后延半月果殁。
　　一男子上腭肿痛月余，以散风清热药，俱已不效。又两月破流血水，百日外方出细骨，大小三十余块。以十全大补汤并吹生肌散，两月余而敛。中存一小孔，簪脚大，通鼻透气，致难全敛，为愈而不愈也。[599p]

A young woman had a sore under her cheekbone for a year, which caused itching. I wanted to treat it with needles, but her family did not believe me. After I left, she applied moxibustion herself. The next day, the area around the sore began to swell gradually, and the sore became soft and depressed. After three more days, her face and head were extremely swollen, so she asked me to treat it again. I observed that the original sore had developed a black scab where the moxibustion was applied, and although it was dry and depressed, there was no pus. This indicated that the toxic energy had sunk in, and the flesh was already dead. Additionally, her face was puffy, shiny, and hot, looking distressed. This was a clear sign of weakened vital energy and strong pathogenic energy; even if treated, it would be ineffective, and she would inevitably die. Her family then regretted it. After half a month, she indeed passed away.

A man had swelling and pain in his palate for over a month, and treatment with herbs to dispel wind and clear heat proved ineffective. After another two months, the sore broke open, bleeding a watery fluid, and over a hundred days, over thirty small bones emerged. I applied a nourishing decoction and a wound healing powder, and after more than two months, the sore began to close. However, there remained a small opening, the size of a hairpin, connecting to his nasal passage, which made it difficult for the sore to fully heal, leading to a situation where he did not recover completely.[599p]

　　一男子左手上髆结肿年余，方出烂斑，破流稀脓；延至半年，方出多骨一条，如鹅髆骨一样，长约四寸。内服养血健脾药，外搽玉红膏，又月余而敛。
　　一男子小腿正面臁骨肿痛二年，诸药不应，此多骨疮也。后破出骨一块，肌肉腐烂，元气虚弱，以十全大补汤加山茱萸、牛膝、木瓜，服至两月余不敛。每日以神灯照法，将火气助之，又出朽骨一块，上有蛀眼数十孔。以二骨炭火煅红为末，入生肌药中用之收敛。问曰：用骨者何？此骨原禀气血结成，故用之复还元气也。此理合天然之数矣。
　　一女人口左上牙根突肿如粟，坚硬如石，不痛，此多骨疽也，药亦不效。后三年始痛，破流臭脓，后出多骨，形如小鳖，肿仍不退，此骨未尽。稍久又出小骨二块，色枯峻嶒，其肿方退。以四君子汤加升麻、陈皮，外以甘草煎汤漱口，生肌散日搽三次而收敛。[600p]

A man had a swelling on his left hip for over a year, which eventually developed into a rotten patch that oozed thin pus. After six months, a bone-like growth appeared, resembling an eagle's hip bone and measuring about four inches long. He took herbs to nourish the blood and strengthen the spleen internally, and applied Yuhong ointment externally. After a little over a month, it began to heal.

Another man experienced swelling and pain in the front of his lower leg for two years, with various medicines proving ineffective; this was a case of multiple bone sores. Eventually, a piece of bone broke through, and the flesh became rotten, while his vital energy weakened. He was treated with a tonic soup of Shiquan Dabu, adding Shan Zhuyu, Niuxi, and Mu Guo, but after over two months, it showed no signs of healing. Each day, he used a spirit lamp to apply heat, which helped another piece of decayed bone break through, revealing dozens of small holes. He powdered the two pieces of bone over a red-hot fire and mixed it into a wound-healing medicine to aid in healing. When asked why bone was used, the answer was that the bone originally held the essence of vital energy and blood, which is why it was used to restore the vital energy. This principle aligns with the natural order.

A woman had a swelling at the root of her upper left tooth resembling a grain of millet, hard as stone and painless; this was a multiple bone sore, and medication was ineffective. After three years, it began to hurt, oozing foul pus, and later, numerous bone fragments emerged, resembling a small tortoise; the swelling persisted. After some time, two small bones emerged, marked by a dry and rugged appearance, and the swelling finally began to subside. She was treated with Si Jun Zi Tang with added Sheng Ma and Chen Pi, and rinsed her mouth with a licorice decoction, applying a wound-healing powder three times until it healed.[600p]

　　《寓意草》曰：黄鸿轩手臂忽生痈痛，漫肿无头，痛极莫耐，外科医者咸谓热毒所致。揆之平素，淡泊明志，宁静居心，绝无生热致毒之因，究莫识其所起也。尊公我兼谓昌善议病，盍舍樽俎而一代庖人乎？昌曰︰吾议此证，请先为致贺，后乃言之。疮疡之起，莫不有因：外因者天行不正之时毒也，起居传染之秽毒也；内因者，醇酒厚味之热毒也，郁怒横决之火毒也。治火毒与治诸毒，原自天渊。盖火与元气，势不两立，以寒凉折之，则元气转漓矣。鸿轩于四者总无其因，不问知为胎毒之余也。凡人禀受天地之气，有清浊之不同，惟纯粹以精之体，其福泽寿算，俱不可限量。然从父母构精而有身，未免夹杂欲火于形骸，所赖者惟在痘疮一举，暗将所藏欲火，运出躯外，复其粹精之恒体。如矿金相似，必经红炉煅炼，而渣滓与精莹始分之为两。[601p]

"The Meaningful Grass" states: Huang Hongxuan suddenly developed a painful abscess on his arm, swollen and without a head, causing extreme discomfort that was unbearable. All external doctors agreed it was caused by heat poison. Upon reflection, he was usually indifferent, clear-minded, and calm, having no factors contributing to heat and poison, thus he didn't know the origin of his affliction. I urged Mr. Zun to deliberate with Changshan on the illness, suggesting we set aside our wine and food to focus on remedying it. Chang replied: "Regarding this condition, let's first offer congratulations, then I will discuss it."

Every sore and ulcer has its cause: external causes include the toxic influences of improper weather and the infectious filth of daily rituals; internal causes involve the heat poison from rich wines and heavy flavors, or the fiery poison born from suppressed anger. The treatment of fire poison and all other poisons essentially originates from two extremes. Fire and vital energy cannot coexist; when cooled by coldness, vital energy dissipates. Hongxuan showed no signs of these causes, and thus failed to recognize it as leftover fetal poison.

Human beings inherit the vital energy of heaven and earth, differing in purity and turbidity; those possessing pure and refined essence can expect boundless fortune and longevity. However, having been conceived by parents, one's body inevitably carries a mix of desires and passions; what one relies on is the expulsion of that latent desire through eruptions like pox, thereby returning to the constancy of pure essence. Like mining gold, one must undergo the refining process in a red furnace, where impurities are separated from the pure shine.[601p]

吾尝以此法观出痘者之眸子，七八日后眼开之时，黑白分明者精金也，赤筋红膜包裹者混金也。至于瞳人模糊，神光不现，则全非金矣。鸿轩幼时出痘太多，元气不能充贯，又为杂证所妨，脏腑中之火毒虽尽，而躯壳间之留滞犹存，所以痘痈之发，必于手足之委中、曲池者，则以零星小毒无处可容，而潜避于呼吸难到之处耳。今之痈疖，正当委中之穴，其为痘毒何疑？毒伏肘腋之下，原无所害，但粹精之体，微有夹杂，是亦宝鉴之纤尘，白璧之微颣也。日者太和元气充满周身，将十五年前之余滓，尽欲化为脓血而出，他人见之为毒，吾早已卜其为兴者机矣。岂有畅于四肢而不发于事业者哉？治法，外用马齿苋熬膏攻之速破，内用保元汤托之尽出，仍以痘痈门药为治，即日自当痊愈，必不似疮毒之旷日持久。但不识证而以治疮毒寒凉泻火诸药投之，适以增楚贻患耳。孰谓外科小恙可无樽俎折冲之人耶？如法治之，溃出脓水甚多，果不用生肌长肉而自愈。
[602p]

I once observed the eyes of those who had developed smallpox using this method. After seven or eight days, when their eyes were opened, those with clear distinctions between black and white possessed pure essence, while those with red veins and a red membrane were mixed essence. As for those with blurry pupils and lacking the spirit's light, they were entirely devoid of essence. Hong Xuan had too many pox marks in his youth, which prevented his vital energy from being fully replenished. While the internal fire poison had been eliminated, stagnation within his body still remained; thus, the pox sores inevitably erupted in the areas of his hands and feet, particularly at the Qiuchu points, as scattered minor poisons had no place to reside and sought refuge in hard-to-reach areas. Today’s sores and abscesses appeared exactly at the Qiuchu acupoint, raising no doubt about the nature of the pox poison. The poison lurking under the elbows and armpits was harmless, but the pure body contained some impurities, which also constitute fine dust in a precious mirror, a slight blemish on a white jade. The day when the supreme harmony’s vital energy fills the entire body, it aims to expel all remnants from fifteen years past as pus and blood. Others may see this as poison, but I had long foreseen it as an opportunity for recovery. Is it plausible that one can be free-flowing in limbs yet not develop in vital matters? The treatment involves externally applying purslane gel for rapid breakdown, and internally using the Baoyuan Decoction to expel everything, while still employing the prescribed medication for pox and abscesses, ensuring prompt recovery, unlike the prolonged issues of sore poisons. However, if one fails to recognize the symptoms and indiscriminately administers cooling and poison-expelling medications, it simply amplifies the troubles. Who claims that minor external ailments can be dealt with without someone who understands how to negotiate effectively? If treated as prescribed, there will be a significant outflow of pus and water, and naturally, there is no need for wound healing and flesh growing treatments for spontaneous recovery.[602p]
